loans.name: Carlos

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia do mesmo nome, sul  de Moçambique, casado e pai de 4 filhos dos quais todos ainda frenquentam a Escola. Fez 6ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua mãe que vive com ele. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, trabalha como jardineiro na empresa de administração de águas fluviais (ARA-SUL) ha mais de 10 anos e tem um salario de 3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Já teve emprestimos  em outros bancos (CCoM) para construção da sua casa, o qual conseguiu pagar sem nenhumas dificuldades. Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 21.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção (areia, cimento, pedra, ferro  e outros) para aumentar a sua residencia.
Pretende solicitar mais valor para poder mobilar a sua casa para isso, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Carlos was born in Maputo, located in the province of the same name in southern Mozambique.  He is married and has 4 children, all of whom attend school.  He attended school through the 6th grade but dropped out due to a lack of financial resources.  He owns his own home where he lives with his family and his mother, whom he also supports.   

He has never left Maputo.  He has worked for the past 10 years as a gardener for the regional water authority (ARA-SUL).  He earns 3.000.00mt per month which he uses for household expenses and he saves a bit in his bank account.

He has had loans in other banks (CCoM) for construction of his home, which he was able to pay without any problems.  He learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also clients.  This is his fourth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 21.000.00mt, which he will use to purchase construction supplies (sand, cement, stones, iron, etc.) to expand his home.  He plans to request additional loans in order to furnish his home, and will request loans from Hluvuku to do this.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (sand, cement, stones, iron, etc.)

loans.name: Jesica

texts.en:
Jessica is 42 years old and lives in Tabo-o Jiminez Mis. Occ. She is married and blessed with four children. For the past year, Jessica has operated a sari-sari (general) store where she sells different kinds of basic products such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, soy sauce, food for snacks, and other items. Jessica's business is a great help to her family to sustain their daily needs. She earns PHP 4,000 PHP. Jessica joined GDMPC in 2009 and has been a cooperative member for two years. 

Jessica is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to purchase additional goods to sell in her general store like those mentioned above. She has a great plan for her future and for the family, and she wants to expand her business, increase her profit, and purchase a transport vehicle. 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. GDMPC is people empowering people.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Mihrubon

texts.ru: Михрубон жительница города Вахдат. Возраст, 48 лет. Она замужем. У нее 8 детей. Михрубон более 12 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Она арендует торговую точку, где продает фрукты. В торговле ей помогает ее муж. Она берет кредит для увеличения ассортимента своего товара. Целью получения кредита является покупка овощей для продажи.
texts.en: Mihrubon lives in the Vahdat district.  She is 48 years old, married and has 8 children.  Mihrubon has been involved in sales at the market for over 12 years.  She leases a retail outlet, where she sells fruits.  Her husband helps her with the sales.  Mihrubon is requesting this loan to expand her product assortment.  The goal of this loan is to purchase vegetables for sale.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for sale

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old, single and lives with two family members.

Since 2010, Ali is an owner of a store selling marble, ceramics and flagstones. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His store is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.
Ali decided to apply for $2400 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to add more inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to open a new store and to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to pay the annual rent and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina is 43 years old and is a housewife. Her husband is a musician who earns 3 USD per day. The couple has four children: one is studying, and the other three are working in a factory each earning 3 USD daily. Each month, Sina has to spend 47 USD on food, 10 USD on electricity, 10 USD on school fees, and 10 USD on other expenses.

Sina is requesting a 500 USD loan to buy materials to repair her house. She hopes to send her last child to study at the university so that he will have a good job in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase products such as oil, sweet potatoes, fish, rice, juice, and so on.

loans.name: Sitoma Group

texts.en:
Thomas is the facilitator of the Sitoma group. Thomas and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Thomas and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Thomas takes care of five children at home with his wife. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Thomas had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Thomas was only able to harvest three bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Thomas will educate his children and save for future use.

In 2012, the members of Sitoma group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photo above, Thomas and his group are holding maize cobs from the recent harvest!

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Abesamihigo C Group

texts.fr:
Sylvère fait partie du groupe Abesamihigo C. Le nom du groupe signifie « performers ». Il est né au Rwanda et il a 45 ans. Il est marié avec 5 enfants de 3 à 13 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 8 ans de primaire. 

Sylvère est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est la semence du riz sélectionné. Dans les prochaines années, Sylvère voudrait récolter une grande quantité de riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Sylvère is part of the group called Abesamihigo C. The name of the group means « performers ». He was born in Rwanda and he is 45. He is married with five children from 3 to 13 years old, of whom four are enrolled in school. His own educational level is eight years of primary school. 

Sylvère grows rice. This is his second loan through ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice crop. 

His strategy for growing his business is sowing special sorts of rice. In the coming years, Sylvère would like to grow a lot of rice. With the profit, he intends to educate and care for his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice crop.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Ribau, provincia de Nampula, norte  de Moçambique, casado e pai de 4 filhos que ainda frequentam a escola. Fez 12ª classe e naõ continuou devido ao serviço militar. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta os pais enviando dinheiro para auxiliar nas dispesas alimentares. 

Saiu da sua terra natal em missão de serviço, é militar ha mais de 29 anos e tem um saláario de 14.125.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Já teve emprestimos em outros bancos(BIM) e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu quinto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar material DE CONSTRUCAO DE UMA CASA HABITACIONAL (barrotes, areia, pedra, ferro, e outros.) para dar continuidade a sua obra.Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 13.000.00mt, 17.000.00mt, 7.000.00mt, e 16.000.00mt, para construção da casa.
Pretende solicitar mais valor para concluir a sua casa para oferecer mais conforto a sua familia, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Antonio was born in Ribau in the province of Nampula in northern Mozambique. He is married and the father of four children who are still in school. He went to school through the twelfth grade but dropped out to serve in the military. He and his family live in their own home, and he also supports his parents, sending money to help them pay for food.

He left Ribau for the military and has been a soldier for more than 29 years. He earns a salary of 14,125 meticals a month, with which he covers household expenses and is able to save a small amount in his bank account
He's had loans from other banks (BIM), which he paid off without any problems. He learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is his fifth loan with Kiva, in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which he will use to buy construction materials (rebar, sand, stone, iron, etc.) to continue work on his house. His first loans were in the amounts of 13,000, 17,000, 7,000, and 16,000 meticals, and he used them all to build his house.
He hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to finish his house so he can provide his family with a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (rebar, sand, stone, iron, etc.).

loans.name: Ya

texts.en:
Ya is 49 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Ya sells palm products, earning an income of 3 USD per day. His wife grows rice on her plot of farmland, earning an income of 1.5 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend 50 USD on food and 15 USD on other necessary expenses. 

Ya is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase more palm products and palm sugar to resell. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy palm products and palm sugar to sell

loans.name: Nadien

texts.en: Nadien is a 26-year-old young woman. She is married and has two sons and one daughter. She lives in Rafah City in Gaza, located in the Palestine. Nadien's family owns a grocery store which is the only source of income for them. She wants to purchase more groceries for the store so that there will be a better selection for sale, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for them, so she needs to take out a loan in the amount of $3,000 from FATEN. When Nadien gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to purchase more groceries and have a better selection for sale and thus share in increasing the family income and improving the family's standard of living. Nadien is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in the grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for the grocery store.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is married with four children. He is 36 years old and lives in Esperanza, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur. Edwin has been in his business for 7 years. He raises pigs for sale to earn a living. He earns 15,800 Philippine pesos (PHP) with this line of business. He has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase feed for his newborn piglets.

Edwin has been a member of GDMPC for one year. He is hoping to have his own motor cart or motorcycle that he can use to purchase feed and for the delivery of pigs to the buyer.

======================================

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC: people empowering people.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies

location.town: ESPERANZA, RAMON MAGSAYSAY, ZAMBOANA DEL SUR

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en: Sauda is 42 years old, divorced, with 5 children aged 14-21, renting a house in Hoima, Uganda. She has been selling second-hand shoes for 6 years and this has helped her in educating her children ever since her divorce. She faces the challenge of limited capital which adversely affects her business profits. Her dream is to trade wholesale. Sauda needs the loan to buy second-hand shoes for sale.

loans.use: to buy second-hand shoes for sale.

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo is 42 years old and married with 2 children. He earns a living through farming. Leo tills his own land located in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. He grows rice to sell to his community. Leo works hard to provide for his family's daily needs and his children's education.

Leo has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. He hopes to own a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en: Yeng, 34, resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Yeng produces plastic mats to sell, earning an income of USD 4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 44 on food and USD 50 on the other necessary expenses. Yeng is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more plastic to produce mats. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more plastic to produce mats

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Sokha, 31, resides with her husband and a kid in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Sokha and her husband produce traditional bags to sell, earning an income of USD 6 each per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 66 on food and USD 55 on the other necessary expenses. Sokha is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for travel to buy more bags to sell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for travel to buy more bags to sell

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with two children. Conchita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Conchita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Conchita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is married with five children. She is 32 years old and lives in San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Liza owns a sari-sari store (a general store) to earn a living and has had this business for three years. She is a load retailer, too. She earns 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from this business and on alternative means every month. She wants to sustain the business, so, she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy grocery items to sell such as cereals, noodles, canned goods, soap, etc. to fill in the emptying store.

Liza has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Liza hopes that with this sari-sari store, she can help to meet their daily needs. A portion of her revenue will be used to renovate her house.
 
======================================

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC: people empowering people.

loans.use: To buy grocery items to sell such as cereals, noodles, canned goods, soap, etc.

location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Nalukesi Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Western Kenya!  Bonventure is the facilitator of the Nalukesi group. Bonventure and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Bonventure takes care of seven children at home with his wife. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for his family and to have additional maize profits to send his children to school. In the recent 2011 season, Bonventure had a good maize yield harvesting 8 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Bonventure was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Bonventure will educate his children and invest in livestock.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Bonventure and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

In 2012, the members of Nalukesi group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photo, group members are standing with maize cobs from the recent harvest in front of them and one of One Acre Fund's maize information sheets in hand!

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with five children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a business of selling goats on the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Another major challenge is the price fluctuation in the market. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase goats and pay for transportation to her place of operation. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase goats and pay for transportation to her place of operation.

loans.name: Sami

texts.en: Sami, 57, resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Sami and her husband buy rice from local farmers to resell, earning an income of USD 4 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 83 on food and USD 82 on the other necessary expenses. Sami is requesting a loan of USD 750 to purchase more rice to resell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more rice to resell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. Elvira is widowed with five children. Elvira has had her business for 9 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Elvira has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Elvira hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en: Sitha, 51, resides with her husband and a kid in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Sitha is a farmer, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband is employed at the factory, earning an income of USD 2.6 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 37 on the other necessary expenses. Sitha is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to work. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the children to commute to work

loans.name: Zacaerias

texts.pt:
Nasceu em chibuto, Provincia de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 6 filhos 3 maiores de idade e 3 ainda frequentam a escola. Fez  4ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 
Saiu da sua terra natal para Boane a procura de melhores condicoes de vida, trabalha na bananalândia e pescador ha mais de 25 anos e tem um rendimento mensal de cerca de 10.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos  conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar redeS de pesca
No futuro pretende solicitar mais valor para comprar gado bovino, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Zacaerias was born in the city of Chibuto, in the province of Gaza in southern Mozambique. He is married and the father of six children, three of whom are adults and three of whom attend school. He went to school through the fourth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. He lives with his family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else. 
He left Chibuto for Boane in search of a better life. He's worked as a fisherman and on a banana plantation for more than 25 years. He earns about 10,500 meticals a month, which he uses to cover household expenses. He is also able to save a small amount in his bank account.
He has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is his second loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which he will use to buy fishing nets.
In the future, he hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to buy some cattle.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Parcel

texts.en:
Parcel is a 41-year-old businessman, married with six children. He runs a motorcycle transport business to make a living. He has been driving his usual routes for five years. A problem with motorcycle parts has been detected that pushes him to request a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos. This loan will be use to purchase interior and exterior [parts] for his motorcycle. He says this loan could be a big help to fix the problem he's encountered with his motorcycle and  allow him to resume business operations immediately.

In the future, Parcel hopes that he can improve his transportation business so that he can send his children to school and meet their daily needs.

loans.use: to buy interior and exterior part for his motorcycle

loans.name: Lang

texts.en: Lang, 61, resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Lang is a housewife while her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 6 per day. Two of her children are employed at the factory and at a construction site to earn money for the family. Each month, the family has to spend USD 100 on food and USD 37 on the other necessary expenses. Lang is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to work. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the children to commute to work

loans.name: Chhan

texts.en: Chhan, age 27, is a domestic rice trader in the Kompong Speu Province. She and her husband work together in the same business. They can earn an income from their business of around $6.75USD each day. In addition, Chhan’s husband also runs a trailer motor service to all passengers and other villagers for additional fees. They have been married for over five years and they are blessed with one child who studies in the local school. To generate more revenue, Mrs. Chhan and her husband have decided to ask for a loan as working capital for expanding their rice-selling business by purchasing more rice to stock up for future sales.  This loan will help provide the family  with better living conditions. To enlarge her existing house is a part of Chhan's future plans and also she needs to sustain her child to graduate with a university degree.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to stock up for future sales.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with children. 
Emma has a pigpen that sells grown & matures pigs. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy animal feed for pigs.
Emma has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Emma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for pigs

loans.name: Bielinda

texts.en:
Bielinda is proud to share that she comes from a family of farmers. She is 56 years old and is married. Bielinda manages her sari-sari store business in their village. She sells snack foods, candies, chocolates and salt. She has been in this type of business for five years and earns approximately P5,000 a month.
Bielinda is asking for a loan of P15,000 to purchase cooking oil, spices, coffee, sugar, and eggs to sell in their village. She wishes to expand her business by selling additional products in her sari-sari store. Bielinda believes that her earnings will increase if she increases her sales.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, spices, coffee, sugar, and eggs to sell in their village.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Myrna has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Myrna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Myrna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Nyakyanika 11 Women Group

texts.en: Damas is 26 years old and married with four children living in Masindi, Uganda. He is a member of Nyakyanika Group where each member guarantees the other in accessing a loan. His family goal is to start up a small business for his wife to supplement the family income. He is a fishmonger and he has been in the business for four years. He started the business with 100,000 shillings but now it has grown to 1,500,000 as his working capital. His challenge is price fluctuation and the difficulty of transporting the fish due to poor feeder roads. Damas needs the loan to buy fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is a married woman with four children between 20 and 25 years old. She has been engaged in agricultural activities for more than 10 years. Marietta tills land in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato where she grows rice crops to sell. She also raises pigs in her backyard.

Marietta plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim, 61, resides with her husband and a child in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Kim is employed at a garment factory, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Her child is employed at the factory as well to earn money for the family. Each month, the family has to spend USD 40 on food and USD 20 on the other necessary expenses. Kim is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: C2183  Twitezimbere Group

texts.en:
Patrick is the president of a group called “Twitezimbere”, which has a total of five members: four men and one woman. He is 21 years old and is married with a one-year-old child. Patrick owns a small business selling items such as rice, sugar, tomato sauce, soap, cooking oil, etc. He has had two successful years in this business and employs one person to help him. He and his group work from 7 am until 9 pm every day.

Patrick and his group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase more tomatoes, Irish potatoes, bananas, rice, sugar, cooking oil and soap to sell. With any profits from the proceeds of this loan, Patrick and his group would like to provide food for their families, pay school fees for their children and save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes, Irish potatoes, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is a 50-year-old married woman with two children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She owns a retail shop that sells general merchandise and she has operated it for 10 years. Her main dream is to expand her business to become a wholesale shop. Faith needs the loan to buy sugar, soap and matchboxes to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and matchboxes to sell.

loans.name: 06 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Lan has a manufacturing business sewing curtains. She is applying for a loan to purchase machines to do tailor-made clothing and repairing service.

Lan is 39 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of an eight-member group: the 06 Đông Vệ solidarity group. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

In 2010, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Lan has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lan has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Lan faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lan hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase machines to do tailor-made clothing and repairing service

loans.name: Arlindo

texts.pt:
Nasceu na provincia de Zambezia, norte de Moçambique, casado e pai de 4 filhos todos ainda frequentam a escola. Fez  o nivel medio do ensino geral e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ele. 

Saiu da sua terra natal a Maputo em missão de estudos, é bibliotecário ha mais de 10 anos e tem um salario de 3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 16.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar material de construcao DE UMA CASA (ferro, pedra, cimento, barrotes, e outros) para dar continuidade com a construcao da sua casa. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 5.000.00mt, e 10,000.00mt, para sua obra.
Pretende solicitar mais valor para concluir a sua casa mobiliar e comprar eletrodomesticos, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Arlindo was born in Zambezia Province, in northern Mozambique. He is married and the father of four children, all of whom attend school. He made it through the middle school, but wasn't able to continue his studies out of financial constraints. He lives in his own home with his family and also supports two nephews who live with him as well. He left his native region near Maputo for his studies. He has been a librarian for more than 10 years and makes a monthly salary of 3,000 MZN [Mozambique Meticais] that goes to his household expenses and also some savings in his personal bank account.  

He has never taken out a loan from any other bank and became aware of Hluvuku [Kiva field partner] through some friends who are also Hluvuku clients. This will be his third loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 16,000 MZN [Mozambique Meticais] with which he plans to buy construction materials (steel, stone, cement, bricks, etc.) so he can continue building his house. His prior loans were in the amounts of 5,000 MZN [Mozambique Meticais] and 10,000 MZN [Mozambique Meticais] for this work. He plans to take out further loans from Hluvuku to finish his house and buy appliances.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (steel, stone, cement, bricks, etc.) so he can continue building his home.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Edna has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Edna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Edna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials (doors, sand, bricks, etc.) so he can continue building his home.

loans.name: Samol

texts.en: Samol, 31, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Samol and her husband are employed at a garment factory, earning an income of USD 3 each per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 70 on food and USD 40 on the other necessary expenses. Samol is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase a fishing boat for her husband to go fishing during the fishing season. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat for her husband to go fishing

loans.name: Primetiva

texts.en:
Primetiva is 61 years old and lives in Lawa-an Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with seven children. 

Primetiva sells snacks. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

Primetiva has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Primetiva hopes to have a grocery store in order to help her family. She is a hard working mother and has a happy family. Primetiva is a MIGS member of PMPC, She is thankful because PMPC can help her in terms of financial problems.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy maize, groundnuts and beans

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Benedicta has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Benedicta has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Benedicta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials (bricks, boards, cement, etc.)

loans.name: Nat

texts.en: Nat, 32, resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Nat sells sugarcane juice, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a police officer, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 16 on the other necessary expenses. Nat is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase fertilizer for growing rice. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for growing rice

loans.name: C2178 Duteraninkunga Group

texts.en:
Mwadjuma is 37 years old, married and has three children between 7 and 20 years old. Mwadjuma is the president of this group, which is called " Duteraninkunga" in local language. She is in the middle on the right side.

She owns a small business where she sells different products such as beans, sugar, salt, cooking oil and Irish potatoes. Mwadjuma has been engaged in this business for one year and she currently employs one person to help her. She runs her business from 6 am until 9 pm every day.

Mwadjuma and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy more products such as beans, sugar, cooking oil and Irish potatoes for resale to get better profits. With these profits, she and her group will reinvest in their business and save for their future.

loans.use: To buy more beans, sugar, cooking oil and Irish potatoes to sell

loans.name: Atta

texts.en: Atta is a 44-year-old man who is married with two sons and four daughters. He lives in Rafah City in Gaza located in Palestine. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Atta has a store for selling cosmetics, which is another source of income for the family. He wants to purchase more cosmetics and to have a better collection to sell. The amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. When Atta takes the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will purchase more cosmetics and have a better collection to sell. That will increase his income and improve his family life positively with better living conditions. Atta is photographed in the picture in his store.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Alfonia

texts.en:
Alfonia is 63 years old and lives in P-1 Cogon, Ozamis City. She is a widow, with 3 children. Alfonia is dressmaker. She has been doing this work for 30 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 to purchase material for her business.

Alfonia has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Alfonia hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase material for her dress making business

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. Esterlita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, beverages and also dried fish. She has had this business for 6 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell. Esterlita has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Esterlita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Manjacaze, provincia de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, viuva e mãe de 4 filhos dos quais 1 é maior de idade e 3 frequentam a escola. Fez 6ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu da sua terra natal quando casou-se, é comerciante ha mais de 4 anos e tem um rendimendo de cerca de 6.000.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar bidons de óleo para a revenda.
NO FUTURO VAI solicitar mais valor para ampliar a sua actividade comercial e construir uma casa,irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku
texts.en:
Lucia was born in the city of Manjacaze, in the province of Gaza in southern Mozambique. She is a widow and the mother of four children, one of whom is adult and three of whom go to school. She went to school through the sixth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. She lives with her family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else. 

She left Manjacaze when she got married. She's had a shop for more than four years and earns 6,000 meticals a month. She uses her salary for household expenses and is able to save a small amount in her bank account.
She has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which she will use to buy cans of cooking oil to sell.
She hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to expand her business and build a house.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Reoun

texts.en:
Reoun, 51, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Reoun produces traditional baskets, earning an income of 3 USD per day. Her husband produces wooden windows to sell. Each month, the family has to spend 75 USD on food and 13 USD on the other necessary expenses. 

Reoun is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to commute to work

loans.name: Lidia

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade da Matola, provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 2 filhos que frequentam a escola. Fez o nivel medio e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta os pais enviando dinheiro para axiliar nas dispesas. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é comerciante e modista ha mais de 10 anos e tem um rendimendo de cerca de 12.000.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 16.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar tecidos para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
Pretende solicitar mais valor para comprar uma maquina de corte e cose, para ampliar a sua actividade comercial ,irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Lidia was born in the city of Matola, in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique. She is single and the mother of two children, who go to school. She attended school through middle school but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. She lives in her own home with her family and also supports her parents financially, sending them money to help with their expenses.

She's never left Matola. She's had a shop for more than ten years and earns 12,000 meticals a month. She uses her salary for household expenses and is able to save a small amount in her bank account.
She has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 16,000 meticals, which she will use to buy clothing to increase the quantity of merchandise she carries.
She hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to buy a sewing machine to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nemesia Group

texts.en:
Nemesia is married with two children. Nemesia is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Nemesia is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for the corn. Nemesia has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Nemesia hopes to purchase more fertilizer for the corn.

Nemesia is the leader of a three-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child.
 
Irene has a shop that sells vegetables like string beans, eggplants, okra & squash. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy vegetables to sell.

Irene has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Irene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Kann

texts.en:
From the Reussey Keo commune, Mr. Kann is a humble man who makes an income by working in a garment factory as a sewing worker. He has worked in this job since 2007 and gets a specific salary every month. His wife also generates a little income from her current occupation as a garment factory worker in the same field. 

On average, the couple can earn an income of about $8 per day. They have two children who still are enrolled in school. As they face a problem with transportation needs, they often hire a motor taxi driver to pick up them when they go to achieve their work task or other traveling needs. The couple mentioned that they really wish to buy a new vehicle, but they do not have enough cash on hand to do so. So Mr. Kann and his wife have requested a loan in the amount of $1,000 from Kiva in order to purchase a new motorbike for driving to their job location. Mr. Kann hopes he will use the increased income to expand his old house to a larger size.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for driving to his job location.

loans.name: Kimweyi Joint Group

texts.en:
Albert is the facilitator of the Kimweyi Joint group. Albert and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Albert and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Albert takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for his family and to have additional maize profits to send his children to school. In the recent 2011 season, Albert had a very good maize yield harvesting 9 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Albert was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 4 acres of land.

With income from maize sales, Albert will educate his children and invest in a livestock raising business as savings for future use.

In 2012, the members of Kimweyi Joint group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 4 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Yolanda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Yolanda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Yolanda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, provincia do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 3 filhos todos maiores de idade. Naõ estudou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia no Distrito de Boane e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

É comerciante ha mais de 30 anos e tem um rendimendo de cerca de 2.000.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (caldo, óleo, arroz, amendoim, peixe, e outros.) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. O primeiro emprestimo foi de 10.000.00mt, para o comercio.
No futuro vai solicitar mais valor para concluir o seu estabelecimento para ampliar a sua actividade comercial, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Julieta was born in the city of Maputo, located in the province of the same name in southern Mozambique.  She is single and mother of 3 adult children.  She did not attend school due to a lack of financial resources.  She owns the home she lives in with her family in the Boane district and she does not support anyone else. 

She has had her own business for more than 30 years and earns around 2.000.00mt monthly, which she uses for household expenses and saves some in her bank account. 

She has never had a loan with other banks.  She learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also clients.  This is her second loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 15.000.00mt, which she will use to purchase products (broth, cooking oil, peanuts, fish, etc.) to increase her stock of merchandise.  The first loan was for 10.000.00mt, for her business.  In the future she plans to request additional loans to complete her store and to expand her business.  She will request additional loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase products for resale (soup, cooking oil, rice, peanuts, fis, etc.)

loans.name: Dorah

texts.en:
Dorah is a married woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a food vending business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Her major dream is to expand to a bigger restaurant in the future.  

With the KSHS 20,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase cement and timber to build a bigger restaurant and add more furniture. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cement and timber to build a bigger restaurant and add more furniture.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a resident and a farmer at Kitale in western Kenya where she has been practicing poultry farming for eight years. She is aged 38 and married with 6 children between 17 and 6 years old.  She sells her poultry products to the local market.

Susan has made a loan request with Juhudi Kilimo for 50,000 KES to boost her poultry business by buying more poultry birds. She is optimistic that the business will pay back owing to her experience. She aspires to be the leading supplier of eggs in the local market. She adds that improved income will enable her to give better health care to her children.

Susan mentions diseases and the high costs of poultry feeds as her current challenge in farming.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry birds

loans.name: Jurial

texts.en:
Jurial is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children. 

Jurial is providing motorela or habal-habal services. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy tools and pay for gasoline for maintenance.

Jurial has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jurial hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (sand, stones, beams, iron, etc.)

loans.name: Ngo

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngo was born in Kompot Province, Cambodia. She has resided in this province since 1980, and this is where she works as a rice cultivator. From this business, she earns approximately $3 each day. 

She is married to Mr. Sros, who generates income as a sugar-palm tree climber. This humble couple has been blessed with five children, two of whom are single, and the other three are already married and live independently. 

Mrs. Ngo also has a second economic activity: raising pigs. She has been doing this for several years, and it is going very well for her thanks to the persistence she brings to her work. To earn a living, she has discussed with her family purchasing more piglets, but they are lacking some money so they wish to request some funds through HKL's partnership with Kiva. They hope that these funds will make their family meet happiness and prosperity and have a larger house. This is her first loan with Kiva and her second loan with HKL. They are grateful to all donors in advance.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets.

loans.name: Cacilda

texts.pt:
Nasceu no distrito de Boane, provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 3 filhos que todos frequentam a escola. Fez a 11ª classe devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ela. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é professora ha mais de 18 anos e tem um salario de 2.500.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Ja teve emprestimos em outros bancos(BIM) e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 12.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao DE UMA CASA (areia, pedra, ferro, cimento e outros) para dar continuidade a sua obra. O primeiro emprestimo foi de:10.000.00m, para a obra.
Pretende solicitar mais valor para concluir a sua casa e dar continuidade com os estudos, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Caclida was born in the district of Boane, in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique. She is married and the mother of three children, who go to school. She only went to school through the eleventh grade because of her family's economic circumstances. She lives in her own home with her family, and also supports two nephews who lives with them.
She's never left Boane. She's been a teacher for more than 18 years and earns about 2,500 meticals a month. He uses his salary to pay for household expenses and also saves a little in a bank account.She's had loans from other banks (BIM) to build her house, which she paid off without any problems. She learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 12,000 meticals, which she will use to buy construction materials (sand, stone, iron, cement, etc.) to continue work on her house. Her first loan was in the amount of 10,000 meticals for the construction.She hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to finish her house and continue her studies.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (sand, stone, iron, cement, etc.).

loans.name: Kiryantaama United Group

texts.en: Mary is a 48-year-old married woman with seven children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Mary sells fresh foods and maize flour, a business she has operated for 10 years. Her major challenge has been inadequate capital to inject in the business and her dream is to have a big food store. Mary needs the loan to purchase fresh foods and cassava flour to sell. Mary is wearing a pink blouse and a dress.

loans.use: to purchase fresh foods and cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Fatema

texts.en: Fatema is a 34-year-old young woman. She is married and has four sons and one daughter. She lives in Khanyounis city in Gaza located in Palestine. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Fatema has a project of having chairs to rent to wedding parties, which is another source of income for the family. She wants to increase the number of chairs she has because of the high customer demand for renting chairs for their parties in this season. The amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. When Fatema gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will purchase chairs and increase the number of rental chairs. That will increase her income and enable her to share the life expenses and live with her family in better conditions. Fatema is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: To purchase extra chairs for rental to wedding parties.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Pablita is providing motorela or habal-habal services and her husband is the driver. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy tools & pay for gasoline for maintenance.

Pablita has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Pablita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for gasoline

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Bilene Macia, provincia de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, solteira e não tem filhos. Fez a 3ª classe e parou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais 1 sobrinha que vive com ela. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é agricultora ha mais de 16 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 3.688.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Ja teve emprestimos em outros bancos (BARCLAYS) e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao de uma casa( chapas, areia, pedra, barrotes, ferro, e outros.) para dar continuidade a sua obra.
No futuro vai solicitar mais valor para concluir a sua casa para melhor confortar a sua familia irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Isabel was born in Bilene Macia, in the province of Gaza in southern Mozambique. She is single and has no children. She went to school through the third grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. She lives in her own home with her family, and also supports a niece who lives with them.
She's never left Gaza. She's been a farmer for more than 16 years and earns about 3,688 meticals a month. She uses her salary for household expenses and is able to save a small amount in her bank account. She's had loans from other banks (Barclays), which she paid off without any problems. She learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is her first loan, in the amount of 10,000 meticals, which she will use to purchase construction materials (sheet metal, sand, stone, rebar, iron, etc.) to continue the construction on her house. She hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to finish his house so she can provide his family with a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (sheet metal, sand, stone, rebar, iron, etc.).

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is married with four children. Eliza is 44 years old and lives in Bogabongan, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte.

Eliza sells ready to wear clothes to earn a living and has had this business for 13 years. Each month, she earns 1,500 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14,900 PHP to purchase clothes, pants, skirts and other items.

Eliza has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Eliza hopes to have good living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase clothes, pants and other products to sell.

location.town: Bogabongan, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is a 55-year-old married woman with two children. She is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Merlie primarily grows rice crops to sell. She works hard to improve her business and support her family.
Merlie has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes this loan will help her achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials (sheet metal, sand, stone, rebar, iron, etc.).

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with five children. 
Mercy buys and peddles fish such as sardines and mackerel. She has run this business for ten years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy fish to sell.
Mercy has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Nim

texts.en:
Mrs. Nim was born in Kompot Province, Cambodia. She has resided in this province since 1979, and this is where she works as a rice cultivator. From this business, she earns approximately $2 each day. She is married to Mr. Svay, who is a rice farmer also. 

This humble couple has been blessed with four children; all of them have already married and live independently. Mrs. Nim also has a second economic activity: raising pigs. She has been doing this for many years, and it is going very well for her thanks to the persistence she brings to her work. To earn a living, she has discussed with her family purchasing more piglets but they are lacking money, so they wish to request some funds through HKL, a partner with Kiva. They hope that these funds will make their family meet happiness and prosperity and have a larger house. This is her first loan with Kiva and HKL. They are grateful to all donors in advance.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets.

loans.name: Florencepin

texts.en:
Florencepin lives in Villaflor, Oroquieta City. She is married with three children. 
Florencepin works in the piggery industry for a living. She has been doing this for ten years. She has requested a loan of 5,500 PHP to purchase pigs for her piggery. 
Florencepin has been a member of Kiva partner, PMPC, for seven years. In the future, she hopes to have a large amount of capital for her piggery. Florecepin is proud to be a member of PMPC because it can help with her financial problems.

loans.use: to purchase pigs for her piggery.

loans.name: Evelina

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, provincia do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 4 filhos que ainda frequentam a escola. Não estudou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é comerciante ha mais de 30 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, amendoim, peixe, batatas, e outros.) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro vai solicitar mais valor para concluir o seu estabelecimento e ampliar a sua actividade comercial, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Evelina was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name in southern Mozambique. She is single and the mother of four children, who go to school. She never went to school because of her parents' difficult financial circumstances. She lives with her family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.
She's never left Maputo. She's had a shop for 30 years and earns 4,000 meticals a month. She uses her salary for household expenses and is able to save a small amount in her bank account. She's never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 10,000 meticals, which she will use to buy products (rice, peanuts, fish, sweet potatoes, etc.) to increase the quantity of merchandise she carries. She hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to finish building her shop and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy products (rice, peanuts, fish, sweet potatoes, etc.) for her shop.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 38 years old and lives in San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is married with three children. Joel operates his own jeep for transport to earn a living. He has been engaged in this business for six years. He earns 10,000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy some spare parts for his jeep for repair and maintenance. Joel has been a member of Kiva partner, GDMPC, for one year. In the future, he hopes to purchase another jeep for transport to earn more money for the education of his children and for the family. About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. GDMPC: people empowering people.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for jeepney repair and maintenance.

location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Amalia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for three years. She has requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Amalia has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2009. In the future, Amalia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Patience and hard work are the key to attaining success in life says Elizabeth. During the three years she has operated her retail shop business, Elizabeth has experienced both ups and downs. Aside from her sari-sari (variety) store, she has also been engaged in a hog-raising business for one year. Elizabeth is married and has five children who are studying at a public school in her community. She is thankful because her husband helps her in maintaining her retail business. He is also in charge of their rice farming and fish vending businesses. Elizabeth hopes that she is able to improve their businesses in order to be able to support her children to the higher level of education. 
With this in mind, she is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods, cooking ingredients, sugar, cooking oil, milk and detergent soap for her general store. She hopes that with this loan she will be able to enlarge the store, offer more services to her customers and earn a higher income to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods, cooking ingredients, sugar ,cooking oil, milk and detergent soap for her general store.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.pt:
Nasceu no distrito de Morrumbala, provincia da Zambezia, norte de Moçambique, casado e pai de 5 filhos dos quais 2 maiores de idade e 3 ainda frequentam a escola. Fez a 7ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais uma sobrinha que vive com ele. 
Saiu da sua terra natal a procura de emprego, trabalha como segurança ha mais de 3 anos e tem um salario de 4.000.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material construcao de uma casa (areia, cimento, pedra, baarrotes, e outros.) para dar continuidade a sua obra.Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 5.400.00mt, e 7.500.00mt, ambos para o andamento da sua obra.
No futuro vai solicitar mais valor para concluir a sua casa e comprar uma viatura pra auxiliar no transporte dos produtos, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Alberto was born in the district of Morrumbala, in the province of Zambezia in northern Mozambique. He is married and the father of five children, two of whom are adults and three of whom attend school. He went to school through sevent fifth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. He lives in his own home with his family, and also supports a niece who lives with him.
He left Morrumbala to find work. He's been a security guard for more than three years and earns about 4,000 meticals a month. He uses his salary to pay for household expenses and also saves a little in a bank account. He's never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is his third loan with Kiva, in the amount of 10,000 meticals, which he will use to buy construction materials (sand, cement, stone, rebar, etc.) to continue work on his house. His first loans were in the amounts of 5,400 and 7,500 meticals, both of which he used for the scaffolding for the construction. In the future, he hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to buy a car to help with transporting his merchandise.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (sand, cement, stone, rebar, etc.).

loans.name: Kyamazima Twimuke Group

texts.en: John is a 62-year-old married man with nine children. He lives in his own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is raising his hand in the photograph above. John operates a charcoal store – a business he has carried out for the last 34 years. His major challenge has been ever increasing rent and transport costs. His dream is to diversify and deal in other energy sources such as solar systems. John is requesting this loan to buy sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Mrs. Yem, age 50, has been working in a farming business for a long time. She has a plot of fertile farmland in Kompong Speu province that she got from her grandparent. Normally she is able to earn some income from her crop-planting business, around $2.50 each day to use for the family’s needs.  Her husband is a policeman in his community. They are blessed with two children who are employed in various places but with the same career as domestic workers.

Mrs. Yem said that she has a plan to purchase some piglets to feed for their offspring and for slaughter, but her savings are insufficient to do that. To deal with this situation, Mrs. Yem would like to request a loan from Kiva to buy some pigs for breeding purposes. Mrs. Yem believes that she can sell her pigs when they are big enough. She can use the revenue to expand this pig-raising business.

loans.use: to buy some pigs for breeding purposes

loans.name: C2188 Twegerane Group

texts.en:
Aphonsine is 27 years old and is married with three children aged between four and eight. She is the president of a group called Twegerane, and in the picture she is the second person on the right. Aphonsine and the other members of her group sell sorghum. They have had five successful years in this business.
Aphonsine and her group have requested a loan to purchase a large quantity of sorghum to sell at the market. They hope this will help them to earn a good profit from the sale. This will allow them to provide for their families, pay school fees for their children and save some money for the future.

loans.use: to purchase a quantity of sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pretende comprar material de construcao de uma casa (chapas,areia, cimento, pedra, e outros.)

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 
Thelma has a shop that sells fish such as sardines and mackerel. She has run this business for seven years. She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy fish for resale.
Thelma has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Adriano

texts.pt:
Nasceu na  cidade de Xai-Xai, provincia de Gaza , sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 4 filhos todos maiores de idade. Fez a 6ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais dois netos que vivem com ele. 
Saiu da sua terra natal em busca de melhores condiçoes de vida, trabalha como empregado domestico, ha mais de 10 anos e tem um salario de 3.000.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao DE UMA CASA (areia, ferro, chapas, cimento, pedra, e outros.) para dar continuidade sua obra. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 8.500.00mt, e 15.000.00mt para cobrir as dispesas do casamento, seu e do seu filho.
No futuro vai solicitar mais valor para concluir a sua obra e oferecer mais conforto a sua familia, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Adriano was born in the city of Xai-Xai, in the province of Gaza, in the south of Mozambique, is married and the father of 4 children, all adults. He completed 6th grade and didn’t continue his education due to a lack of financial means. He lives in his own house with his family and also supports two grandchildren who live with him.

He left his homeland in search of a better quality of life and has worked as an employee in a private residence for more than 10 years. He has a monthly salary of 3,000.00 meticals (MZN) which he spends on household expenditures and saves in his bank account.

He has never had loans with other banks and heard of Hluvuku through friends who are also clients. This is his third loan with Hluvuku and will be for the value of 10,000.00 MZN, with which he intends to purchase construction materials for a house (sand, iron, sheets, cement, stone and others) to continue his building work. His first loans were for: 8,500.00 MZN and 15,000.00 MZN to cover the expenses of his and his son’s weddings.

In future he will solicit higher amounts in order to complete his construction work and offer his family a higher level of comfort. He will request these loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: purchase construction materials (sand, iron, sheets, cement, stone and others)

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with two children. 
Nelita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for nine years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Nelita has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 27-year-old young woman. She is married and has one son. She lives in Khanyounis city in Gaza, Palestine. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a modest salary. 
Samar wants to purchase new basic home appliances that will make her family life easier and healthier, such as a refrigerator, stove, etc. However, because her husband's salary is only modest, she doesn't have sufficient funds to make these purchases so she wants to take a loan of $1,500 from Kiva partner, FATEN. When Samar takes the loan, which is to be repaid on a monthly basis, she will purchase the home appliances she needs and provide her family with better and healthier living conditions. 
Samar is a conservative woman so her husband is photographed instead in a FATEN branch.

loans.use: to purchase needed home appliances.

loans.name: Ludelen

texts.en:
Ludelen is married with four children. She is 45 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. 
Ludelen has a general store business to earn a living and has run this business for three years. Each month she earns 4,000 PHP doing this business. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to purchase stock for her general store. She has been a member of Kiva partner, PMPC, for three years. 
Ludelen hopes that her children have a good future someday.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 29 years old and married to Antony. They have two school-going children. Ruth has been operating a greengrocery shop for the last six years in Kangemi town.
Ruth was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by a KADET client. She has paid her previous loans well and in good time. She intends to use this loan amount to buy ten crates of tomatoes, two bags of onions, Sukuma Wiki (greens) and one bag of cabbage – all for resale.
In the future, Ruth hopes to open a wholesale greengrocery shop.

loans.use: to buy ten crates of tomatoes, two bags of onions, Sukuma Wiki and one bag of cabbage.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Rosie has a shop that sells animal feed by the kilogram for chickens and pigs. She has run this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy sacks of animal feed for resale.
Rosie has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of animal feed for resale.

loans.name: Rabbim

texts.ru: Раббим  более 13 лет ведет бизнес в  аграрной сфере. Начал он бизнес-деятельность выращиванием  картофеля и пшеницы, также занимается скотоводством .Он трудолюбивый, старательный человек. Трудолюбие помогло ему  расширить свой бизнес,  он начал выращивать картофель в большем объеме. На полученные доходы Раббим хочет построить сарай. Раббим хотел бы получить займ в размере 10000 Сомони для покупки семян, горюче смазочные материалы и скота.
texts.en: Rabbim has been running a business in the agricultural field for over 13 years.  He started his business with growing potatoes and wheat and is also involved in animal husbandry.  He is a hard-working and diligent person.  Hard work helped him expand his business; he started to grow potatoes in large volumes.  Rabbim wants to use the received profits to build a barn.  He want to obtain a loan in the sum of 10000 Somoni to purchase seeds, fuel-lubricant materials and livestock.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fuel-lubricant materials and livestock

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is an elementary graduate; she did not have the chance to enter high school or college because her parents had no capacity to send her to school. Nenita is married to a farmer and blessed with seven children. 
Nenita and her husband work together to do their best for their children's future. Two of their children are in high school or college. Nenita’s family is united in the desire to carry itself out of poverty. 
Nenita needs additional capital of 12,000 PHP to buy herbal medicines and soap to sell. She decided to take this loan to maintain her business. Through the income she generates from the business, she is able to finance her household's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy additional herbal medicines and soap to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 51-year-old married woman. She has six children aged from 8 to 24. 
Margaret describes herself as visionary. She operates a retail shop where she sells maize, beans, cereals, basins, jugs and dresses. Her business is located within a shopping center. She has been involved in this business for five years. She describes her biggest business challenges to be inflation, poor transportation and seasonality. She will use the loan of 85,000 KES to purchase a motorcycle to transport her products. Her business goal is to have bought a pick-up truck for transporting goods from town within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into wholesale.
