loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to transport goods.

loans.name: Esmaelita

texts.en:
Esmaelita is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Esmaelita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for ten years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Esmaelita has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Grace has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products from NATASHA and AVON. She has had this business for six years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy additional products from NATASHA and AVON for resale.
Grace has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional products from NATASHA and AVON for resale.

loans.name: Pius Muthoka

texts.en:
Pius is a 53-year-old married man. He has six children aged between 8 and 31. He describes himself as talkative and someone who enjoys sharing ideas. 
Pius operates a school supplies store where he sells pens, rulers, combs, elastic bands, masking tape and pencils. He has been involved in this business for 26 years. His business is located in a commercial area and his primary customers are school pupils. He will use his loan of 20,000 KES to purchase additional stock for his kiosk. 
His business goal is to own a shop in Mwingi Town within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to provide education for his youngest child and grandchildren to university level.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell at his kiosk.

loans.name: Makpurat

texts.ru: Макпурат 33 года, замужем и имеет троих сыновей – 11 лет, 5 лет и 3 года. С 2001 года Макпурат занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав со стартового капитала в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Макпурат насчитывается одна корова и 50 баранов. Для дальнейшего увеличения количества голов скота и закупа корма, Макпурат обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS).  Это позволит расширить ее хозяйство и повысить прибыль в бизнесе.
texts.en: Makpurat is 33 years old, married and has three sons, who are 11, 5 and 3 years old.  Makpurat has been involved in animal husbandry and beekeeping since 2001, having started with a capital of 15,000 som (KGS).  Today, Makpurat's farm has one cow and 50 sheep.  She requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to further increase livestock quantity and buy livestock feed.  This would allow Makpurat to expand her farm and increase business profit.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and livestock feed

loans.name: Manaljav

texts.en:
Manaljav is 28 years old and lives with her two sons and husband in a rented apartment in Govisumber province, Mongolia. Her husband works at the local gas station. Her eldest son is a high school student and her other son goes to kindergarten. 
Manaljav worked as a salesperson at a local store from January to May 2011. From May 2011, she started her own business by renting a commercial space at the local market and selling clothes and shoes. She is planning to specialize her trading business in shoes. She is a diligent woman who says, "If my husband becomes a full-time employee at the gas station, our income will increase and we will go for an apartment loan." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy shoes for her business.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Yong

texts.en:
This borrower is from Baray District, Kompong Thom Province, Cambodia. Mrs. Yong is 34 years old, married and has four children.

Yong has owned a store since 2006, selling all kinds of fish, both fresh and grilled, and fresh vegetables. She has good experience, a deep understanding of local consumers and a good reputation. Her store is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

She also has a second economic activity of raising pigs. To upgrade her standard of living, she wishes to apply for a loan from Kiva and their partner HKL. The purpose of this loan is to use it to purchase piglets. She hopes that this loan will generate more money which will offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole and to have a bigger house. This means a brighter future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets

loans.name: C 2189 Dufatanye Group

texts.en:
Florence is the president of a group called “Dufatanye” with a total of three members, each with a different business. Florence owns a small general store selling different kinds of products.

Florence is 37 years old and married with one child. Her business is open from 6 am until 6 pm every day including weekends. This is her 10th successful year in her business.

Florence and her group will use this loan to purchase more products such as salt, cassava flour, bread, and so on. Florence and her group have many plans for the profits that they make from this loan. She would like to provide food for her family, pay school fees for their children, renovate their house, and save money for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more salt, cassava flour, bread, etc.

loans.name: Laarni

texts.en:
Laarni is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Laarni has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Laarni has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Laarni hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 58 years old and lives in Fatima, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with five children.

Yolanda has a handicraft business selling crocheted products and earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase products for her handicraft business.

Yolanda has been a member of PMPC for more than one year. In the future, Yolanda hopes to promote her business.

loans.use: to purchase more crocheted products to sell

loans.name: Jaynery

texts.en:
Jaynery is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child.
 
Jaynery is providing motorela or habal-habal services. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools & pay for gasoline for the maintenance.

Jaynery has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Jaynery hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for gasoline

loans.name: Yuma

texts.en: Yuma is a single woman. She has two children with ages ranging from 7 to 13 years old. She describes herself as quiet. She operates a tailoring business where she provides tailoring services for skirts, shirts, dresses and shorts. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a commercial area and her primary customers are students and school pupils. She describes her biggest business challenge as the lack of capital to purchase more materials. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to add to her stock of material. Her business goal is to have a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to educate her two children up to the university level and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more fabric

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok, 28 years old, is buying a cow to resell. She earns $4 per day. Her husband is a blacksmith who earns $4 per day. They have two children who are six and two years old. Every month she has to spend $33 on food, $10 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a cow to resell. She doesn’t want to change her career because she can make a good profit from this business, and she plans to buy more cows to sell when she has more money. For her children, she wants to send them to study at the university.

loans.use: To buy a cow to resell

loans.name: Ganhuyag

texts.en: Ganhuyag is 44 years old and lives with his sons and wife in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Songino-Hairhan district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His wife stays at home; two of his sons are college students and the other two are high school students. He started his business in 2000 by making Mongolian traditional boots at his home. His business is going well and he now has 11 years business and work experience. He plans to expand his business in the future. His family is also building a house at his place. He is a diligent and hard-working man who says, "I want to increase my income and make my life better." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to pay his sons' tuition fees and to buy more materials for making shoes.

loans.use: To pay for his sons' tuition fees and to buy more materials

loans.name: Marufа

texts.ru: Маъруфа занимается предпринимательской деятельностью 16 лет. Имеет многолетний опыт работы в бизнесе. Маъруфа любящая мать 4 замечательных  детей. У неё  торговая точка, где он занимается  продажей  свежих овощей и зелени. Она начала свой бизнес с мизерной суммы.  Постепенно  товарооборот увеличивался, возрастал спрос  покупателей, для этого ей нужны дополнительные средства для покупки овощей и зелени для расширения бизнеса. С этой целью она запрашивает займ на сумме 1300$ США.
texts.en: Marufа has been involved in entrepreneurship for 16 years.  She has many years of experience working in business.  Marufа is a loving mother of four remarkable children.  Marufa has a retail outlet, where she sell fresh vegetables and greens.  She started her business with a scanty sum of money.  Gradually, product turnover increased and so did customer demand.  This is why she needs additional funds for the purchase of vegetables and greens to expand her business.  Marufa is requesting a loan in the sum of $1300 for this purpose.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables in order to increase product turnover

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 30-year-old married woman. She has 3 children aged from 10 years to 13 years. She describes herself as innovative. She operates a general store where she sells flour, sugar, milk and rice. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. She says her biggest business challenge is lack of enough working capital. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to purchase flour, sugar and rice. Her business goal is to open up another business within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will own a wholesale business and give her children a better life.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice and flour

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en:
Suzan is a 30-year-old young woman. She is married with three sons and one daughter. She lives in Rafah city, Gaza, Palestine. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. He also works as a taxi driver after hours. Suzan's husband has a taxi that provides income for the family's living expenses. This taxi needs a new engine to work more efficiently. Suzan wants to share this expense with her husband and take a loan of $1,896.50 from FATEN. When Suzan takes the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, her husband will be able to purchase a new engine and work extra hours to increase the family income and improve their living conditions. Suzan is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead next to the taxi. 


About this loan product:
 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase a new engine for the taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase tea

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhem is a 45-year-old married woman who has three children: two of them are married and live independently and another child is single. She is a hardworking woman and provides her family with a good living situation.

Presently she is working as a sewing factory worker in Phnom Penh city where she can earn enough salary for each month. For an upgrade to their standard of living, she needs to request some funds from donors. The purpose of her loan is to purchase a cow. She hopes that this business will help her family gain additional profit.

She is very thankful to all kind lenders that help her family. In the future she is expecting to open a grocery store in front of her house, and to have a comfortable house.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth has been selling clothes for the past four years in Kangemi town. She is 30 years old and is married to Peter. They have two school-aged children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET client. She has repaid her previous loans well and in good time. She intends to use the loan to buy four bales of ladies' clothes, two bales of children's wear and 20 pieces of men’s jeans.

In future, Ruth hopes to own a building from where she can operate her business.

loans.use: To buy four bales of ladies' clothes, two bales of children's wear and 20 pieces of men’s jeans.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov, 50-years-old, is a food seller who earns $10 per day. Her husband is a taxi driver who earns $10 per day. This couple has four children: two are studying, one is a tailor who earns $2.5 per day and the other one is at home. Every month she has to spend $60 on food, $10 electricity, $30 on school fees and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 for her daughter to get blood tests and other services for her to work in Korea. She plans to buy a new car for her husband's taxi service because his car is old.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter to get blood tests to go to work in Korea

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla earns a living through farming. She plants rice and vegetables on her land located in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Perla works hard to help provide for her family. She has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm inputs. She is hoping to achieve an abundant harvest.
Perla is 52 years old and married with three children. She hopes to provide better living conditions for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 
Tita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages .
Tita has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Abdinazar

texts.ru: Абдиназар  труженик села. Он начал работу с продажи овца, потом перешел на выращивание сельхоз культур. Вначале он  посеял на 0,20 соток пшеницу и на 0,10 соток лук. В этом году он расширил посевные участки и начал сеять на 0,30 соток пшеницу. Абдиназар имеет 4 детей разного возраста и заботливую жену. Жена и две старшие дочери  помогают ему  в выращивании сельхоз культур. Он хотел бы получить займ для покупки семян.
texts.en: Abdinazar is a farm worker.  He started his business with selling sheep and then transitioned into growing agricultural crops.  At first, he sowed wheat on 0.20 sotka and onions on 0.10 sotka.  This year he expanded his sowable land and started to sow wheat on 0.30 sotka.  Abdinazar has four children of different ages and a caring wife.  His wife and two older daughters help him with growing agricultural crops.  He wants to obtain a loan for the purchase of seeds.

loans.use: to buy seeds for growing agricultural crops

loans.name: Narorn

texts.en:
Narorn is 47 years old and raises pigs. She earns $3 per day. Her husband is a taxi driver who earns $10 per day. They have two children, both of whom are studying. Every month Narorn has to spend $50 on food, $5 on electricity, $30 on school fees and $10 on other expenses. 
Narorn would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy pigs, and pig food to feed them, which she will then sell. She wants to buy more pigs to raise so she can make a good profit at this time. She also wants to help one of her children to work in Korea where one can make more income than in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig food.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Erlinda provides manicure and pedicure services. She has run this business for three years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy materials needed for offering manicure and pedicure services.
Erlinda is a new member of Kiva partner, HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for manicure and pedicure services.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Genelyn has a retail shop that sells fruits such as mangoes and apples. She has run this business for two years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy a variety of fruits to sell.
Genelyn is a new member of Kiva partner, HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Antony Munyao

texts.en:
Antony is a 26-year-old married man. He has a son who is four months old. Antony describes himself as pragmatic and a strategic thinker. 
Antony operates a boda boda transport service. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a trading center. He describes his biggest business challenges as poor road infrastructure and environmental conditions that affect his health unfavorably. He will use his 70,000 KES loan to purchase another motorcycle. He hopes that, in the future, he will be able to venture into real estate and own shares in blue-chip companies.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Bora Bidii Group

texts.en:
Janerose is the facilitator of the Bora Bidii group. Janerose and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Janerose and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Janerose takes care of one child at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for her family and to have additional maize profits to send her child to school. With income from maize sales, Janerose will educate her child and invest in a livestock raising business as savings for future use.

In 2012, the members of Bora Bidii group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the picture above, one group member is holding a One Acre Fund maize information sign.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Rosalinda has a retail shop that sells a variety of fruits such as mangoes and apples. She has run this business for two years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of fruits to sell.
Rosalinda is a new member of Kiva partner, HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is 27 years old, married to Stephen and is blessed with two children. Carolyne runs a chicken farm in busy Kitengela town, distributing chickens to dealers in restaurants. She has been running this business for the last two years and earns an income of 52,000 KES per month.
Carolyne was introduced to Kiva partner,  KADET LTD, by a client of KADET. She has a good credit history in KADET and is now applying for her second loan, of 60,000 KES. With her loan, she plans to build a poultry house and add more chicks to rear. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her child.
In the future, Carolyne hopes to start rearing layers. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: to build more chicken houses and buy more chicks.

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en:
Arnel is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 
Arnel provides a motorcycle, or habal-habal, service. He has run this business for 20 years. He has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the gasoline to keep the motorcycle running.
Arnel is a new member of Kiva partner, HSPFI. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a 43-year-old widowed woman. She has four children aged between 17 and 23. She describes herself as resolute. 
Rosa operates a greengrocery store. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a trading center and her primary customers are householders. She describes her biggest business challenges to be fluctuating sales, high transport costs, and inadequate supplies. She will use her 50,000 KES loan to add to her greengrocery stock. Her business goal is to open a wholesale grocery store in town within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be able to purchase and develop a plot of land.

loans.use: to restock her greengrocery store.

loans.name: Kang

texts.en:
Mrs. Kang is a 45-year-old divorced woman who has four children: two of them are married and live independently and the other two of them are single.  She is a hardworking woman who covers her family's expenditures.

Presently she has been generating a business as a rice seller in a market near her community. From this industry she can receive just about 5 dollars each day. She currently wants to apply for a loan from HKL, a Kiva partner. The aim of this loan is to use it to purchase a cow. She hopes that this trade will help her family gain additional profit.

She is very pleased with all the kind lenders that help her family. In the future she is expecting to have a larger house.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a 46-year-old woman and a mother of three children. She works in the direct sale of cosmetics. She sells perfumes, lipstick and lotion. Myrna’s husband works abroad and is her partner in paying her children's school fees.
Myrna has been in business for five years. She experiences obstacles, which might be seen as reasons for not continuing the business, but she just takes them as a challenge. Myrna wants to help her husband even in a simple way, that’s why she keeps on selling even when her customers do not pay on time. She believes that patience leads to success. 
Myrna is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to pay for the products that she purchases and then sells to her customers. She hopes to purchase more products to sell, which will increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products for resale.

loans.name: Herman

texts.en:
Herman is a 66-year-old widower who operates a butchery. He has been in this business for the past six years.
Herman was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET LTD, by a KADET client. This is his second loan. He paid his previous loan well and in good time. He intends to use his loan to buy 170 pieces of chicken, 20kg of pork and 20 pieces of fish, weighing 10kg, to add to his business stock. In this way, he hopes to diversify his business and deal with the sale of fish and pork.

loans.use: to buy 170 pieces of chicken, 20kg of pork and 20 pieces of fish for resale.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 32-year-old young man. He is married with three sons and two daughters. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a modest salary, and he also has another source of income from driving the taxi he owns. 
Mohammad wants to make some repairs to his taxi, but the amount of money he has isn't sufficient, so he wants to take a loan of $1,000 from Kiva partner, FATEN. When Mohammad gets the loan, which is to be repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to pay for making the repairs that the taxi needs. This will increase his taxi's efficiency and allow Mohammad to work extra hours and improve his family income and living conditions. 
Mohammad is photographed next to the taxi he owns.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to his taxi.

loans.name: Mbolu

texts.en:
Mbolu is a 42-year-old married man. He has two children aged 15 and 16. He describes himself as honest. 
Mbolu operates a trading store where he sells confectionery. He has been involved in this business for 12 years. His primary customers are retail shops. He describes his biggest business challenge to be difficult business finance. He will use his loan of 20,000 KES to purchase soda to sell in his trading store. He hopes that, in the future, he will be able to purchase a plot of land and develop residential units.

loans.use: to add soda to the products he offers for sale.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. He provides motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for 2 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools for maintenance and pay for gasoline.

Ronald is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools for maintenance and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy electronic devices

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 
Vicente provides a motorcycle, or habal-habal, service. He has run this business for three years. He has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the gasoline to run his motorcycle.
Vicente is a new member of Kiva partner, HSPFI. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Mahmadamin

texts.ru: Махмадамин житель города Вахдат. Ему 56 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Он более пяти лет предоставляет услугу такси. Махмадамин развозит людей по маршруту Душанбе – Вахдат. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en: Mahmadamin lives in the town of Vahdat.  He is 56 years old, married and has five children.  He has been providing a taxi service for over five years.  Mahmadamin transports people along the Dushanbe-Vahdat route.  He is requesting this loan to make repairs to his car.

loans.use: to make repairs to his car

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 52 and lives with his family of eight children in the Kitale area of western Kenya. Three of his children are still of school-going age. 
John has been in farming for ten years and currently employs one farmhand on his farm. His farm produces milk, maize and yoghurt, which he processes himself for the local market.
John has made a second loan request of 92,000 KES with Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo. He will use the loan to purchase and insure a dairy cow at 52,000 KES and use the remaining 40,000 KES to construct a modern dairy unit for his dairy animals. He says the loan will increase his income and enable him to educate his children.
John mentions the high cost of animal feed and fluctuations in milk prices as the challenges in farming.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and build a dairy unit.

loans.name: Edelisa

texts.en:
Edelisa is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Edelisa has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for two years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Edelisa is a new member of Kiva partner, HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ruth Achieng

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 7 years to 20 years. She describes herself to be passionate, tolerant, and God fearing. 

She operates a tailoring and dressmaking business where she provides dresses and ladies suits. She has been involved in this business for 11 years and employs 2 staff members. Her primary customers are local residents. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase tailoring materials for dressmaking. Her business goal is to sew uniforms and organizational trademarks on a large scale within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand the business to employ the trainees as full-time staff.

loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials for dressmaking.

loans.name: Kossi Adabadji

texts.fr:
Kossi  un homme âgé 32 ans. Il est est un célibataire sans enfants.  
Kossi travaille comme ferronnier  depuis 2006. Il achète du fer et l’utilise pour fabriquer divers objets pour revendre à ses  clients composés de toutes personnes. Il travaille seul dans son activité. 
Kossia requis son premier cycle de crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du fer à béton.
Dans les prochaines années, Kossi voudrait agrandir son activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit améliorer sa vie pour mieux s'occuper de sa famille.
texts.en: Kossi is a 32 year old single man without children. He has been working as an iron craftsman since 2006, making various objects that appeals to all types of customers. He works alone. Kossi is asking for his first loan from WAGES in order to purchase concrete reinforced iron (sometimes called rebar). In the coming year Kossi would like to increase the activity of his business, and use the profits to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: purchase iron

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

She has a retail shop that sells spices, noodles and food seasonings. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy vegetables and spices for resale.

Myrna is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and spices for resale.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is the mother of a 3-year-old son. She owns quarry land in Kitengela town. She has been in this business for the last year. 

This is her first loan with KADET LTD. With this loan Winfred plans to buy another piece of land for quarry mining work. 

The anticipated profits will be used to buy a lorry for transportation. She desires to be a prominent businesswoman and support her son.

loans.use: To purchase another place for quarry mining.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. She provides manicure and pedicure services. She has had this business for 2 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed for pedicures and manicures. Evelyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for pedicures and manicures.

loans.name: Estelle

texts.fr:
Estelle est une femme agé(e) de 38 ans. Elle est mariée å un revendeur. Elle a 2 enfants qui vont tous  à l’école. Le premier a 15 ans et le dernier a 12 ans.  
Estelle travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2007. Elle achète des mèches pour revendre à ses clients dont la plupart sont des femmes.  Elle travaille seule dans son commerce.
Estelle a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des mèches. Elle veut réinvestir les profits supplémentaires dans son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Estelle voudrait agrandir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Estelle, age 38, is married to a reseller. She has two children who both attend school. The oldest is 15, the youngest is 12. Estelle has been working as a reseller since 2007. She purchases hair extensions and resells them to a mostly female clientele. She works alone in her business.

Estelle is seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy hair extensions. She wants to reinvest the extra profits into her business. In the forthcoming years, she would like to expand her business. She says that with the profits, she intends to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more blouses and skirts for her business.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 40 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in the Philippines.  Arlyn has a retail shop that sells fruits, noodles, and  spices. She has had this business for two years. She is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy fruits and spices.

Arlyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Arlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and spices.

loans.name: Koamivi

texts.fr:
Koamivi est un homme âgé de 30 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a un enfant
Koamivi travaille comme frigoriste depuis 2003. Il achète des pièces pour froid qu’il utilise pour les prestations à ses  clients. Il travaille avec 3  membres employé(e)s et s’approvisionne au Ghana. 
Koamivi a requis son premier  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter 10 évaporateur, 6 compresseurs, 10 condensateurs
texts.en: Koamivi is 30 years old and married to a saleswoman. The couple have one child. Koamivi has been working as a refrigeration engineer since 2003, and has 3 employees. He buys refrigeration spare parts to repair his customers' fridges and gets his supplies in Ghana. Koamivi is requesting his first loan from WAGES so that he can buy 10 evaporators, 6 compressors and 10 condensers.

loans.use: to buy refrigeration spare parts.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 40 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in the Philippines. Evangeline has a retail shop that sells spices, fruits, and  noodles. She has had this business for three years. She is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy fruits and spices.

Evangeline is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Evangeline hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and spices.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is 51 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in the Philippines. Martina has a retail shop that sells fish such as sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for four years. She is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy fish.

Martina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Martina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, Eunice has operated a retail shop.  Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. Eunice dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

Eunice is requesting a loan for 40,000 KES, which she will use to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, and washing soap. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, and washing soap.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Akouvi est une femme âgée de 31 ans. Elle est mariée å un revendeur. Elle a 2 enfants.
Akouvi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2005. Elle achète et revend pour ses clients des produits de bébé pour  ses clients. Elle achète les produits à au grand marché de Lomé. Elle travaille avec 1 employé. 
Akouvi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter renforcer son activité.
texts.en: Akouvi is 31 years old and married to a salesman. The couple have 2 children. Akouvi has been working in sales since 2005. She sells baby products and works with one employee. She gets her supplies at the Grand Market of Lomé and is requesting her first loan from WAGES in order to restock on merchandise.

loans.use: to restock on baby products.

loans.name: Bukhtumur

texts.en:
Bukhtumur is 69 years old, married, and has two children.  He is a pensioner and lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent located in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His occupation is a driver in the public transportation system, which he has done for many years. His son recently married and Bukhtumur gave his own ger to his son as a wedding gift. Therefore, Bukhtumur needs his own new ger immediately. 

Bukhtumur is planning on building his new ger with his own hands in the Mongolian traditional way. Building the new ger requires a wall, which is made from wool, a wooden floor, which is made by the traditional method, and other ger parts. He is planning to finish it before the the start of winter. Bukhtumur is requesting a loan to purchase the materials needed to build his Mongolian ger.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build a Mongolian ger.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has two children. 

Jerry has a barber shop that provides hair cutting. He has had this business for four years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed for the barber shop.

Jerry is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Jerry hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the barber shop.

loans.name: Ashur

texts.ru: Ашур умная и честная женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать 1 ребенка. Она занимается шитьем национальных женских платьев. Данный бизнес принесет ей стабильный доход, и она хочет расширить данный бизнес и ещё больше хочет получать прибыли.  Кроме этого она занимается переработкой сухофруктов. Она еще получает денежные переводы из России. Ашур хотела бы получить займ для покупки тканей с целью расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Ashur is a smart and honest woman.  She is married and is a loving mother of one child.  She is involved in sewing national women's dresses.  This business brings her a stable income, and she wants to expand this business and make a larger profit.  Ashur is also involved in processing dried fruits.  She also receives money transfers from Russia.  Ashur wants to obtain a loan for the purchase of fabrics in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Lydia

texts.fr:
Lydia est une femme âgée de 55 ans. Elle est mariée  å un revendeur. Elle a 4 enfants.
Lydia travaille comme couturière  depuis 1981. Elle achète des tissus et pagnes pour confectionner des habits pour les revendre à ses clients. Elle achète les tissus et pagnes  au grand marché de Lomé. Elle travaille avec 3 employés. 
Lydia a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des tissus et pagnes pour confectionner des habits pour revendre.
texts.en: Lydia is 55 years old and married to a salesman. The couple have 4 children. Lydia has been working as a seamstress since 1981 and has 3 employees. She buys fabrics and "pagnes" (traditional sarong-like clothing) at the Grand Market of Lomé and is requesting her first loan from WAGES so that she can restock on materials in order to make clothing for resale.

loans.use: to buy fabric and pagnes.

loans.name: Chhlak

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhlak, 49 years old, is a local rice cultivator who lives in the Pouk District of Seim Reap Province. She has no life partner as she has been divorced from her husband for several years. Currently, she lives with her son who works as a domestic casual worker and always shares the small income which he gets from his job with Mrs. Chhlak.

Besides the farming business, she also raises some piglets in a cage behind her house. She is able to earn an average income of around 1.50 USD each day. With her requested loan, Chhlak will be purchasing more piglets for continuing her pig-raising business, mending her old cage and will also use it to buy some farming materials for planting a rice crop with the rainy season coming now.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets, to mend her old cage and to also buy some farming materials for planting a rice crop

loans.name: Gantsooj

texts.en:
Gantsooj, 32, is a gas fitter and he has been doing this job for four years. He lives with his two children and his wife in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. His wife is a nurse and currently she is in maternity leave.  

Gantsooj has been building a new small house inside his fence. He should be finished before the this winter begins, because Mongolian winter is freezing cold and the ger has no insulation in the walls. 

Therefore he is taking a loan to finish building his house and will dedicate his loan to purchase the building materials needed to finish the house.

loans.use: To purchase the building materials needed to finish building the house.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Marcelina has a retail shop that sells fish like milk fish and sardines. She has had this business for two years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell.

Marcelina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marcelina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Ne'maa

texts.en:
Ne'maa is a religious, conservative woman, so her son, Mahmoud, who is 22 years old, was photographed in the picture instead.    

Ne'maa is 51. She is married and has five sons and two daughters. Some of her sons are employed and sharing her expenses. 

Ne'maa has a project of selling clothes, and she wants to purchase a large quantity of clothes for the coming winter season so she will have a better collection with which to compete. 

Ne'maa has some money, but it is not enough to pay for the clothes, so she needs to take a loan of $500 from FATEN. 

When Ne'maa gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will pay to purchase new season clothes for sale. She hopes this will increase her income and improve her life conditions.

loans.use: To purchase large quantity of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Janepher

texts.en:
Janepher is 28 years old and married to Andrew, who is a policeman. They have three children. She operates a retail shop and a mobile phone-based money transfer business (called M-PESA) in Kitengela town. 

She has been in this business for the last four years. This is her first loan from  KADET Ltd. She plans to add more stock to the shop like sugar, washing detergent, salt with KES 20,000 of the loan and buy float for the M-PESA business worth KES 10,000. 

The anticipated profits will be used to open another branch at Kitengela. She desires to open a wholesale store in the near future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, washing detergent and salt worth KES 20,000 and to add float for the M-PESA business for KES 10,000.

loans.name: Lotis

texts.en:
Lotis is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Lotis provides motorcycle or habal-habal transport. Her husband is the driver. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy gasoline and tools for maintenance of the motorcycle.

Lotis has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lotis hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and tools for maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Дилшод проживает в районе Кумсангир. Он женат. Ему 22 года. У него двое детей. Дилшод имеет среднее образование. При доме у него имеется большой участок земли, где он выращивает овощи и сеет пшеницу. Этим видом деятельности занимается шесть лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян.
texts.en: Dilshod lives in the Qumsangir district.  He is 22 years old, married and has two children.  Dilshod has a secondary education.  He has a large plot of land by his house, where he grows vegetables and sows wheat.  He has been in this business for six years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.
 
Erlinda has a retail shop that buys and sells bananas and coconuts. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy bananas and coconuts for sale.

Erlinda is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 44 years of age, married and has four children. Her husband operates their tricycle for passengers’ transportation. 

Juanita is determined mother who has the attitude and dreams to succeed. She has been managing her sari-sari store business for 10 years. She usually sells snack foods and drinks to people in their village. Through the income she generates from the business, Juanita sustains her children's necessities. 

Juanita is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy coffee, sugar and milk to sell. Juanita hopes to get higher profits to further support her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar and milk to sell.

loans.name: Vohid

texts.ru: Вохид женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Он трудолюбивый и целеустремленный человек.  Более 17 лет занимается в сфере бизнеса. Он открыл свой магазин и там продает продукты питания. Данный бизнес принесет ему хороший доход. Благодаря бизнесу его жизнь улучшается, и с прибылью он отремонтировал свой дом. Вохид мечтает получить максимальный прибыль, с этой целью он старается расширить свой бизнес. Он запрашивает займ в размере 1000$ США для покупки нового ассортимента продукты питания.
texts.en: Vohid is married and is a loving father of three children.  He is a hard-working and goal-oriented person.  He has been involved in business for over 17 years.  Vohid opened his own store and sells food products there.  This business brings him a good income.  Thanks to this business, his life is improving, and he was able to repair his house with the profits.  Vohid dreams of making the maximum profit and tries to expand his business to achieve this goal.  He is requesting a loan in the sum of $1000 for the purchase of a new assortment of food products.

loans.use: to purchase a new assortment of food products

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has two children.
 
Edward has a bakeshop that sells breads, pastries and cakes. He has had this business for five years. 

He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making breads.

Edward is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Edward hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making breads.

loans.name: Garun

texts.en:
Garun is 37 years old. He lives in Tsovagygh village in the Sevan area, with his wife, two children and his parents. 

Garun’s wife stays at home and takes care of their one- and two-year-old daughters. 

Garun and his parents have been engaged in cattle-breeding since 1998. On their farms Garun and his parents breed cows, calves and bull calves as well. They sell milk to procurement agencies and sell beef to butchers. The sale of agricultural produce allows Garun to support his family.
 
Garun intends to develop his farm and start to breed sheep. Therefore, he is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy 10 sheep and also five calves for his farm. Garun is sure that developing his farm will lead to higher profits in the future.

loans.use: To buy 10 sheep and also five calves for his farm.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмире 50 лет, разведена и имеет одного сына. В 1991 году Гульмира начала свой бизнес в животноводстве с начальной суммой 12,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день, благодаря упорству и настойчивости Гульмиры, ее хозяйство приносит доход в сумме около 8,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  Для снижения расходов на корм, летом Гульмира отправляет скот на пастбище, а осенью продает откормленный скот на местных рынках. Для дальнейшего развития бизнеса, Гульмира  обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом на покупку скота. В будущем, Гульмира планирует также увеличить свое хозяйство за счет покупки жеребят  и бычков.
texts.en: Gulmira is 50 years old, divorced and has one son.  Gulmira started her animal husbandry business in 1991 with a capital of 12,000 som (KGS).  Today, thanks to her persistence and diligence, her farms brings in an income of about 8,000 som (KGS) per month.  To reduce her animal feed expenses, Gulmira sends livestock to a pasture during the summer and sells fattened-up livestock at local markets during autumn.  To further develop her business, Gulmira requested a loan in the sum of 50,000 som from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock.  She plans to also expand her farm by buying foals and calves.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Almida

texts.en:
Almida, age 58, has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products from Natasha and Avon. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy clothing and beauty products from Natasha and Avon to offer for sale. 

She and her husband have one child.

Almida has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Almida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing and beauty products from Natasha and Avon to offer for sale

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en: Shirly, a 57-year-old widowed mother of one, lives in the Philippines where she has been operating a food shop selling banana and sweet potato cues for 10 years. A new member of HSPFI, she has  requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more bananas and sweet potatoes to make banana cues. In the future, Shirly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas & sweet potatoes to make banana cues.

loans.name: Anta

texts.fr:
Née il y’a 50 ans à Diankabou,  Anta est mariée, mère 4 enfants, et réside avec son époux et ses enfants, dans la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Anta après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée il y a vingt ans, à cette activité d’achat et de vente d’habillements et de vêtements. Elle mène son activité dans son quartier et dans d’autres villes, où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ un an. Elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel. Le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.
Elle compte acheter avec ce présent prêt, 15 pièces de pagnes wax, 5 complets de tissus brodés. Elle achète ses marchandises à Bobo Dioulasso (au Burkina Faso) avant de les coudre chez les tailleurs brodeurs pour les revendre, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement d’hommes et des femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Anta was born in Diankabou 50 years ago and is married with 4 children. She lives with her husband and their children in the town of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Anta started trading in clothing 20 years ago, after several failed business ventures. She sells clothes in her local district and surrounding towns, and is much in demand due to the high quality of her products. She decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution about a year ago in order to be able to satisfy increasing customer demand. She is now requesting a second loan from the institution, having fully repaid the previous one. She will use the money to buy 15 Pagnes Wax (traditional, sarong-like clothing) and 5 suits of embroidered fabric. She normally buys her merchandise in the town of Bobo Dioulasso (in Burkina Faso), before getting it tailored and ready for resale. She sells the clothes for cash or credit to a mixed clientele of men and women.

Anta thinks she will achieve a monthly profit of around 100 000 FCFA, which will mainly be used to increase her business, contribute to her family's expenses and pay off the interest on her loan.

loans.use: to buy Wax pagnes and embroidered fabrics.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan, age 24, always seems to succeed in every move he makes in his business. He runs his business inside the local school in his village, vending snack foods, juices, soft drinks, and school supplies. Juan has been in this business for two years and earns approximately PHP 5,000 a month.

Juan's loving wife is his partner in managing their school canteen business. They strive to improve their business and gain a higher income. They have one small child.

Juan dreams of finishing the building of the house in which the family lives. This is his primary goal for working hard and managing the business well, since he is determined to finish their house through the profits he and his wife earn. 

Juan also wants to expand his business by offering a greater selection of school supplies. He is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy school supplies like paper, notebook, ballpoint pens, and pencils to offer for sale.

loans.use: o buy school supplies like paper, notebook, ballpoint pens, and pencils to offer for sale at the local school in his village

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, age 57, is a widow with five children. She operates a boda-boda (motorcycle) transport business. She has been in the business for three years. She also engages in catering to earn more income. Previously, she used to run a retail shop. 
 
Margaret has become more focused in her business since she joined Faulu Kenya. She has improved her business by accessing business loans.  

She is requesting a loan of 69, 000 Kenya shillings to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her transportation business

loans.name: Twitezimbere/rbr Group

texts.fr:
Jean Bosco fait partie du groupe Twitezimbere / RBR et sur la photo est celui qui a l'argent. Le nom du groupe signifie « let’s develop ourselves ». Il est né au Rwanda et il a 34 ans. Il est marié avec 6 enfants de 9 mois à 12 ans, dont 3 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire. 

Jean Bosco est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de cultiver à temps. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Bosco voudrait récolter une grande quantité de riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean Bosco is a member of the group called Twitezimbere / RBR and in the photo he is the one holding the money. The name of the group means "let’s develop ourselves". He was born in Rwanda and he is 34. He is married with six children whose ages range from 9 months to 12 years old. Three of them are enrolled in school. His own educational level is six years of primary school. 

Jean Bosco grows rice. This is his first loan with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer and pay for labor for his rice crop. 

His strategy for growing his business is to plant his crop in a timely manner. In the coming years, Jean Bosco would like to harvest a big quantity of rice. With the profit, he intends to educate and care for his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer and pay for laborers for his rice crop.

loans.name: Nilfa

texts.en:
Nilfa, age 43, operates a food shop that sells snacks like banana cue and sweet potato cue. These popular snacks are deep-fried bananas or sweet potatoes coated in caramelized brown sugar. She has run this business for five years. 

Nilfa and her husband have five children.

She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 in order to buy the raw ingredients needed for making her fried snack foods. 

Nilfa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Nilfa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy the raw ingredients needed for making fried banana and sweet potato snack foods to offer for sale

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Né il y’a 33 ans à N’Golo-Diassa situé à environ 6 km de la ville de Sikasso, Monsieur Moussa est marié et père de deux garçons, il réside avec sa femme et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie dans son village natal.
Monsieur Moussa est un mécanicien de profession depuis plus de huit ans, qui dispose également dans le souci de faciliter à ses clients de s’acquérir de pièces d’occasions d’origines et de qualités, un magasin d’achat-vente de pièces détachées (des bielles, arbre à came, pistons, jantes, carters, vilebrequins, culasses etc). Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant deux années Il  est à son cinquième prêt individuel et tous les quatre prêts précédents ont été remboursés correctement.
Il compte acheter avec ce cinquième  prêt, un  véhicule casse pour en extraire un grand lot de pièces détachées. Les marchandises (pièces)  qui sont issues  du démontage sur place de véhicules casses, sont revendues dans son magasin au sein de son garage, en détail et généralement au comptant.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 125 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Moussa, age 33, was born in N'Golo-Diassa, which is located about 6 km from the city of Sikasso. Married with two sons, he lives with his wife and their children in a large, extended traditional family in his hometown.

An auto mechanic by trade, Mr. Moussa has been practicing this activity for over eight years. He also buys and sells quality genuine spare parts and runs a shop where his customers can purchase used parts such as connecting rods, camshafts, pistons, rims, crankshafts, cylinder heads, etc. He is in high demand due quality of his merchandise.

To meet the needs of a growing customer base, he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso two years ago. This is his fifth individual cycle, and all four previous loans were repaid properly. 

With this fifth loan, he plans to buy a scrap vehicle in order to extract a large number of spare parts. The parts obtained from scrap vehicles dismantled on site are sold in the shop he runs from his garage, at retail, usually for cash.

He expects to earn a monthly profit of 125,000 FCFA, which he will use primarily to help with the family expenses and pay the interest on the loan. Any remainder will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy scrap cars and sell the spare parts

loans.name: Diosdana

texts.en:
Diosdana, age 34, makes milk bars that she offers for sale in her retail shop. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 in order to buy the raw ingredients needed for making milk bars. 

She and her husband have one child. 

Diosdana is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Diosdana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy the raw ingredients needed for making milk bars

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson, age 57, practices livestock farming to earn a living. He has been farming for two years. To earn additional income, he is employed as a mason. He and his wife have seven children.

Since he became a member of Faulu Kenya, Johnson has been able to expand his business. He hopes eventually to practice large-scale farming in the future. 

Johnson has requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 Kenya shillings in order to buy goats and cows.

loans.use: to buy goats and cows

loans.name: Tahirou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Tahirou a 47 ans, marié et père des deux enfants, il réside avec sa famille dans une grande famille traditionnelle dans la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Tahirou après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès,  s’est initié  au commerce d’articles de quincaillerie notamment à l’achat-vente de ciments et de matériels de constructions  tels les fers il y a maintenant trois ans. Autrefois son activité était mené de façon ambulante, maintenant il y a deux ans qu’il dispose de sa propre Quincaillerie au quartier Sanoubougou I Extension, mais dès l’ouverture de sa quincaillerie sa clientèle composée généralement d’entrepreneurs mais également de ferrailleurs a considérablement augmenté. 
Pour satisfaire cette clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il a déjà bénéficie d’un premier crédit qui ont été correctement remboursé. Ainsi ce deuxième prêt lui permettra d’acheter à Bamako auprès des grossistes, 15 tonnes de ciments, 100 barres de fer 6, 90 barres de fer 8, et 80 barres de fer 10. 
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 300 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Monsieur Tahirou is 47, married and the father of two children. He lives with his family in a big traditional family dwelling in the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

After having tried out various businesses without success, Monsieur Tahirou began selling hardware three years ago, especially buying and selling cement and construction materials such as iron. He used to run his business as an ambulatory salesperson, but for two years now he has had his own hardware shop in the Sanoubougou I Extension area. Since the opening of his hardware whop, his clientele, composed generally of builders but also blacksmiths, has grown considerably. 
 
In order to satisfy this growing clientele, he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom he has already had one loan which he correctly reimbursed. This second loan will permit him to purchase, in Bamako and from wholesalers, 15 tons of cement. 100 bars of #6 iron, 90 bars of #8 iron,  and 80 bars of #10 iron. 

He expects to make a monthly profit, based on this loan, of 300,000 F CFA which will be used essentially to grow his working capital for his expenditures, contribute to family expenses, and pay the interest on his loan.

loans.use: to buy hardware items.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud, a 40-year-old married father of four sons and two daughters, has a stone-cutting facility as the main source of family income, supplemented by  his work in agriculture. Mahmoud wants to prepare for the coming agricultural season by purchasing seedlings, and so is requesting a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. The loan, to be repaid on a monthly basis, will enable him to prepare well for the coming season, thereby leading to increased crop yields and income improvement that will benefit his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings to prepare for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Jaycel

texts.en:
Jaycel, age 24, runs a retail shop that sells Vita Plus products like food supplements and energy drinks. She has had this business for two years. She lives with her husband and children in San Miguel, Iligan City.

She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of food supplements from Vita Plus to offer for sale. 

Jaycel is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Jaycel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of food supplements from Vita Plus to offer for sale

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona, age 46, operates a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has run this business for 10 years. She and her husband have five children.

She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale. 
 
Alona has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Alona hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr:
Âgé de 38 ans, Monsieur Daouda est marié et père de 5 enfants. Il réside dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie dans la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrtive de la république du Mali). 
Daouda, qui est issu d’une famille de forgeron, n’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école, s’est vite initié à cette activité familiale depuis  son très jeune. Il achète de l’aluminium et de la tôle noire 30, à Bamako pour les  transformer en objets de toutes sortes : bascule 500kg, 300kg, 200kg, bascule Minikilo, les couteaux Ronmelle, les  marmites, théières, poêles  casseroles, fourneaux, etc.).
Nanti d’une expérience inédite et d’une bonne moralité, il est sollicité par ses clients compte tenu de la qualité de ses services. 
Aujourd’hui, faute de moyens il se voit incapable de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle qui est de plus en plus forte. Ainsi, il intègre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à un premier prêt, qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 500kg d’aluminium, 3 feuilles de tôle noire.
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 200.000 FCFA. Les revenus qui découleront de l’exercice de cette activité lui permettront de rembourser son prêt et faire face aux besoins de sa famille, ensuite investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
At 38 years of age, Monsieur Daouda is married and the father of five children. He lives in a big traditional extended family in the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

Daouda,  who comes from a family of blacksmiths, did not have the good fortune to attend school and quickly got into the family business when he was still very young. He buys aluminum and black sheet metal #30 in Bamako and makes them into all sorts of objects:  scales for 500kg, 300kg, and 200kg, "Minikilo" levers, "Ronmelle" knives, pots, tea pots, stoves, pans, braziers, etc. 

Endowed with a great deal of experience and a good character, he is much in demand with his clients, in view of the good quality of his services. Today, lacking means, he is not able to satisfy the demand of his clientele, which is ever-growing. This, he joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom he is on his first loan which will be used to buy 500 kg of aluminum and three pieces of black sheet steel.

With this loan he expects to make a monthly profit of 200,000 F CFA. The income from his business will allow him to reimburse his loan and provide for his family, investing any remainder back into his business.

loans.use: to buy aluminum and sheet metal.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 42 years old, married, and has two children.  He earns a living from his taxi business.  He has operated the business for six years and has employed one person.  He is also employed as a tour guide.  He was previously employed as a driver.  

Bernard works hard in his business so as to provide for his children.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to save his money and manage his business.

Bernard hopes to open a tour company in the future.  He has requested 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy a car for his taxi business.

loans.use: To buy a car for taxi business.

loans.name: Irene Cris

texts.en:
Irene Cris is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Irene Cris has a pigpen and she sells matured & full-grown pigs. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy animal feed for her pigs.

Irene Cris is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Irene Cris hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for pigs.

loans.name: Mariame

texts.fr:
Madame Mariame a plus de  60 ans et vit avec son époux et ses 10 enfants, dans la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrtive de la république du Mali).
Après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, Mariame s’est finalement initiée à l’activité de restauration depuis maintenant plus de vingt ans. Son activité est menée tous les jours devant le domicile conjugal à Sanoubougou I et à la gare routière de Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses sauces. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant sept ans. Elle est à son huitième prêt individuel et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce présent prêt des pièces de bœuf : 20 têtes de bœuf, 40 pâtes de boeufs, et 60 queues de bœuf. Elle achète ses marchandises sur le marché de Sikasso et dans les villages environnants, auprès des bouchers. Elle en fait des bonnes sauces qui seront vendues au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes, de jeunes (célibataires) surtout de noctambules. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Madame Mariame is over 60 and lives with her husband and her 10 children in the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

After having tried various businesses without success, Mariame finally got into preparing cooked food for sale and has been doing this for more than 20 years. Her business is open every day in front of her family home in  Sanoubougou I and at the bus and taxi station of Sikasso where she is much in demand with her clientele because her sauces are so good. 

In order to satisfy her ever-growing clientele, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso seven years ago. She is on her eighth individual loan and all the preceding loans were correctly reimbursed. 

With this loan she intends to buy 20 ox heads, 40 ox feet, and 60 oxtails. She buys her supplies in the Sikasso marketplace and the surrounding villages, from butchers.  She uses them to make delicious sauces that are sold for cash or credit to a clientele composed of women, young unmarried men, and especially those who are out strolling at night.
  
She expects to make a monthly profit of 75,000 F CFA which will be used essentially to contribute to covering family expenses, paying the interest on her loan, and reinvesting any remainder back into her business.

loans.use: to buy beef to cook and sell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice, 34,  is married and has one child.  She sells charcoal to earn a living.  She has been in the business for seven years.  She has experienced a lot of growth in her business since she joined Faulu Kenya. This is because she has been trained in business management and she has been able to access business loans.

Eunice hopes to open other outlets of her business so that she can generate more income.  With 50,000 Kenya shillings, she will add stock of charcoal.

loans.use: To add stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Florida has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages . She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Florida has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, Florida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Rajaa'

texts.en:
Rajaa', age 30, operates her own grocery store business. She and her husband have three sons and two daughters and live in the city of Jenin in Palestine. Her husband is a baker with a decent salary, and her grocery business is another source of income for the family.
 
Rajaa' wants to improve her grocery by purchasing additional grocery items to offer for sale. She does not have a sufficient amount of money for what she needs, so she is requesting a loan in the amount of $3,000 from FATEN. 

When Rajaa' receives this loan, which will be repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to purchase a greater variety of groceries and have a better selection to offer for sale. In this way, she will sell more and increase her income so as to help raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of groceries and have a better selection to offer for sale

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Rosanna has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stock from AVON & NATASHA to sell.

Rosanna has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Rosanna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from AVON & NATASHA to sell.

loans.name: Djumagul

texts.ru: Джумагуль  48 лет, вдова, воспитывает дочь – школьницу. Джумагуль начала свой бизнес в 1991 году, использовав свой стартовый капитал в сумме 5,000 сом (KGS)на покупку коровы.  На сегодняшний день, Джумагуль  зарабатывает около 7,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи мясных и молочных продуктов.  Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Джумагуль запросила кредит в компании «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры»  в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота.  Доходы от кредита Джумагуль планирует вложить в обучение ее дочери.
texts.en: Djumagul is 48 years old, widowed and is raising a teenage daughter. Djumagul started her business in 1991, using 5000 som (KGS) as starting capital to purchase her first cow. Currently, Djumagul makes 7000 som (KGS) a month from meat and dairy sales. To further expand her business and purchase more cattle, Djumagul is asking for a loan of 55,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and partners". Profits from this loan Djumagul is planning to spend on her daughter's education.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Yacouba

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yacouba est âgée de 48 ans, mariée et père de 5 enfants. Il résidant avec son épouse et ses enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie dans la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Yacouba après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,  s’est finalement initié à cette activité de tailleur couturier il y’a 24 ans. Son atelier de couture se trouve à Wayerema Zone où il dispose déjà 5 machines dont 2 machines de broderie et 3 machines simples. Monsieur Yacouba qui est couturier et brodeur est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses services. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est à son un premier prêt qui lui permettra d’acheter, 1 machine de broderie au Burkina. 
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 125 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Monsieur Yacouba is 48, married and the father of five children. He lives with his spouse and his children in a big traditional extended family in the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

After having tried several businesses without success, Monsieur Yacouba finally began working as a tailor 24 years ago. His tailoring workshop is located in Wayerema Zone and he already has five sewing machines: two for embroidery and three normal ones. 

Monsieur Yacouba who is both a tailor and an embroiderer is much in demand with his clientele for the excellent quality of his services. Wishing to satisfy that ever-growing clientele's needs, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom he is on his first loan which will permit him to buy an embroidering machine in  Burkina (Faso). 

He expects to make a monthly profit of 125,000 F CFA with this loan, which will essentially be used to contribute to covering family expenses, paying the interest on his loan, and investing the rest back into his business.

loans.use: to buy a new embroidery machine.

loans.name: Nova

texts.en:
Nova is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

 Nova has a  buy and sell business focusing on buying and selling of processed food like hotdogs, longganiza and tocino. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy stock to sell.
Rosanna is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rosanna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy additional processed food like hotdogs, longganiza and tocino for selling

loans.name: Begilda

texts.en:
Begilda is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Begilda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Begilda has been a member of HSPFI since 1998. In the future, Begilda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap, biscuits, and batteries  for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy various items for resale.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.en:
Eusebia is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Eusebia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Eusebia has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Eusebia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Abishyizehamwe/mht Group

texts.fr:
