Boniface fait partie du groupe Abishyizehamwe / MHT et sur la photo c'est celui qui a de l'argent. Le nom du groupe signifie « ceux qui sont ensemble ». Il est né au Rwanda et il a 25 ans. Il est marié. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire. 

Boniface est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de cultiver à temps. Dans les prochaines années, Boniface voudrait récolter une grande quantité de riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit de construire une maison d’habitation et payer le minerval de ses petits frères.
texts.en:
Boniface is part of the group called Abishyizehamwe / MHT and in the photo he is the one holding the money. The name of the group means "ceux qui sont ensemble" (Those who are together). He was born in Rwanda and he is 25. He is married and his level of education is six years of primary school. 

Boniface grows rice. This is his first loan with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice crop. 

His strategy for the growth of his business is planting his crop in a timely manner. In the next few years, Boniface would like to harvest a large quantity of rice. With the profit, he wants to construct a house to live in and pay the school fees for his younger brothers.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice crop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie, age 41, runs a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 11 years. She lives with her husband and their three children in Dampil, Lagonglong, Misamis Oriental. 

She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 in order to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale. 
 
Julie  has been a member of HSPFI since 2005. In the future, Julie  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pepper, bitter ball (pea eggplant), and rice to offer for sale at the local market

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 65 years old, married, and has one child.  She lives in the Philippines. Rosita has a shop that sells green and yellow bananas and coconuts. She has had this business for five years. Rosita is requesting a loan for 4,000 PHP, which she will use to buy bananas and coconuts.

Rosita has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bananas and coconuts.

loans.name: Abdujabor

texts.ru: Абдучабор умный и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и  любящий отец 4 детей. Он занимается транспортными услугами более 8 лет. От данного бизнеса он получает хороший прибыль.  Раньше он взял автомобиля марки «Газель» в аренду и продолжал свой бизнес. Постепенно зарабатывая денег, он купил себе автомобиль для своего бизнеса. Абдучабор хотел бы получить займ для покупка запчастей для своего автомобиля.
texts.en: Abdujabor is a smart and goal-oriented man. He is married and a loving father of four children. He has been running a profitable taxi business for the last 8 years. At first he was renting a "Gazelle" car as his taxi vehicle, but after saving money for a while he was able to purchase his own car. Abdujabor would like to take out a loan to purchase spare parts fro his vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Eila

texts.en: Eila is 41 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is married and has eight children aged 18 to 25; six are presently in school and live at home, while the others are living on their own. For the past  three years she has been selling  peppers, oil, and bitter ball (a local vegetable) in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has many customers, but  she  has insufficient goods,  so  she is requesting a loan to purchase more peppers, oil, and bitter ball for her business. She plans to build her own house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more peppers, oil, and bitter ball (a local vegetable) for her business.

loans.name: Gretchie

texts.en:
Gretchie is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Gretchie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Gretchie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gretchie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Sonnie

texts.en: Sonnie  is 39 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is married and her husband works as a security guard and she has four children ages 1 to 15. Two of them are presently in school, and the younger ones are not yet in school. All of them  live at home. For the past  five years she has been selling  oil, rice and bitter ball (a vegetable)  in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has many customers. A problem she is facing is goods shortage. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, rice, and bitter ball for her business. She plans to buy  a plot of land and  build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, and bitter ball (a local vegetable) for her business.

loans.name: Sergo

texts.en:
Sergo was born in 1960. He lives in Achajur village, Tavush regeon. He is married and has three children: two sons and a daughter. Sergo’s sons live and work in the Russian Federation, and his daughter is jobless and lives with her parents. His wife is a disabled person and she doesn’t work. 

For 16 years, Sergo worked at an Ijevan road-building organization as an operator. Since 1992, Sergo has been engaged in animal breeding and land cultivation. On his farm he breeds cows, chickens, ducks, turkeys and rabbits; on his plot of land he grows wheat and oats. Also, Sergo grows various fruits and vegetables in his garden. 

Sergo and his family use agricultural produce (such as milk, butter, cheese, fruit, vegetables and wheat) for personal use, but when there happens to be a heavy crop they sell a part of their production. Farming allows Sergo to provide for his family. 

This is Sergo’s 4th loan from Nor Horizon and now he is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy some calves and fodder for his farm animals. Sergo has never delayed his repayments.

loans.use: To buy some calves and fodder for his farm animals.

loans.name: Ibolya

texts.ru:
Иболя – из Виноградово, Западная Украина. Она торгует одеждой секонд-хенд на центральном рынке своего родного городка. Три торговые точки Иболи находятся практически в самом центре рынка, конкуренция практически отсутствует. Иболя работает с этим типом товара уже 13 лет. 

Иболя планирует использовать кредит в сумме 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить 200 килограмм одежды, увеличить количество реализуемого товара, а, значит, и свой доход. Иболя не хочет оставаться на одном месте, она хотела бы развиваться дальше и расширять свою торговлю. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Ibolya is from Vinogradovo, Western Ukraine.  She sells second-hand clothing at the central market of her native town.  Three of Ibolya's retail outlets are located practically right in the center of the market, where there is no significant competition.  Ibolya has been working with this type of merchandise for 13 years.  She plans to use the loan in the sum of 20000 hryvnia to purchase 200 kilograms of clothing, increase the quantity of her merchandise and, therefore, increase her income.  Ibolya does not want to remain in one place, but wants to develop and expand her business further.

loans.use: to buy 200 kilograms of clothing

loans.name: Orelyn

texts.en:
Orelyn is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Orelyn has a retail shop that sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON to sell.

Orelyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Orelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 43 years old, married, and has three children who attend school.  He has been rearing pigs as his primary business and also owns a workshop where he makes speakers for sale. He has been in business for the last 10 years. 

John was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET client. This will be his first loan. He will use the loan to buy pig feeds and timber for his workshop.

In the future, John hopes to open another workshop.

loans.use: to purchasea pig feeds and  timber for his workshop

loans.name: Vasyl

texts.ru:
Василь родом из Западной Украины. Он женат, живет в городе Ивано-Франковске. В свое время Василь торговал автомобилями на автобазаре. Но вот уже 12 лет Василь работает в службе такси и предоставляет пассажирские перевозки на территории Украины. Его ежемесячный доход составляет 6 000 гривен. Параллельно с работой в такси, Василь в первой половине дня работает в службе теплокоммунэнерго, в отделе работы с должниками.  

Используя кредит в размере 10 000 гривен, Василь планирует отремонтировать некоторые элементы кузова своего автомобиля, заменить салон и подготовить машину к продаже. В ближайшем будущем он планирует продать это транспортное средство и приобрести более новое, возможно, минивэн, который бы работал на метане или дизеле. Оставшуюся часть прибыли Василь планирует использовать для того, чтобы обустроить свое жилье. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Vasyl is from Western Ukraine.  He is married and lives in the town of Ivano-Frankivsk.  Previously, Vasyl used to sell cars at an auto market.  Since then, Vasyl has been working in the taxi service for 12 years and provides passenger transportation services on the territory of Ukraine.  His monthly income is 6000 hryvnia.  Parallel to the taxi work, Vasyl spends first half of his day working for a utility service, in the collections department.  Using the loan in the sum of 10000 hryvnia, Vasyl plans to repair various parts of his car trunk, replace the interior and prepare the car for sale.  In the near future, he plans to sell this car and purchase a newer vehicle, possible a minivan, that runs on methane or diesel.  Vasyl plans to use the remaining part of the profit to fix up his home.

loans.use: to repair various parts of his car trunk, replace the interior and prepare the car for sale

loans.name: Levy

texts.en:
Levy, age 32, runs a business selling and delivering mineral water in gallons. She has had this business for four years. She lives with her husband and their three children.
 
She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 in order to be able to sell and deliver gallons of mineral water using a multipurpose cab. 
 
Levy has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Levy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to be able to sell and deliver gallons of mineral water using a multipurpose cab

loans.name: Benedeta

texts.en:
Benedeta runs a grocery business. She has been in this business for five years and she has one employee. 

She started by selling only bananas, and she was able to add a variety of fruits and vegetables after getting a loan from Faulu Kenya. Her business has improved as a result, and she can now afford to pay school fees for her children without strain.

Benedeta hopes to expand her business into wholesale in the future.  

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 40,000 Kenya shillings in order to buy tomatoes, bananas, onions, and potatoes to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, bananas, onions, and potatoes to offer for sale

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix, age 37, is a chemist. His business is located at the busy Kitengela market and his customers are the local area residents. He gains a monthly income of 36,800 KES. He intends to use the loan to purchase more medicine. He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a KADET customer.
 
He is married to Louise, who is a dentist. Together they have two children, aged eight and five years. 

Felix will use the anticipated profits to open a wholesale store and to open other branches of his existing business.

loans.use: to purchase medicines to stock in his pharmacy business

loans.name: Florentino

texts.en:
Florentino is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 

Florentino has a cassava garden from which he harvests & sells dried cassava in due time. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fertilizers for cassava plants.

Florentino is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Florentino hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for cassava plants.

loans.name: Nuripa

texts.ru: Нурипе 56 лет, замужем и воспитывает одного  сына. Нурипа с мужем – фермеры, занимающиеся животноводством с 1991 года. Стартовый капитал в сумме 18,000 сом (KGS) был использован Нурипой для покупки коров. Благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости Нурипы, ее мужа и их сына Ислама, их хозяйство стало успешным. В целях дальнейшего развития семейного бизнеса, Нурипа обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота.
texts.en: Nuripa is 56 years old, married and is raising one son. Nuripa and her husband are farmers and have been raising livestock since 1991. In the beginning they used a starting amount of 18,000 som (KGS) to purchase animals for their herd. Due to the family's diligent work and perseverance the cattle business flourished and became profitable. In order to expand the family business further, Nuripa turned to "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) which she will use to purchase additional animals.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Fatoumata Diouma

texts.fr:
Madame FATOUMATA DIOUMA est une femme mariée âgée de 39 ans qui vit avec ses 3 enfants et son époux dans une famille nucléaire dans la ville de Ouelessebougou.
Fatoumata n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école  pour des raisons familiales, très tôt s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente d’articles divers  tels les habits, les pochettes, les chaussures, les parures,  etc. 
FATOUMATA est à son premier prêt individuel, qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, quelques douzaines d’habits pour enfants et 50 paires de chaussures de différentes sortes, auprès des grossistes du marché de Ouelessebougou. Elle effectue sa vente à la maison, au  marché de Ouelesseboubou et en ambulant dans les différents quartiers de la ville, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Madame FATOUMATA espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt, aider le mari à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et réinvestir le reste dans les activités. 
FATOUMATA ambitionne diversifier davantage ses activités et devenir grossiste en habillements et chaussures à Ouelessebougou
texts.en:
Fatoumata Diouma is 39 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children in the town of Ouelessebougou. Fatoumata was unable to go to school because of personal reasons and became interested in sales at an early age, selling a variety of products like clothes, wallets, shoes and jewellery. She sells her merchandise from her home and the Ouelessebougou market, as well as on the street. Her mixed clientele of men and women buy her products for either cash or credit.

Fatoumata is requesting her first individual loan in order to buy a few dozen batches of children's clothes and 50 different pairs of shoes from the wholesalers at her local town market. She hopes to achieve an average monthly profit of 40 000 CFA francs which she will use to repay her loan and help her husband with the family's expenses, as well as reinvesting some into her business. She wants to be able to diversify her range of activities and become a wholesaler of clothing and shoes in Ouelessebougou.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Keko

texts.en:
Keko has been a farmer for the last ten years. He is 42 years old, married, and a father of four school-going children.

He learned about KADET LTD from the marketing done by the KADET staff in his area of abode. This is his third loan which he plans to use to buy  farm supplies. 

He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in farming and buy a bigger farm. His dream is to be the best and a well-known farmer in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en:
Restituta is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with two children. 

Restituta has a food shop or "carenderia" that sells "adobo" & "afritada". She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands to sell.

Restituta has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Restituta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 37, married, and has a five-year-old child.  She runs a salon to earn a living.  She has been in the business for six years and has employed two people.  She also does poultry and pig farming to supplement her income.  Previously, she used to sell clothes.  She was able to open a salon after getting capital from Faulu Kenya.

Lucy hopes to open a hair-dressing college in the future.  She needs a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy hair blow-dryers.

loans.use: To buy hair blow-dryers.

loans.name: Marecil

texts.en:
Marecil is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Marecil has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Marecil is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marecil hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice, age 28, is a hard-working businesswoman who has been running a retail shop for the past two years. To earn additional income, she rents out houses.

Beatrice and her husband are blessed with one child. 

Over the next five years, she wants to become financially stable. Her dream is to build a permanent business premise. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 30,000 Kenya shillings in order to buy sugar and cooking fat to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy sugar and cooking fat to offer for sale

loans.name: Karoline

texts.fr:
Madame KAROLINE est une femme mariée de 37 ans, qui vit dans une famille nucléaire à Ouéléssébougou.
KAROLINE quitta l’école très tôt pour des raisons de mariage, afin de s’insérer dans la vie économique, elle  intégra le programme  crédit de Soro Yiriwaso pour entreprendre la vente de boissons de façon ambulante.
Après quatre prêts tous bien remboursés, elle est à son cinquième prêt individuel, qu’elle  compte utiliser pour acheter et se constituer un stock important de boissons pour une longue période sans rupture.
Elle est approvisionnée sur place par  livraison de son fournisseur et espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  cent dix milles (110.000)  qu’elle utilisera pour le paiement de ses échéances et subvenir à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
Madame KAROLINE ambitionne dans les jours à venir, avec l’appui de Soro Yiriwaso être un dépositaire de boissons pour faire la vente en gros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Karoline is a married 37-year-old woman with five children who lives in Ouéléssébougou with her husband and children.  She left school very early to get married, and in order to contribute economically, she is participating in Soro Yiriwaso's credit program in order to sell soft drinks on the street.

After four loans which were all repaid, she is on her fifth individual loan, which she plans to use to buy and build up a large stock of soft drinks to last a long period of time.  She buys her stock locally through delivery from the supplier and hopes to make an average monthly profit of one hundred and ten thousand (110,000) FCFA, which she will use to pay her bills and daily expenses.

Mrs. Karoline hopes, with the support of Soro Yiriwaso, to one day be a bulk seller of soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Richard has a shop that sells bananas & coconuts for copra. He has had this business for four years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy bananas & coconuts to sell.

Richard is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Richard hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy bananas & coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is a hard-working, married business man aged 31. For the last two years, he has been operating a business selling clothes to earn a living. He works hard in his business so that he can improve his living standards.  In the next 5 years, he wants to manage a boutique. He is requesting a loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings to buy clothes. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya because he has managed to access business loans.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Salif Zan

texts.fr:
Monsieur  SALIF ZAN  est âgé de 39 ans et vit avec ses cinq.enfants et son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à Ouelessebougou.
SALIF ZAN n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat stockage vente de céréales. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant de céréales. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement           remboursé le deuxième prêt il est à son troisième individuel  qui servira à acheter, 5 tonnes de céréales (maïs, haricot, mil, fonio) auprès des paysans producteurs de SOUGOULA et environnants qu’il gardera pendant au moins 3 mois. Il vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako.
SALIF ZAN espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 75 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mr Salif Zan, aged 39, lives with his five children and his wife in a traditional family in Ouelessebougou. He did not have the opportunity to attend school. At a very young age he took an interest in income generating activities, in particular buying, storing and selling cereals. He learnt this activity from his uncle on his mother's side who used to be a great cereal merchant.

In order to satisfy his ever increasing clientele, Salif Zan decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. After having paid off his second loan on schedule, he applies for his third individual loan which he will use to buy 5 tons of cereals (corn, beans, millet and fonio) from farmers in Sougoula and nearby villages. He will store the cereals for at least three months. He usually sells wholesale to merchants in the large cities, such as Bamako.

Salif Zan expects to make an average profit of 75,000 CFA francs a month, which will be used to pay off the loan. Any money left over will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Meriam has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Meriam has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Meriam hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Ominajon

texts.ru: Оминахон умная и честная женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать 4 детей. Её муж занимается услугами таксиста на местном городе. Она сама занимается откормом скота. Она успешно продолжает данный бизнес более 11 лет и у неё очень хороший опыт. Она имеет 6 голов овца и 3 голов корову. Она получает хороший доход от данного бизнеса, прибыль который она получила,  она отремонтировала свой дом. Оминахон запрашивает займ для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Ominajon is a smart and honest woman. She is married and a loving mother of four children. Her husband is a taxi driver in the nearby town. Ominajon herself raises cattle for sale. She has been running her business for the last 11 years and has a lot of experience taking care of animals. Her herd consists of six sheep and three cows. The business is profitable and she was able to repair the family home using income from cattle sales. Ominajon is asking for a loan to purchase more cattle in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 38 years old and married to Mary. Together they have five children aged seven, nine, 11, 13 and 15 years. He runs a hardware shop as his primary business. He has been in the business for the past 15 years. He gets a monthly income of KES 8,000.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD . He plans to use the loan amount to pay school fees for his children. His dream is to expand his hardware store and educate his children to a higher level of education.

loans.use: to pay school fees for  his children

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 38 years old and married with three children. To earn a living, she runs a grocery stall. She has operated the business for eight years. She has retained her business because of the financial support from Faulu Kenya. Previously, she was in farming. Esther hopes to have a fully established business within five years so that she can generate more income for her family. With 40,000 Kes, she will buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Reika

texts.en:
Reika is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with children. 

Reika has a retail shop where she buys & sells dried fish per kilogram. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stock of dried fish in different kinds.

Reika is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Reika hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of dried fish in different kinds.

loans.name: Without Money Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Without Money” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Fatmata.  Fatmata is age 35; she was born in Makeni city where she is currently residing together with her husband and two children.  Her husband is a monthly wage earner and her children are attending primary school.  For 10 years now, Fatmata has been selling locally produced foodstuffs like "gari" (quick-cooking food made out of cassava roots), rice, beans, etc.  With this loan, Fatmata will buy the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: to buy "gari", rice, beans, etc. wholesale to add to her business inventory.

loans.name: Sitan

texts.fr:
Madame S. est une femme âgée de 30 ans qui vit avec un enfant, son époux et d’autres parents dans une famille traditionnelle élargie à OUELESSEBOUGOU.
S. n’a pas été à l’école pour des raisons sociales. Très tôt elle s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente de produits alimentaires tels les condiments alimentaires. S. a 2 ans d’expérience dans cette activité de commerce, d’où sa bonne réputation et renommée  à OUELESSEBOUGOU et environs.
Après avoir correctement remboursés son premier prêt, elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel, qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, différents colis de condiments alimentaires (concentrée de tomate, oignons, sel de cuisine, ails, tomate fraîches, gombo, épices, poivres, poivrons, choux, aubergines, courges, etc), auprès des grossistes à Bamako (capitale du Mali) et des paysans producteurs de Ouelessebougou. Elle effectue sa vente à la maison et au  marché de Ouelessebougou, en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Madame S. espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt, aider le mari à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mrs S., aged 30, lives with one child, her husband and other relatives in a traditional extended family in Ouelessebougou. She did not attend school for social reasons. At a very young age she took an interest in income generating activities, in particular buying and selling food products, such as food condiments. Mrs S. has 2 years' experience in this activity, hence her good reputation and renown in Ouelessebougou and surroundings.

After having paid off her first loan on schedule, she applies for her second individual loan which she will use to buy various kinds of food condiments (tomato purée, onions, cooking salt, garlic, fresh tomatoes, gumbo, spices, pepper, peppers, cabbage, eggplants, squashes, etc.) from wholesalers in Bamako, the capital of Mali, and farmers in Ouelessebougou. She sells retail, for cash and credit, out of her home and at the market in Ouelessebougou to a clientele made up of women and men.

Mrs S. expects to make an average profit of 40,000 CFA francs a month, which will be used to pay off the loan and help her husband with family expenses. Any money left over will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy food condiments.

loans.name: Saidjafar

texts.ru: Саиджафар проживает в районе Кумсангир. Ему 43 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его дети не работают. Сам Саиджафар занимается торговлей на рынке. У него имеется магазин, где он продает музыкальные диски. Этим видом деятельности он занимается три года. Кредит берет для покупки DVD и MP3 дисков.
texts.en: Saidjafar lives in the Qumsangir district.  He is 43 years old, married and has four children.  His children do not work.  Saidjafar is involved in sales at the market.  He has a store, where he sells music disks.  He has been involved in this business for three years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of DVD and MP3 disks.

loans.use: to purchase DVD and MP3 disks

loans.name: Timmy

texts.en: Timmy is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. Timmy has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Timmy is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Timmy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en: Anastacia is 44 years old, married and has four children. She is able to raise her children with the income she gets from dairy farming. Now, it's five years since she started farming. She also runs a grocery stall to supplement her income. She has grown the business through the financial support from Faulu Kenya hence improving her living standards. Anastacis has requested for 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Rebecca has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy fish to sell. Rebecca has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Rebecca hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her business by buying more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a hard-working business lady aged 21 and the single mother of one. For the last two years, she has been operating a business selling clothes to make a living. She has witnessed a lot of growth in her business since she joined Faulu Kenya. In the next 5 years, she wants to become successful in her business. She is requesting for a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Timap Bifo Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Timap Bifo” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Kadiatu aged 31. She was born in Koidu city but she is currently residing in Makeni together with her husband and four children. Her husband is a businessman. One of her children is attending primary school and two are in secondary school. For many years Kadiatu has been selling gara lappers (locally dyed clothes). With her share of this loan, she is going to buy materials, ink, candles, powder, caustic soda, white cotton, etc. in order to produce a larger quantity of gara clothes for sale.

loans.use: to buy materials, ink, candles, powder, caustic soda, white cotton, etc. in order to produce a larger quantity of gara lappers (locally dyed clothes) for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his crops and perform maintenance on a vehicle

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 34 years old, married, and has two children. He runs a motorbike transport business to earn a living. He has been in the business for only one year. He also does farming to supplement his income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his money and retain his customers because he has been trained on good customer care. 

Francis hopes to grow his business in the future. He has requested 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Safarmo

texts.ru: Сафармо проживает в районе Кумсангир. Ей 35 лет. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Сафармо имеет среднее образование. Уже четыре года как она занимается растениеводством. В основном она выращивает овощи для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Safarmo lives in the Qumsangir district.  She is 35 years old, married and has five children.  Safarmo has a secondary education.  She has been involved in agriculture for four years.  She primarily grows vegetables for sale.  Safarmo is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Fearness Group

texts.en:
Rugiatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Rugiatu was born in Makeni city about 47 years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple has four children, two of whom are attending primary and secondary schools.

Rugiatu sells palm oil, rice, and fish. She has been doing this business for 21 years now. 

With the help of this loan, Rugiatu and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Rugiatu will use her share of the loan, 1,500,000 Leone (SLL), to buy fish, palm oil, and rice for resale.

loans.use: to buy fish, palm oil, and rice for resale

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 37 years old, married and has two children in school.  He does welding so as to earn a living for his family.  He started the business ten years ago and has employed one person.  He also does farming to supplement his income.  

David has grown his business with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya.  Now, he needs 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a welding machine.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine

loans.name: Mamikon

texts.en:
Mamikon was born in 1967 in the village of Gandzakar, Tavush Region. Mamikon is married and has two school-age children, a son and a daughter. Since 1993, Mamikon and his wife have been engaged in farming. On their farm they breed cows and pigs, and grow fruits and vegetables. Mamikon apportions his farm produce for his family's use and also sells some of it to fellow villagers. Mamikon produces high-quality dairy products that are always in great demand from his neighbors. Agricultural activity permits Mamikon to provide for his family.
 
Now he is seeking a 1,000,000-Armenian-dram (AMD) loan to buy two cows and a large lot of fodder for his cows and pigs. This is Mamikon’s second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to buy two cows and a large lot of fodder for his cows and pigs

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti has operated a food stall business for the past six years, selling on a retail level to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces her primary business challenge in the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

She and her husband have six children, three of whom still attend school. The family owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

With her Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and washing detergents to offer for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and washing detergents to offer for sale

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 35 years old, married, and a father of two.  He works as a mechanic to earn a living.  He has been in the business for over ten years.  He has been able to educate his children with the income from the business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to grow his business.
William hopes to expand his business for more income generation.  He has requested 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy vehicle spare parts.

loans.use: To buy vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Laneh Kuru Group

texts.en:
Mohamed is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mohamed was born in Makeni city, about 56 years ago. He is married to a trader and the couple has seven children who are attending primary, secondary and tertiary institutions. Mohamed has been a businessman for 25 years now. He sells groundnuts (peanuts), rice, palm-oil, gari (fast food made out of cassava roots), etc. 

With the help of this loan, Mohamed and his group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Mohamed will use his share of the loan, 1,000,000 Leone (SLL), to buy the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts, rice, palm-oil, gari, etc. at wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en: Rosalyn is 39 years old, married and has two children who are 19 and 18 years old. She earns a living as a farmer in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato, helping her husband grow rice on their land. She also raises pigs in their backyard, working hard to support her family. She is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, insecticides and other farm supplies. Her goal is to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ephantus

texts.en: Ephantus, a hardworking 27-year-old unmarried businessman, has been selling second-hand items such as refrigerators and televisions to earn a living for the last two years. He has grown his enterprise since becoming a member of Faulu Kenya, and in the next five years wants to expand it. Ephantus is now requesting  a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a refrigerator and television.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and television for his business.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es: El Sr. Marcelino es cliente antiguo  desde  el año 2009, esta casado con la se señora Olga la cual  también tiene un negocio  es comerciante que viaja  a otro departamento a comprar su mercaderia, tiene 3 hijos que  se encuentran en  edad escolar,  el  cliente vive  en la zona de Vino Tinto de la ciudad de  La Paz. El Sr. Marcelino   vende ropa deportiva y chamarras de segunda mano,  el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de  mercadería ropa deportiva y chamarras por mayor, el cliente es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable el cliente esta contento y agradecido con la institución por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Sr. Marcelino has been a longtime client since 2009. He is married to Sra. Olga who also has a business. Marcelino is a merchant who travels to another department to buy merchandise. He has three children who are of school age. Marcelino lives in the District of Vino Tinto in the city of La Paz. He sells sportswear and secondhand jackets.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of sportswear and jackets in bulk. Marcelino is a hardworking and responsible individual who is pleased and grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to purchase sportswear and jackets in bulk.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a hardworking businessman who is 24 years old and married. For the last two years, he has been managing a carpentry business to earn a living. He plans to use this loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy timber. He has used his previous loans from Kiva field partner Faulu Kenya to boost his business.

loans.use: to buy timber

loans.name: Omar  Javier

texts.es: El Sr.   Omar  es cliente antiguo de la institución, se encuentra en el tercer ciclo de su crédito,  se dedica a la elaboración de riquísimas comidas que vende en su restautante,  su esposa es la señora Elena que también le ayuda en el  negocio de venta de comida  tiene dos hijos que están en edad escolar  y en su tiempo libre  sus  hijos colaboran en  los que haceres del negocio, El crédito  lo invertirá en  el  equipamiento de su negocio compara  muebles y sillas. El negocio queda ubicado en una de las avenidas más concurridas de la zona del tejar  El Sr Omar  se siente  feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado. En la foto el Sr. Omar se encuentra acompañado de su esposa.
texts.en:
Sr. Omar is a longtime client of Emprender who is in his third loan cycle. He prepares delicious meals that he sells in his restaurant. His wife Sra. Elena helps him in his business of selling food. They have two children who are of school age and spend their free time helping them with the tasks involved in running their business.

This loan will be invested in equipment for his business, such as furniture and chairs. Omar’s business is located along one of the busiest avenues in the District of El Tejar. He is pleased and grateful to Emprender for the support that has been provided. In the photograph, Sr. Omar is accompanied by his wife.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for his restaurant.

loans.name: Amba D Group

texts.en:
Patrick is the facilitator of the Amba D group. Patrick and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Patrick takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and grow enough food to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Patrick had an excellent maize yield harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Patrick was only able to harvest 9 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Patrick will save for the future and invest in raising livestock.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Patrick and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

In 2012, the members of Amba D group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is  a farmer in Litein area of South Rift,  Kenya. He is aged 40 and  married with six children aged between 14 and below two years. He has been in farming for six years with his milk and maize produce going to the local market. He runs a retail shop in the local market for additional income.

Jonah has requested a loan of 70,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo  to purchase  a dairy cow. He says the improvement of income to due an additional dairy cow will enable him provide  basic needs to the family. He adds that the dairy farming business will continue to grow. 

He is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for the previous three loans.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 52, married and has three children.  He has been operating a timber yard for two years, and has three employees.  Previously, he sold firewood.  Since joining Kiva field partner Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business hence improving his living standards.  Peter hopes to register his business as a company so that it can be eligible to compete for tenders.  He plans to use this loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more timber and renovate his business premises.

loans.use: to buy more timber and renovate his business premises

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a resident and a farmer  in Nyamira, South Rift, Kenya. He is aged 55 and is married with 11 children, with only the last three still schooling. He has been in mixed farming for 20 years and currently employs three farmhands and produces tea, beans, millet and milk for the local market.

Andrew has requested for a second loan of 90,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost his farming by buying an additional dairy cow at 60,000 KES and more poultry for 30,000 KES.  He is optimistic the two businesses will continue to grow and uplift his family living standards as well as enable him to buy a motor vehicle to make deliveries to the market and earn more from transportation.

He laments the poor road networks as well as rampant animal and crop diseases.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is a married woman who lives in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato with her family. She is a farmer who primarily grows rice to sell. Shirly also runs a sari-sari (variety) store business where she sells various items like vinegar, detergent, soap, and soy sauce.

Shirly requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.She hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 45 years old, married to Humphrey, and they have six children ages 25, 20, 16, 13, 11, and four. She runs a retail shop and she has been in business for seven years and right now her monthly income from the business is KES  36,800.

She is borrowing a loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD to buy maize flour, sugar, and sweets for sale. This is her second loan and she successfully repaid her previous loan.  

Her hopes and dreams are to diversify to dairy farming for milk production and to offer her children the best education.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, sugar, and sweets for sale.

loans.name: Maréme

texts.fr: Commercante dans une ville située a quelques kilometres de la capitale du Sénégal, elle s'active dans le commerce depuis plus de 5 ans. Achetant ses marchandises en Gambie et en Mauritanie, ce ptêt lui permettra de faire les voyages beaucoup plus facile et d'acheter des produits comme des portables, des produits divers telque du savons des parfums.Cela a pour but de renforcer son stock de marchandises et de répondre a l'attente des clients quotidiennement. Ce prêt aussi va l'aider a améliorer son fond de roulement en lui permettant d'anticiper sur les événements auquel les clients sollicitent ses produits.
texts.en: A saleswoman in a town located at some kilometers from the capital of Senegal, she has been working in sales for more than five years. As she buys her merchandise in Gambia and in Mauritania, this loan will allow her to make much easier journeys and buy products like cell phones, various products such as soaps and perfumes. The goal of this is to bolster her stock of merchandise and respond daily to the needs of her customers. This loan will also help her improve her working capital by allowing her to anticipate events for which customers request her products.

loans.use: permettre de faire du commerce

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 38-years-old, married and has two school-going children. He has been operating a retail shop for two years.  So far, he has employed one person in the business.  He also practices livestock farming for more income.  He is very grateful to Faulu Kenya because he used his previous loans to educate is wife who is currently a teacher.

Peter hopes to grow his business into a wholesale operation in the future.  He has requested for 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, maize flour and beans.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour and beans.

loans.name: Davis Daniel

texts.en:
David describes himself as cheerful and determined. He operates a construction equipment company where he supplies and rents out construction equipment. He has been involved in this business for four years. He reports that his biggest business challenge is the high cost of wood. 

He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to purchase more construction supplies. 

His business goal is to open a hardware shop and become an all-round supplier within five years.

loans.use: to purchase more construction supplies

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.es:
María tiene 30 años es soltera y tiene un hijo de 9 años, vive en O. con su familia. María de describe como una persona humilde y sencilla con deseos de seguir adelante.

Trabaja sola en la confección de bolsos, bufandas y pantalones. Es la primera vez que trabaja con Fodemi, el crédito que solicitó es para la compra de hilo de seda y tela para la confección de pantalones lo cual le ayudará a incrementar su producción, sus ventas y sus ingresos.

Su sueño es poder construir su casita y darle la educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
María is 30 years old and has a nine-year-old son. She lives with her family in Otalvo. María describes herself as a humble and simple person who has the desire to move forward.

She works alone making bags, scarves, and trousers. This is the first time she has worked with FODEMI. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy silk thread and fabric for making trousers. This will help her increase production, as well as her sales and her income.

Her dream is to build a small house and provide her son an education.

loans.use: to buy fabric and silk thread for making trousers.

loans.name: Indatwa 14 Zone 1 Group

texts.fr:
Jacques fait partie du groupe Indatwa 14 Zone 1. Le nom du groupe signifie « célèbre ». Il est né au Rwanda et il a 53 ans. Il est marié avec 8 enfants de 11 à 27 ans, dont 7 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire. 

Jacques est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de semer une bonne qualité de riz. Dans les prochaines années, Jacques voudrait récolter une grande quantité de riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jacques is a member of the group called  Indatwa 14 Zone 1. The name of the group means "célèbre" (famous)  He was born in Rwanda and he is 53. He is married with eight children whose ages range from 11 to 27, of whom seven are enrolled in school. His own level of education is six years of primary school. 

Jacques grows rice. This is his first loan with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice crop. 

His strategy for growing his business is to sow good quality rice. In the years to come, Jacques would like to harvest a large quantity of rice. With his profit, he intends to educate and care for his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice crop.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 43-years-old, married and has three children.  She runs a retail shop so as to earn a living.  She has operated the business for four years.  She has retained the business because of her good customer care. She also does livestock farming to supplement her income.  She is grateful to Faulu Kenya because she has been able to access business loans.

Mary hopes to expand her business into a wholesale operation in the future.  She has requested 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy water tank and begin selling water from his store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chicken feed as well as cloth from which to make dresses to offer for sale

loans.name: Margaret Ayiela

texts.en:
Margaret is 48 years old, married woman, and has five children.  She operates a retail shop located in a shopping center where she sells sugar, bread, flour, soda, cakes, and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. 

Margaret is requesting a loan for 30,000 KES to purchase maize to sell in her store. She describes her biggest business challenges to be inflation and low purchasing power. Her business goal is to expand her business into wholesale within five years. In the future, she wants to buy a plot n to put up rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase maize.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a farmer working in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Teresita plants rice crops and vegetables on her land. She sells her harvest to the people in her community. 

Teresita and her husband have four children. She works hard to improve her business and support her family. 

She has requested this loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds. Teresita hopes to have a progressive life and to raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, age 43, operates a retail shop. She was introduced to KADET by a KADET client. This will be her first loan through KADET. She intends to use the loan funds to open another general store as well as to add more stocks of sugar, salt, flour, and soap to her current shop. 

She and her husband Gilbert have seven children. 
 
Her hope is to become a successful businesswoman and to be financially stable.

loans.use: to open another general store as well as to add more stocks of sugar, salt, flour, and soap to her current shop

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 42-years-old, married and has three children. He does quarrying so as to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years. He has employed two people in his business. He also does farming to supplement his income. 
 
Bernard joined Faulu Kenya so that he could easily access business loans. He has used his previous loans to improve his business. He has requested  30,000 Kenya shillings to rent land for quarrying.

loans.use: to rent land for quarrying.

loans.name: Marta Lucia

texts.es: Marta desde hace un año tiene una tienda en le primer piso de su casa y con ayuda de sus hijos ella sostiene su negocio, actualmente su negocio está creciendo y por esto ella quiere tener muchos mas productos para ofrecerle mas variedad a sus clientes, de esta manera su calidad de vida mejorará y la de su familia también, además su sueño de tener un minimercado se acercará cada día más.
texts.en: Marta has operated a store on the first floor of her house for one year.  Her children help with maintaining the business.  At the moment, her business is growing so she wants to have as many products as possible so that she can offer her customers more variety.  This will allow the quality of life for herself and her family to improve.  In addition, her dream is to have a mini-market with each passing day.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Jhasmin Rosalina

texts.es:
Jhasmin tiene 20 años vive en Otavalo con su Mamá, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Se describe como una mujer alegre y divertida con deseos de superarse.

Trabaja con su mamá en la confección de ropa. Es el segundo crédito que le solicita a Fodemi y va a invertir en la compra de una máquina industrial para la confección de la ropa, lo cual le dará calidad a su producto y de esta manera incrementará sus ventas.

Su sueño es poder construir su casa y seguir manteniendo a su mamá.
texts.en:
Jhasmin is 20 years old and lives in Otalvo with her mother. She is single and has no children. Jhasmin describes herself as a fun and outgoing woman who wants to succeed.

She and her mother work together in making clothes. This is the second loan she has requested from FODEMI. She will invest the money in the purchase of an industrial sewing machine for making clothes. This will allow her to produce a quality product so that she can increase her sales.

Her dream is to build a house where she can continue supporting her mother.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Infiliatah

texts.en: Infiliatah is a hardworking business lady aged 48. She is married and blessed with four children. For the last nine years she has sold clothes to make a living. She has retained her business because of her good customer care. In the next 5 years she wants to expand her business. Her dream is to buy a piece of land. She is requesting for a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
Los deseos de Mary Luz de progresar han sido el motor que la impulsan a trabajar día a día, desde hace 10 años se dedica a la cría y engorde de cerdos, lo cual se ha convertido de gran ayuda puesto que debe generar ingresos debido a que su familia cuenta con bajos recursos económicos, a sus 32 años de edad Mary Luz tiene un hijo de 9 años a quien espera ofrecerle un mejor futuro, y aunque hoy cuenta con la fortuna de tener el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja en la ganadería de leche y le ayuda con los gastos de hogar, ella sueña con llegara  tener una granja agropecuaria con la cual generar empleos y ayudarle a mas campesinos de la región.

Mary Luz es una luchadora que a pesar de haber tenido dificultades de orden público y dificultades por el invierno ha salido adelante y enfrentado la adversidad con mucha tenacidad. Sin embargo en este momento Mary Luz solicita un préstamo con el cual adecuar las canoas de alimentación y comprar más cerdos de engorde ya que se acerca la temporada navideña y allí sus ventas aumentan, generando más ingresos, ocasionando que su calidad de vida y la de su familia mejore notablemente
texts.en:
Mary Luz desires to makes progress, which is the reason that motivates her to work day after day.  For the past 10 years she has been raising and fattening pigs, since it has become a great help in generating revenue for her low-income family.  Mary Luz is 32 years old and has a nine-year-old son for whom she wants to provide a better future.  Today she is fortunate to have the support of her husband, who works on a dairy farm and helps with the household expenses.  She dreams of having her own farm so that she can generate jobs and help more farm laborers from the region.  

Despite the difficulties related to dealing with regulations and the winter weather, Mary Luz is a fighter who presses forward and confronts adversity with great tenacity.  At the moment, she is requesting a loan to repair her feeding troughs and to buy more pigs for fattening.  Her sales should increase as the Christmas season approaches.  This will generate more income, causing the quality of life for her family to improve significantly.

loans.use: to buy pigs and to repair the feeding troughs.

loans.name: Brayan

texts.en: Brayan is a hardworking business man aged 33. He is married and blessed with one child. For the last six years he has been selling mobile phone accessories to earn a living. He has grown his business because of his hard work and determination. In the next 5 years he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy mobile phone accessories.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Olga Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora Olga tiene 64 años de edad, tiene una pareja actualmente, tiene 2 hijos, uno de los cuales mayor es edad y la menor esta cursando la educación secundaria.
La Señora Olga se dedica hace 3 años a la elaboración y venta de comidas, da servicios de almuerzo y desayuno. Se inicio en pequeñas cantidades y luego fue creciendo gracias a que sus mismos clientes le hacían promociones con otras personas y de esa forma fue creciendo de a poco, ella se considera una buena cocinera. Comenta que todos los días empieza desde muy tempano con la elaboración de sus comidas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus comidas, como ser carne, pollo, harina, fideos, arroz y otros. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le da, pues de obtener el crédito le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Señora Olga is 64 years old and is currently in a relationship. She has 2 children, one of which is an adult and the other a minor studying at secondary school.

Señora Olga has for the last 3 years prepared and sold food. She makes lunch and breakfast. She started off small and then started to grow thanks to the recommendations of her customers to other people. In this way she grew a little at a time. She considers herself to be a good cook. She says that she starts preparing the food very early evvery day.

She is asking for a loan to buy raw materials to make her meals such as meat, chicken, flour, noodles, rice and other products. She is thankful to the Fundacion for the opportunity given her as obtaining the loan will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, flour, noodles, rice and other products.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en: Gerald is a business man aged 33. He is married and blessed with three children. For the last year he has been selling plastic basins and sandals to make a living. In the next 5 years he wants to expand his business. His dream  is to manage a wholesale business. He is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to renovate his business.

loans.use: to renovate his business premise.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 64 years old, married and the father of several children, all of whom are married. For the last 20 years, he has earned a living by running a food kiosk. He was introduced to KADET by one of our clients and is applying for his first loan, which he will use to buy more items to sell to his customers and buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. In future, he hopes to own a large shop and be a very successful farmer.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to his customers and supplies for his farm.

loans.name: La Unión Hace La Fuerza Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “La Unión hace la Fuerza”, lo conforman 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran verdulerías, bazar, taller de bicicletas, venta de herramientas de cerrajería, materiales de construcción y venta de ropa. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Colina, ciudad de Santiago.
Clara integrante del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la segunda fila de pie, en el tercer lugar de izquierda a derecha, vistiendo un sweater color verde manzana, su cabello es castaño claro y está tomado.
Se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida rápida, desde hace 7 años, comenta que disfruta mucho de su negocio. 
Actualmente cuenta con un carro que lo ubica en su casa, ahí vende sándwich, pan amasado, papas fritas, sopaipillas y completos. Trabaja de lunes a viernes por las tardes. Está muy contenta, ya que cuenta con mucha clientela y esto le ha permitido que le vaya bien. 
Sus insumos los compra en la vega (feria para comerciantes).
Con el crédito comprará sacos de papas, aceite por litro, kétchup, mayonesa, bolsas de papel, envases para completos, servilletas, entre otros. 
Las metas en su negocio son tener un local establecido, en el cual pueda atender a sus clientes para que consuman en el local, además ubicarlo en el ante jardín de su casa. Comenta que solo le falta construir un pequeño local, ya que cuenta con una picadora de papas y un horno industrial completo.
Clara vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de 23 años de edad, quien sufre una discapacidad. 
Sus sueños son tener su propio local, para generar mayores ingresos y con esto poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. 
Clara está muy contenta y agradecida con los servicios brindados por Fondo Esperanza, y que este apoyo ha sido fundamental, al igual que las amenas reuniones que comparte con el grupo del Banco comunal. 
Colina es una comuna de la región metropolitana (donde está Santiago, capital de Chile) ubicada al norte de la misma. Actualmente es centro de importantes inversiones, principalmente en el área agro industrial, debido a la instalación de grandes e importantes empresas, que de paso entregan un gran número de empleos a la comunidad. Es también un área de parcelaciones de agrado, lo que ha contribuido a aumentar considerablemente el número de habitantes. También cuenta con espacios adecuados al turismo, tales como termas, deporte en la Laguna Piedra Roja y montañismo.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is called "La Unión hace la Fuerza”  ("Union Makes Strength").  It is made up of 17 entrepreneurs who work in different fields, including a greengrocers, a variety store, a bicycle workshop, selling locksmith tools, construction materials and selling clothes.  They are all part of the Colina community in the city of Santiago.

Clara is a member of the Communal Bank group.  In the photo, she's standing in the second row, third from the left, wearing an apple-green sweater.  Her hair is light-brown and pulled back.

She works preparing and selling fast food, which she has been doing for the last seven years. She comments that she really enjoys her business.  She currently has a cart which is located at her home, which is where she sells sandwiches, homemade bread, french fries, sopaipillas (fried pastries) and hot dogs.  She works evenings, Monday through Friday.  She is very happy, and has many customers which has allowed things to go well for her.

She buys her supplies at the "vega" (the market for retailers).  With the loan, she will buy sacks of potatoes, oil by the liter, ketchup, mayonnaise, paper bags, hot-dog containers, napkins, and other things.

Her goals for her business are to have an established premises, where she can tend to her customers and they can eat on-site.  She would put it in the back garden of her home.  She comments that the only things she needs now is to build the small location, as she already has a potato-chopper and a full industrial oven.

Clara lives with her husband and her 23 year old son, who has a disability.

Her dreams are to have her own premises, so as to earn better income and with this be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

Clara is very happy with and grateful for the services that are provided by Fondo Esperanza.  This support has been fundamental for her, as has been the meetings of the Communal Bank group.

Colina is a community in the metropolitan region (which is Santiago, Chile's capital), located in the north of the region.  It is currently the center of some important investments, mainly in the agro-industrial area, thanks to the presence of large and important companies which bring a large number of jobs to the community.  It is also an area of pleasant sub-divisions, which have contributed to the considerable growth in the number of inhabitants.  It also has things suitable for tourists, such as spas, fun in the Red Stone Lake, and mountain-climbing.

loans.use: to buy sacks of potatoes, oil by the liter, ketchup, mayonnaise, paper bags, hot dog containers, napkins and other things.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a hard-working businesswoman who is married and blessed with two children. 

For the last four years, she has been selling clothing to make a living. She has retained her business because of her hard work and determination.  

In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothing.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel se desempeña en una empresa temporal de oficios varios y adicionalmente ella para incrementar sus ingresos vende mercancía a vecinos y compañeros de trabajo.

Ella se sueña con tener un almacén propio de venta de ropa para dejar de trabajar como empleada de oficios varios y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y para empezar a construir este gran sueño ella necesita comprar mas mercancía para ofrecerles a sus cliente mayor variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Maribel works for a temp agency doing miscellaneous jobs.  In order to increase her income, she also sells merchandise to neighbors and work colleagues.

Maribel dreams of owning her own clothes store so that she can stop working in miscellaneous jobs and improve her quality of life.  In order to build this big dream, she needs to buy more merchandise so that she can offer her customers a wider range of products.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Elicio German

texts.es:
Elicio Germán tiene 54 años de edad es casado vive con la esposa y con el hijo de tres años de edad en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Descripción de la Ventanilla  VRC Luchar para triunfar, se encuentra ubicada en el sector la poza, perteneciente a la ciudadela 10 de noviembre  Cantón Ventanas, Los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a diferentes labores tanto Agrícola como comercial.

Elicio tiene una mini tienda se dedica a la venta de productos como los víveres, harinas, bebidas gaseosas, productos para consumo humano. Los productos los compra en Ventanas y los vende en el negocio.

El crédito lo solicita para poder agrandar el negocio para adquirir más productos para poder venderlos, el crédito le ayudará muchísimo para poder cubrir las expectativas que tiene como comerciante.

El Sueño es poder superarse y llegar hacer una buena comerciante.
texts.en:
Elicio Germán is 54 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and 3-year-old son in Ventanas, in Los Ríos province.

The 'Luchar para Triunfar' community bank is located in La Poza sector, in 10 de Noviembre district, in Ventanas canton.  The members of the community bank work in different businesses, both agricultural and commercial.

Elicio has a mini-mart where he sells products such as provisions, flour, soda, products for human consumption.  He buys his products in Ventanas and sells them in his business.

Elicio is requesting this loan to expand his business and acquire more products to sell.  The loan will help him a lot in covering the expenses that he has as a retailer.

Elicio's dream is to do well and become a good salesman.

loans.use: to expand his business and acquire more products

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a hard-working businessman who is twenty-nine years old. He is married and blessed with one child.  

For the last year, he has been selling clothing to earn a living. He has grown his business through the financial support of Faulu Kenya. 

He is requesting a loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings to buy shirts and blouses.

loans.use: To buy shirts and blouses.

loans.name: Unidos Para El Futuro Group

texts.en: Yrene is a member of a loan group called Unidos para el futuro (United for the Future). Its members live in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo,  where running water is non-potable and electricity is unreliable. She is excited to be taking out her seventh loan in four years from Esperanza, because these loans have allowed her to buy more rice to sell to her customers. In the Dominican Republic, rice is often the day's main meal, which is why Yrene went into business buying rice wholesale and selling it in small bags, sometimes on credit. She uses her profits to reinvest in her business. She lives with her long-term partner and their three children in a very simple home in one of the poorest neighborhoods in their area. Despite her poverty, she is determined to care for her children and pay for the cost of their education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a single businessman who is twenty-nine years old. For the last five years, he has been selling shoes to earn a living. He has grown his business with the help of his previous loans through Faulu Kenya.  

In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy shoes.

loans.use: To buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Ramón Leonardo

texts.es:
El señor Ramón es de la ciudad de Pilar. El es comerciante, tiene una pequeña despensa, está casado, tiene un hijo que ya es mayor de edad con una profesión, es Licenciado en Análisis de Sistema, tiene casa propia, vive con su señora, es una persona muy activa responsable y trabajadora con muy buenas referencias en el barrio ya que es una persona muy servicial.
Desea poder seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y de esa forma surgir generando ingresos para su familia, ya que se siente muy a gusto con lo que hace. Además de eso comenta que todo su esfuerzo siempre es para ayudar a su familia en todo lo que el pueda.
El solicita el préstamo para la compra de azúcar, harina, fideo, arroz para el abastecimiento de su almacén. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda, pues es una ayuda para su micro emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Señor Ramón is from the town of Pilar. He is a merchant and has a small store. He is married and has a son who is an adult and a graduate with a degree in systems analysis. He has his own house and lives his wife. He is a very active, responsible and hardworking person with a very good reputation in the neighbourhood as he is a very helpful person.

He wants to continue investing in his business and in this way generate a greater income for his family as he feels very comfortable with the work he does. In addition he says that all his efforts are to help his family in any way he can. 

He is asking for the loan to buy sugar, flour, noodles, rice to stock up his store. He thanks the Fundacion for the opportunity given him as it helps his micro enterprise.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, noodles and other products.

loans.name: Jairo

texts.es:
Don Jairo desde sus 18 años se desempeña en la labor de pintura y latonería de carros, desde hace ya varios años tiene su propio negocio que se ha ido fortaleciendo gracias a su buen trabajo y calidad del mismo.

Para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia el necesita tener mas materia prima para así poder tener mas clientes y así se incrementaría su economía, además el quiere que cada día su negocio tenga mas prestigio en el sector.
texts.en:
Jairo has been working as an auto body mechanic (panel beater) and vehicle painter since he was 18 years old.  He has owned his own business for several years now and has been strengthening it thanks to the good-quality work that he does.

In order to improve his own quality of life as well as that of his family, he needs to have more raw materials available so that he can serve more customers and thereby improve his financial situation.  He would like his business to continue gaining more prestige in the sector.

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Mwandege Group

texts.en:
Arafa is in her early 30s, married, and has one child who attends school. She has been a tailor since 2002.  She works from 9 a.m to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Arafa's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to purchase more sewing items for her business. Her dream is to one day be able to fully take care of herself and her family.

Arafa will share this loan with her loan group, which has a total of 21 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to purchase more sewing items.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shoes, jeans and shirts to sell.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Susana; ella tiene 52 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agricultura, ella también se dedica al negocio de venta de leche, ella vende las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, al socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de leche y negocio de agricultura. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar leche y semillas para las tierras de cultivo. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Susana is a member of the 'San Bartolomé de Tambo Real' community bank which is located in Anta district, in Anta province, in Cusco department.

Susana is 52 years old, married, and has four children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her farming business.  She also sells milk.  She makes her sales between 6.00am and 7.00pm.  Through this business, she gets her children ahead in life.  Susana would like to expand her milk business and her farming business.  She is requesting this loan to buy milk, and also seeds for her farmland.

Susana is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy milk, and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Barrio Lindo Floresca Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento Barrio Lindo Floresca  esta entrando a su segunda secuencia conformado por 8 integrantes que viven en la zona Vella Vista cuentan con negocio y actividad propios .                                                                                         La Presidenta es la Sra. Ernestina tiene  45 años de edad fue elegida como presidenta del grupo por su responsabilidad y amabilidad, siempre colabora con sus compañeras, su actividad es la venta de comida  en su mismo domicilio hace 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad, esta casada con el sr. Vicente  el cual es electricista y tienen 2  que se encuentran estudiando, la Sra. Ernestina solicito el crédito para la compra insumos e ingredientes como arroz, fideo, aceite por mayor para la elaboración de sus riquísimos platillos. El deseo de la Sra. Ernestina es el de tener un restaurante con el tiempo y poder ver a su hijos profesionales.
