Los señores están muy agradecidos con nuestra entidad por haber confiado en ellos y brindarles un apoyo para poder crecer en su negocios y actividades
texts.en:
The 'Barrio Lindo Floresca' community bank are beginning their second loan cycle.  The group has eight members who live in Vella Vista district.  They all have their own businesses and activities.  The group's president is Ernestina who is 45 years old.  She was elected president of the group because of her responsibility and kindness.  She always helps her fellow bank members.

Ernestina's business is selling food from her home.  She has been in this business for two years.  Ernestina is married to Vicente, who is an electrician, and they have two children who are in school.  Ernestina requested this loan to buy supplies and ingredients such as rice, noodles and oil wholesale.  She will use these to make her delicious dishes.  Ernestina's wish is to eventually own a restaurant and see her children become professionals.  The members of this group are grateful to our institution for having placed our trust in them and given them the support they need to grow their businesses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, noodles and oil wholesale

loans.name: Vilma Roxana

texts.es:
Vilma Roxana tiene 33 años de edad no tiene hijos, es soltera vive con la madre en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Descripción de la Ventanilla  VRC Luchar para triunfar, se encuentra ubicada en el sector la poza, perteneciente a la ciudadela 10 de noviembre  Cantón Ventanas, Los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a diferentes labores tanto Agrícola como comercial.

Vilma se dedica a la  venta cosmeticos para mujer  la mercadería lo compra en Guayaquil y los vende en Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para comprar más mercadería, poder agrandar el negocio y para arreglo del local.

El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder adquirir fácilmente la mercadería y realizar los arreglos del local.
Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentemente es la competencia. El sueño  es poder apoyar a la familia económicamente y comprarse una casa para poder instalar el local y no pagar arriendo.

En los tiempos libres le gusta  realizar los quehaceres de la casa.
texts.en:
Vilma Roxana is 33 years old and doesn't have any children.  She is single and lives with her mother in Ventanas in the province of Ríos.  

The communal bank Luchar para Triunfar is located in the La Poza sector in the 10 de noviembre (November 10th) neighborhood in the Ventanas canton.  The members of this communal bank work different jobs ranging from agriculture to commercial.  

Vilma  sells cosmetics for women for a living which she buys in Guayaquil and sells in Ventanas.  She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise so she can expand her business and to fix up her shop.  The loan will be very helpful and will allow her to purchase merchandise easily and make repairs to her shop.  

A frequent challenge that she faces is the competition.  Her dream is to be able to financially support her family and buy a house so that she can set up her shop there and not have to pay rent.   

In her free time she likes to do the chores around the house.

loans.use: purchase more merchandise so she can expand her business and make repairs around her shop.

loans.name: Monte De Bendicion 4 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Maria is a member of her group Monte de Bendicion 4 & 6 or "Mount of Blessing". Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. The members are dedicated to doing business around their community and other villages, selling clothing, shoes, cosmetics, underwear, and many other products. Maria runs a homemade sweets business. She offers coconut and other assorted fruit sweets, made in a traditional way.

Maria is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza, which she will use to purchase ingredients like coconut, milk, sugar, vanilla, and fruit. Maria likes the bakery, and she would like to have one in the future with more sweet varieties.

Maria lives with her husband, and she dreams of building her dream house. This would be a beautiful and big house where her family could live and she could run her business. She will reinvest her profits in her business. Maria enjoys working at her home and doing business. She thanks you all for your support!!

loans.use: to buy coconut, milk, sugar, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Norberta Isamar

texts.es:
Norberta tiene 20 años de edad y vive con sus padres.

Norberta es una joven muy emprendedora y trabajadora, tiene ocho años de sembrar maíz y dos años de cultivar el yute o kenaf (fibra natural utilizada para fabricar sacos, lazos, matates, artesanías, etc.). Su familia fue quien  le enseñó a trabajar la tierra desde muy pequeña para tener una fuente de ingresos.

Ella debe viajar en autobús durante una hora desde su casa para poder adquirir los insumos agrícolas necesarios para sus cultivos.

Norberta está solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo para la compra de abono para el cultivo de maíz y para pagar por la mano de obra para recoger la cosecha de yute. Con el préstamo ella podrá obtener una buena cosecha de maíz, ya que el abono dará los nutrientes necesarios. El préstamo tambien hará posible el que Norberta recoga su cosecha de yute, ya que esta actividad requiere el trabajo de más de una persona.

Norberta es una joven visionaria con planes a futuro. Con los ingresos que resulten de la venta de sus cosechas, ella planea pagar el préstamo, y reinvertir para seguir cultivando. Además, ella pretende ahorrar para comprar un vehículo y asi poder salir a vender productos de la canasta básica a distintas comunidades. De la ganancia de estas dos actividades, ella quiere pagar por sus estudios universitarios, ya que por falta de dinero no ha podido seguir estudiando. Hace un año Norberta terminó su bachillerato técnico en contaduría, y lo que más desea es ser tener un título universitario.
texts.en:
Norberta is 20 years old and lives with her parents.

Norberta is an enterprising and hard-working young woman.  She has been growing corn for eight years and jute and kenaf (natural fiber used to make bags, rope, string tote bags, crafts, etc) for two years.  Her family taught her to work the land as a young girl so that she would have a source of income.   She has to travel an hour from her house by bus to buy the agricultural supplies she needs for her crops.   

Norberta is requesting a loan through Fundación Campo to buy fertilizer for her corn crop and to pay for labor to pick her jute crop. The loan will enable her to obtain a better corn harvest since the fertilizer will provide the necessary nutrients.  The loan will also make it possible to harvest her jute crop since this activity requires more than one person.  

Norberta is a young visionary with plans for the future.  With the income she earns from the sale of her crops, she plans to make her payments and reinvest in her subsequent crops.  In addition, she intends to save for a vehicle so that she can travel to sell daily use products in various communities.  With the earnings from these two activities, she wants to pay for her university studies since she was unable to continue her studies because of a lack of funds.  Norberta finished her technical high school degree in accounting and what she wants more than anything is to have a university degree.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer and pay for labor to pick her jute crop.

loans.name: Abishizehamwe/abacuruzi Group

texts.fr:
Jean Bosco fait partie du groupe Abishyizehamwe Abacuruzi. Le nom du groupe signifie « union de commerçants ». Il est né au Rwanda et il a 27 ans. Il est marié avec 2 enfants de 4 mois et 3 ans. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire. 

Jean Bosco est commerçant. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter de sorgho, du riz, des haricots et de la farine a vendre. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’améliorer son activité actuelle. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Bosco voudrait grossiste. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaires pour ses enfants et des frais médicaux.
texts.en:
Jean Bosco is part of the Abishyizehamwe Abacuruzi group. The name of the group means "union of traders". Jean Bosco was born in Rwanda and is 27 years old. He is married and has two children, who are 4 months and 3 years old. He completed 6 years of primary education and is a trader.
This is Jean Bosco´s second loan cycle with ACB and he will use the money to buy sorghum, rice, beans and flour for resale. He plans to grow his business by improving his existing practices, and would eventually like to become a wholesaler. He will use his profits to cover medical expenses as well as his children´s educational expenses.

loans.use: to buy sorghum, rice, beans and flour for resale.

loans.name: 1 De Abril Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “1 DE ABRIL” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva de la cual la señora Justina es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: artesanía en sombreros, venta de ropa, tejido de guantes, fabricación de helados, tejido de mantas, transportistas, venta de accesorios, carnicería, costura de chamarras, carpintería, venta de muebles.

La señora Justina,  indica que hace un año que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora en la zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción de helados que viene trabajando hace dos años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de su esposo.

El préstamo que sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de material para hacer helado) que adquirirá de la Ceja y posterior a la elaboración lo comercializará en su tienda. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación, salud y el ahorro.
texts.en:
The '1 de Abril' community bank is about to begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamericana regional office.  The group has eleven members and is run by a board of directors which has Justina as its president.  The businesses that the members of the bank are engaged in are varied and include: handicrafts (hats), selling clothes, knitting gloves, making frozen treats, knitting blankets, providing transportation services, selling accessories, butcher's shop, sewing jackets, carpentry and selling furniture.

Justina tells us that she has been working with Pro Mujer for one year and joined the institution through an invitation from a loan officer in her area.  Justina currently has a business making frozen treats.  She has been working in this business for two years and learned the trade from her husband.

Justina will use the loan that she is requesting to increase her capital (buying materials with which to make her frozen treats).  She will buy her supplies in La Ceja and, after making the products, she will sell them in her store.  This work enables her to make the income she needs to support her family.  Justina is single and has six children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Justina replied that she likes the training, the health service and the savings.

loans.use: to buy materials for making frozen treats

loans.name: Carlos Hernando

texts.es: Carlos siempre se ha dedicado a trabajar la tierra y desde hace un tiempo tiene su propio cultivo de hortalizas y con este mantiene económicamente su familia. El quiere tener un cultivo mas grande para así mejorarle la calidad de vida a sus hijos y su esposa, por esto necesita comprar mas insumos agrícolas para poder comenzar su nuevo cultivo.
texts.en: Carlos has always made his living working the land, and for quite some time has had his own vegetable garden through which he supports his family financially. He would like to have a larger garden so he can improve the quality of life for his wife and family, so he needs to buy more agricultural supplies to get the garden started.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Blanca Liliana

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene un hijo de 14 años, vive con su familia en San Gabriel que se encuentra en el Carchi al norte de Ecuador. Se describe como una madre que quiere lo mejor para su hijo, brindarle todo su apoyo y asegurar el futuro de su familia.

Blanca trabaja sola en la crianza de animales (chanchos). Trabaja con Fodemi por un tiempo de 5 años, el crédito que solicita actualmente es para mejorar los corrales, comprar alimentación para sus animales y para la compra de 2 crías de chancho lo cual mejoraría el crecimiento de sus animales, aumentaría sus ventas y sus ingresos.

Su sueño es incrementar el número de animales y entrar al negocio de comidas rápidas.
texts.en:
Blanca is thirty-years-old, married, and has a fourteen-year-old son. She lives with her family in San Gabriel which is in Carchi in the north of Ecuador. She describes herself as a mother who wants the best for her son, to give him all her support, and assure the future of her family.

Blanca works by herself raising animals (pigs). She has been with Fodemi for five years. The loan she is seeking is to improve the pens, buy feed for her animals, and to buy two more litters of pigs. The animals would grow better and she would increase her sales and income.

Blanca's dream is to have more animals and get into the fast food business.

loans.use: grow the infrastructure of her pens, buy feed for the animals, and get two more litters of pigs.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 28 years old and married with two children. He practices dairy farming to earn a living. He has been in this business for two years.  He also sells chickens to supplement his income.  

Geoffrey has been able to grow his business with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya. He hopes to grow his business and open other outlets in five years.  He has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to renovate the cowshed.

loans.use: To renovate the cowshed.

loans.name: Manuela Paola

texts.es:
Manuela Paola tiene 29 años de edad es casada vive con el esposo y con el hijo de 1 año cuatro meses de edad en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Descripción de la Ventanilla  VRC Luchar para triunfar, se encuentra ubicada en el sector la poza, perteneciente a la ciudadela 10 de noviembre  Cantón Ventanas, Los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a diferentes labores tanto Agrícola como comercial.

Manuela  tiene una mini tienda se dedica a la venta de productos como los víveres,  bebidas gaseosas, productos para consumo humano. Los productos los compra en Ventanas.

El crédito lo solicita para poder ampliar el negocio,  adquirir más productos que sean más surtidos  y poder venderlos, el crédito le ayudará muchísimo para poder cubrir las expectativas que tiene como comerciante.

El Sueño es poder ampliar el negocio. En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a jugar el básquet.
texts.en:
Manuela Paola is twenty-nine, married, and lives with her husband and sixteen-month-old son in the Ventanas province of Los Ríos. 

The Luchar para Triunfar [Strive for Triumph] group is located in the La Poza sector of the 10 de Noviembre housing community in the Ventanas canton. The members of the group earn their living in a variety of areas from agriculture to commercial.

Manuela has a little store that sells products like supplies, soft drinks, and food. She buys her goods in Ventanas. 

Manuela is seeking a loan so she can expand her business and stock up with more products to sell. The loan will help her quite a bit to cover costs she incurs as a shopkeeper.

Manuela's dream is to be able to grow the business. In her free time she likes to play basketball.

loans.use: to grow her business, and buy more products to stock up.

loans.name: Furaha Group

texts.en:
Nassoro, who is in his late 20s, is married with two children who are still at school.  He has been running a charcoal business for two years now. He works from 8 a.m to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be his 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania and he wants to use it for buying more sacks of charcoal.  His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group  "Furaha" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Beatriz Maura

texts.es:
Beatriz Maura tiene 37 años de edad es soltera vive con la mamá y con los dos hijos de cuatro y dos años de edad en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Descripción de la Ventanilla  VRC Luchar para triunfar, se encuentra ubicada en el sector la poza, perteneciente a la ciudadela 10 de noviembre  Cantón Ventanas, Los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a diferentes labores tanto Agrícola como comercial.

Beatriz se dedica a la  venta de bisutería la mercadería lo compra en Guayaquil y los vende en Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para ampliar el negocio, para  el arreglo del local y adquirir más mercadería. 

El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder adquirir fácilmente la mercadería y realizar los arreglos del local.
Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentemente es la competencia. El sueño  es poder apoyar a la familia económicamente y llegar hacer una  buena comerciante.

En los tiempos libres le gusta  practicar el deporte en especial el vóley.
texts.en:
Beatriz Maura is 37 years old and single.  She lives with her mother and her two children, ages four and two.  They live Ventanas, a province of Ríos.

The “Luchar para Triunfar” (Strive for Triumph) Communal Bank is located in the La Poza sector of the 10 de Noviembre housing community in the Ventanas canton. The members of the group earn their living in a variety of areas from agriculture to commerce. 

Beatriz sells costume jewelry.  She buys the merchandise in Guayaquil, and she sells it in Ventanas.

She is requesting the loan to expand her business, to fix up the place where she sells, and to get more merchandise.  The loan will be very helpful to her in order to easily be able to get more merchandise  and to make the repairs on her place.

The challenges that she frequently faces are the competition.  Her dream is to be able to support her family financially and to come to be a good merchant.

In her free time she likes to play sports, especially volleyball.

loans.use: to expand her business, to fix up the place where she sells, and to get more merchandise.

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan is 40 years old, married and has three children.  He uses scrap metals to make energy-saving cookers (jiko) to earn a living.  He has been in the business for five years.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to save his money.  He has also learnt how to manage his business well because he has been trained in business management.

Duncan hopes to expand his business in the future.  He needs 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy scrap metal as a raw material for making energy-saving cookers.

loans.use: To buy scrap metal.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nancy; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de lácteos, ella vende leche y también quesos, ella vende en las distintas ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de queso y leche. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos parea que quesos como comprar leche al por mayor.
 
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the "San Bartolomé de Tambo Real" community bank which is located in Anta district, in Anta province, in Cusco department.

Nancy is 40 years old, married, and has four children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling dairy products.  Nancy sells milk and cheese.  She sells her products in the different street markets in Anta district.  She would like to expand her business selling cheese and milk.  She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for making cheese (she will buy milk wholesale).

Nancy is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making cheese (she will buy milk wholesale)

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
El señor Roberto, es de la ciudad de Pilar, el se dedica a la mecánica de motos, esta acompañado, tiene un hijo de 4 años, es una persona muy activa responsable y trabajadora con muchas amistades, muy querido en el barrio.
El comenta que todo el trabajo que hace es por darle a su hijo un estilo de vida digno, sin privaciones ni necesidades. En cuanto a su negocio dice que tiene una clientela bien formada, pues es una persona que realiza buenos trabajos y de forma responsable.
Manifiesta que solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos y accesorios para poder generar más ingresos en su taller y de esa forma seguir trabajando. El cliente termina diciendo que esta muy agradecido a la Fundación por la ayuda a las micro empresa ya que nunca tuvo oportunidad.
texts.en:
Señor Roberto is from the city of Pilar. He is a motorcycle mechanic. He is in a relationship and has a son who is 4 years old. He is a very active, responsible and hardworking person who has a lot of friends and is well liked in the neighbourhood.

He says that all the work he does is so that he can give his son a dignified lifestyle, free from want and need. As for business, he says that he has a well-established client base as he is responsible and does a good job. 

He is applying for a loan to buy spare parts and accessories so as to generate more income in his workshop and in this way continue working. The member concluded by saying that he is very grateful to the Fundacion for the support it gives to small businesses as he never had this chance before.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories for the motorcycles he repairs.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
María Auxiliadora tiene 35 años de edad es soltera vive con la familia y con los tres hijos de catorce, nueve y cinco años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Descripción de la Ventanilla  VRC Luchar para triunfar, se encuentra ubicada en el sector la poza, perteneciente a la ciudadela 10 de noviembre  Cantón Ventanas, Los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a diferentes labores tanto Agrícola como comercial.

María se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos los productos para la alimentación de los cerdos los compra en  Comercial Murillo. Solicita el crédito para  la compra de cerdos, comprar la alimentación y vacuna para evitar que se mueran los cerdos.

El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder comprar la alimentación y la vacuna para que el cerdo este en buenas condiciones y poder venderlo.

Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentemente son la competencia y los males. El sueño es poder apoyar a los hijos y darles para los estudios y que puedan culminarlos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta escuchar música y pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora is a single 35 year old mother of three - of ages 14, 9, and 5 - who lives with her family in the Ventanas Canton of Los Rios Province in Ecuador. 

The Luchar para Triunfar ["Fight to Win"] communal bank is located in the Poza sector of the 10 de Noviembre district of Ventanas. The members of the communal bank engage in various lines of work, ranging from agriculture to retail. 

María raises and sells hogs and she buys her feed at the Murillo shopping center. She is requesting this loan to buy hogs, feed, and vaccines so as to prevent the death of her hogs. This loan will be a great help to her by allowing her to buy feed and vaccines so that her hogs will be in good condition and ready for sale. 

The most frequent challenges facing her are competition and sickness. Her dream is to be able to support her children in their studies so they can graduate. In her free time she likes to listen to music and spend time with her family.

loans.use: to buy hogs, feed, and vaccines.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha tiene 46 años, es una mujer alegre y emprendedora, esta casada y es madre D. cuatro hijos D. los cuales dos ya son mayores e independientes y solo los dos últimos viven con ella y su esposo, en su casa propia. El trabajo D. Martha consiste en la venta D. abarrotes, así como la D. carne D. pollo, en ese mismo lugar ofrece también a su clientela cosméticos que previamente son elegidos por medio D. catálogos. Tiene 12  años trabajando este lugar y gracias a éste trabajo es que pudo dar a sus hijos una buena educación. Manifiesta que le gusta lo que hace porque dispone D. tiempo para dedicarse a otras cosas, entre ellas la D. cuidar a sus hijos. Martha piensa seguir trabajando para consolidar su negocio, y con las ganancias remodelar y acondicionar su casa con varias habitaciones para alquilarlos, pues el negocio D. inmuebles le resultaría mucho más rentable. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, en la que asegura cumplirá con el pago D. sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, comprará algunos productos para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Martha, age 46, is a happy and enterprising woman who is married and the mother of four children. Two of her children are independent adults and only her two youngest live with her and her husband in their home. 

Martha sells groceries, such as chicken meat, and also offers her customers mail-order cosmetics at the same location. She has spent 12 years working out in this location, thanks to which she has been able to proviD. her children with a good education. She says she likes what she does because it allows her time for other things as well, such as raising her children. 

Martha plans to continue building her business and, with the profits, to remodel and air-condition her house with several rooms which she plans to rent as doing so would be much more profitable. This will be her first loan with MFP [Kiva field partner], to which she has assured that she will make her payments. With the amount she is taking out, she will buy products to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store.

loans.name: Nelson Leodan

texts.es:
Nelson Leodan tiene 27 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos vive con los padres en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Descripción de la Ventanilla  VRC Luchar para triunfar, se encuentra ubicada en el sector la poza, perteneciente a la ciudadela 10 de noviembre  Cantón Ventanas, Los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a diferentes labores tanto Agrícola como comercial.

Nelson tiene una mini tienda se dedica a la venta de productos como los víveres,  bebidas gaseosas, productos para consumo humano.Lo que se observa en la fotografía en la entrada es una máquina registradora para recibir el dinero al momento de vender los viveres, la tienda de viveres esta atras de la máquina. Los productos los compra en Ventanas y los vende en la tienda.

El crédito lo solicita para poder comprar productos a un muy buen precio y poder ofertar y venderlos a los clintes el crédito le ayudará muchísimo para poder cubrir con el pago de los productos que va ha comprar. 

El Sueño es poder ampliar el negocio y comprarse un carro. En los tiempos libres le gusta practicar el deporte en especial el indor.
texts.en:
Nelson Leodan is 27 years old and single with no children. He lives with his parents in the Ventanas Canton of Los Ríos Province in Ecuador. 

The Luchar para Triunfar ["Fight to Win"] communal bank is located in the Poza section of the 10 de Noviembre district of Ventanas. The members of this communal bank engage in various activities, ranging from agriculture to retail. 

Nelson has a small store in which he sells products including groceries, soft drinks, and other items for consumption. What is observed in the photo is the entrance of the store, where there is a cash register to receive the money from selling provisions. He buys his products in Ventanas and sells them at the store. He is taking out this loan to grow his business by purchasing more varied products and selling them. The loan will help him greatly by allowing him to offer more competitive prices. 

His dream is to grow his business. In his free time he likes to play sports, especially Ecuadorian football/soccer.

loans.use: para poder comprar productos a un muy buen precio y poder ofertar y venderlos

loans.name: Las Vencedoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS VENCEDORAS” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva de la cual la señora Fabiana es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejidos artesanales, macramé, tejido a máquina, tejido de mantas, artesanías en aguayos

La señora Fabiana,  indica que hace un año que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanía en tejidos que viene trabajando hace años atrás.

El préstamo que sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de la Ceja y posterior a la elaboración lo comercializará en diferentes ferias de la cuidad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la discreción del personal.
texts.en:
The Las Vencedoras ["the winners"] borrowing group will be taking out its third loan with Pro Mujer Bolivia [Kiva field partner] as a part of the Panamericana regional office. The group is composed of nine women and is led by an executive council, of which Fabiana is the president. The businesses run by the members are various and include artisanal weaving, macramé, loom weaving, blanket weaving, crafts, and colorful aguayo fabrics. 

Fabiana says that she has worked with Pro Mujer for a year and became involved with the institution through the invitation of a promoter. Currently, she has an artisanal fabric business that she has been operating for years. This loan will be used to buy wool, which she will purchase at the Ceja market and then weave and sell in various markets and festivals in the city of El Alto. This line of work allows her to build up resources to support her family, as she is a single woman. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she appreciates the personal independence.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Nueva Gabriela Group

texts.es:
Éste Banco comunal se llama “Nueva Gabriela” lo conforman 17 emprendedores que se dedican a diferentes rubros, pero principalmente al comercio entre los cuales se encuentran diversos negocios como la venta de ropa, puestos de fritura, repostería y preparación de masas y ensaladas. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de La Cisterna, ciudad de Santiago. 
Jimena integrante del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la primera fila, sentada en el puesto de al medio y quien usa anteojos. 
Se dedica a preparar y vender comida rápida, entre estas masas, pizzas, pan amasado, sopaipillas, frituras, completos, churrascos y papas fritas. Trabaja en éste rubro desde hace tres años, comenta que le ha ido muy bien en su negocio y ha tenido buena aceptación con su clientela. 
Sus preparaciones las vende en el patio de su casa.
La mercadería la compra en una distribuidora y en la vega (feria de ventas para comerciantes)
Su horario de trabajo es durante los fines de semana. 
Con el crédito comprará mercadería para abastecer su negocio, entre los cuales dos galones de gas, saco de papas, tomates, paltas, carne y vienesas. 
Las metas en su negocio son establecer su negocio en un local y ubicarlo en su casa, para que también los clientes puedan comer al mesón. Actualmente cuenta con un horno industrial y una freidora. Sin embargo le faltan algunos muebles y materiales de construcción para su local. 
Jimena vive junto a sus dos hijos de 15 y 8 años de edad, ambos estudian.
Las motivaciones de Jimena para continuar con el negocio, son para costear los estudios de su hijo en la escuela de aeronáutica. Por ende sus sueños son seguir pagando los estudios de sus hijos para que sean profesionales. 
Jimena está muy contenta y agradecida con los créditos y servicios brindados por Fondo Esperanza, debido a la oportunidad y ayuda en sus negocios. Además disfruta de las reuniones del Banco comunal y del grupo, ya que también son vecinas y existe una gran confianza. Para ella estas reuniones son un momento de distracción. 
La Cisterna es una comuna ubicada en el sector centro-sur de la región Metropolitana. Es una comuna esencialmente residencial y comercial. En sus inicios era un sector rural, de grandes parcelas, sin embargo debido al crecimiento de su población y la llegada de servicios pasó a ser un sector 100% urbano.
texts.en:
The Nueva Gabriela communal bank is made up of 17 business owners who engage in various lines of work, though principally in retail, including in clothing sales, food stands, pastries, and the preparation of doughs and salads. They all live in La Cisterna, a community located in the south central part of the Santiago metro region. It's a residential and commercial community, though in its early days it was a rural area of large tracts. Nonetheless, with the growth of the population and emergence of greater services, it has become a 100% urban area. 

Jimena, a member of this communal bank group seated in the front row wearing glasses, prepares and sells fast foods, such as fried masa, pizzas, pan amasado (Chilean biscuits), sopapillas, french fries, hot dogs, and barbecued meats. She's been doing this for three years and says that she has been very good with her business, maintaining a good base of customers. She sells her food items from the patio of her house and buys her merchandise from a distributor in the La Vega market to sell on the weekends. With this loan, she will buy merchandise to supply her business with items including propane, potatoes, tomatoes, avocados, meats, and hot dogs. 

Her goals are to better establish her business in her home so that her customers can eat at the counter. Currently, she has an industrial oven and refrigerator. Nonetheless, she is lacking a few pieces of furniture and construction materials for her setup. Jimena lives with her two children of 15 and 18, both of whom are in school. Her inspiration for keeping up her business is to support her son's studies in aeronautics. In brief, her dreams are to go on providing for her children's studies so that they can become professionals. 

Jimena is very happy and thankful for the loans and services provided by Fondo Esperanza [Kiva field partner] to her business. Also, she enjoys the communal bank and group meetings, as they are also neighbors and share a great trust between them. For her these meetings are an opportunity to relax and have some fun.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to supply her business with items including propane, potatoes, tomatoes, avocados, meats, and hot dogs.

loans.name: Maria Irma

texts.es:
María Irma siempre trabajo en una empresa de calzado y cuando el dueño del negocio se trasladó para otra ciudad ella decidió montar su propio negocio, actualmente ella hace todo tipo de sandalias que le permiten tener el sustento diario para ella y su familia.

Ella necesita comprar insumos para tener mas variedad de calzado y así sus ingresos se incrementaran y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y se sus hijos.
texts.en:
María Irma always worked in a shoe company.  When the owner of the business moved to another city, she decided to launch her own business.  She currently makes all types of sandals.  This allows her to have the daily bread for her family and for herself.

She needs to buy supplies in order to have a greater variety of shoes.  This way her income will increase, and she will be able to improve her quality of life and that of her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make shoes.

loans.name: Fermina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Fermina; ella tiene 60 años de edad y es casada y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de leche, venta de ganado y negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes, ella vende la leche, cuyes y ganados en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta, por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de leche, venta de cuyes y venta de ganados. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes, leche y ganados.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Fermina is a member of the "San Bartolomé de Tambo Real" community bank which is located in Anta district, in Anta province, in Cusco department.

Fermina is 60 years old, married, and has six children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling milk and livestock, and raising animals such as guinea pigs.  She sells her milk, guinea pigs and livestock in the different street markets in Anta district.  Through these small businesses, she gets her children ahead in life.  Fermina would like to expand and improve her business selling milk, guinea pigs and livestock.  She is requesting this loan to buy guinea pigs, milk and livestock.

Fermina is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, milk and livestock

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Ángel tiene 44 años de edad es soltero vive con el hijo y con los padres en el Cantón ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Descripción de la Ventanilla  VRC Luchar para triunfar, se encuentra ubicada en el sector la poza, perteneciente a la ciudadela 10 de noviembre  Cantón Ventanas, Los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a diferentes labores tanto Agrícola como comercial.

Miguel se dedica a la  agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, cacao los productos los compra en Comercial Lola. Solicita el crédito para  comprar abonos, fertilizantes, urea e incrementar la siembra, comprar más  semillas  y obtener más utilidades. 

El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder comprar los abonos para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentemente son la competencia y las plagas.

El sueño de Miguel es poder apoyar a la familia económicamente para la medicina y alimentación y poderse comprar un carro para transportar los productos para poder venderlos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta escuchar música y bailar.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel is 44 years old.  He is single and lives with his son and parents in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The 'Luchar para Triunfar' community bank is located in La Poza sector, in 10 de Noviembre district, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank are engaged in different businesses, both agricultural and commercial.

Miguel is a farmer who grows corn, rice and cacao.  He buys his products in Comercial Lola.  Miguel is requesting this loan to buy manure, fertilizers and urea.  In order to increase the crops that he sows, he will also buy more seeds and thereby make more profits.

This loan will be a great help to Miguel as it will enable him to buy the manure he needs to keep his crops in good condition.  The challenges that he faces are competition and pests.

Miguel's dream is to be able to support his family financially, paying for medicines and food.  He would also like to be able to buy a car to transport his products and sell them.

In his free time, Miguel enjoys listening to music and dancing.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, urea and more seeds

loans.name: Jose Pedro

texts.es:
José tiene 51 años es soltero y vive en San Gabriel con sus dos hijos. Es una persona libre, capaz de tomar iniciativas parea poder emprender en su negocio.

Trabaja solo en su tiendita de víveres. Lleva trabajando con Fodemi un año, los créditos le ayudan ya que Fodemi entiende la necesidad, el crédito que solicita actualmente es para la compra de víveres para abastecer su negocio y también quiere comprar terneros porque quiere empezar con el negocio del ganado.

Su sueño es tener una casa y tener un establo para ganado lechero.
texts.en:
51-year-old José is single and lives in San Gabriel with his two children.  He is a free person who is able to take initiatives in order move forward in his business.

José works alone in his grocery store.  He has been working with Fodemi for one year.  The loans help him as Fodemi understand his needs.  The loan that he is currently requesting will be used to buy food products with which to stock his business.  He would also like to buy calves because he would like to start a livestock-raising business.

José's dream is to own a house and a stable so that he can keep dairy cows.

loans.use: to stock his grocery store and to buy calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, beans, firewood and chicken to make tamales.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa; ella tiene 53 años de edad y es casada y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de leche y también realiza el negocio de crianza de cuyes, ella vende los cuyes y la leche en las diferentes ferias que se realiza en el distrito de Anta, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de leche y venta de cuyes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes y leche al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL” communal bank.  The bank is located in the district of Anta, which is part of Anta province and Cusco department.

The member is Señora Rosa; she is 53 years old and is married with six children.  The member combines her daily activities with her business selling milk, and she also has a business raising guinea-pigs.  She sells the guinea-pigs and the milk in the different markets that take place in the district of Anta. By means of these businesses, the member has been able to move her children ahead in life. 

The member wants to expand her businesses selling milk and guinea-pigs.  The member is requesting the loan to buy guinea-pigs and milk at wholesale.

The member is happy to have the loan and agrees to comply with her repayments.

loans.use: to buy guinea-pigs and milk at wholesale.

loans.name: Jose Humberto

texts.es:
José, vive con su hijo de 3 años, él se dedica a la crianza de ganado y cerdos, esta actividad la realiza hace tres años, su padre le dio el ejemplo, trabaja todos los días y cuando es día de tiangue vende y compra.
El utilizara el préstamo para comprar cinco terneros pequeños para crecerlos en su potrero, y cuando ya esté el tiempo que pueda ser rentable venderlos y de esa forma obtener mejores ingresos.
El sueño de José es hacer su propia casa y darle un mejor futuro a su hijo el cual lo necesita, y tener mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
José lives with his 3 year old son. He breeds cattle and pigs for a living, a job he has done for the past 3 years. Following in his father’s footsteps, he works everyday and goes to buy and sell on market day.

He will use the loan to buy five small calves to raise in his pasture and when the time comes, he will sell them for a profit, thus improving his income.

José’s dream is to build his own house, to provide his son with a better future which is something that he needs and also to have greater financial stability.

loans.use: to buy five small calves.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ink, caustic soda, powder, white cotton clothes, etc. in order to produce a larger quantity of locally dyed clothes to sell.

loans.name: Salomon De Jesus

texts.es:
Salomón, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 6, 7 y 9 años se dedican a la siembra de granos básicos: maíz, frijoles, este trabajo lo heredo de su padre y trabaja todo los días de 6 am a 3 pm de lunes a domingo.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar abono y fertilizantes para que sean mejores cosechas para venderla y dejar una parte  para su familia.
El sueño de salomón es que su familia tenga lo necesario para vivir, y que sus hijos estudien para que sean personas de éxito.
texts.en:
Salomón lives with his wife and three children aged 6, 7, and 9.  They work growing basic grains such as corn and beans.  He took over this work from his father, and works every day, Monday through Sunday, from 6 a.m. to 3 p.m.

This loan will be used to purchase manure and fertilizers so that his harvests will be better and he can sell them and still leave a part for his family.

Salomón's dream is for his family to have life's necessities, and that his children attend school so they can become successful people.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN BARTOLOME DE TAMBO REAL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ana Maria; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 3hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de leche y queso y también se dedica a la agricultura, ella tiene un terreno donde siembra maíz, la socia vende leche, queso en las diferentes ferias que existe, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de leche, queso y maíz. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar queso, leche y maíz al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member, Sra. Ana Maria, belongs to the San Bartolome de Tambo Real communal bank, which is located in the district of Anta, in the province of Anta and the department of Cusco.

Ana Maria is 32 and is a single mother with 3 children. She sells milk and cheese and she is also a farmer. She has a plot of land where she plants corn. She sells milk and cheese at different markets and wants to expand her business selling milk and cheese and corn. She is requesting a loan to buy milk, cheese and corn wholesale.

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy cheese, milk and corn wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts and underwear for adults and children

loans.name: Ligia

texts.es:
Después D. convertirse en madre cabeza D. hogar, Ligia se dedicó a trabajar incansablemente para sacar adelante a sus 4 hijos, día a día se rebusca la manera D. generar ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad D. vida, por ello, desD. hace algún tiempo se dedica a la cría D. cerdos y pollos, y como ingreso adicional venD. arepas a sus vecinos y allegados.

Para continuar con este negocio y esperando ampliar sus clientes, Ligia necesita un préstamo para comprar 2 cerdos, cuido para los cerdos y pollos para el engorD. D. los mismos, y así ser más productiva y generar mayores ingresos ya que se aproxima la época D. diciembre. 

A sus 61 años D. edad, esta emprendedora sueña con poder ofrecerles a sus hijos la oportunidad D. tener un mejor futuro para ellos y los nietos que llegarán, por eso trabaja con gran dedicación y esfuerzo.
texts.en: Once she became the head of her household, Ligia devoted herself to working tirelessly to proviD. for her 4 children.  She is constantly looking for ways to generate income that will allow her to improve her quality of life.  For some time now she has been raising pigs and chickens, and for extra income she sells corn cakes to her friends and neighbors.  In order to continue with her livestock business, and because she is hoping to increase her customer base, Ligia needs a loan to buy 2 pigs, and pig and chicken feed to fatten her animals.  In this way she will be more productive and can generate better earnings, since we are approaching the end of the year.  At 61 years of age, this enterprising woman dreams of providing her children with the opportunity to have a better future for themselves and for the grandchildren to come.  For this reason, she works with great dedication and effort.

loans.use: to buy 2 pigs, and to buy animal feed to fatten her pigs and chickens

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy groundnuts etc. in a large quantity to sell in her business

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es: Maria Francisca habitante del colonia Jacinto Baca, trabaja para el Ministerio de Educacion desde hace 21 años, actualmente labora como Docente Educadora de primaria, su esposo trabaja en el extranjero, quien desde alla colabora en los gastos y en las obras de progreso para el bienestar economico de la unidad familiar, necesita este financiamiento para realizar algunas remodelaciones en su casa de habitacion como repello y ponerle el piso, esto le permitira garantizar mejores condiciones de vida en su casa, e incrementar el valor de la misma, referencias la consideran como una persona responsable, trabajadora, progresiva y de buenas costumbres, esperando ser beneficiada con este fondo para poder llevar a cabo dicha actividad.
texts.en:
Maria Francisca lives in Jacinto Baca neighborhood and has worked for the Ministry of Education for 21 years. Currently she is an elementary school teacher. Her husband works abroad and from there collaborates in household expenses and in the works in progress undertaken for the economic well being of the family unit. 

Maria Francisca needs additional funding to do some remodeling on her home, such as plastering and installing a floor in order to ensure better living condition in the house and increase its value. She is described as a responsible, hard-working, progressive person with good values. She hopes to receive this loan in order to carry out the work mentioned.

loans.use: to remodel her house.

loans.name: Claudelina

texts.es:
La señorita Claudelina tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de banderas y remeras de los Clubes populares de Paraguay, también ropas interiores para damas y caballeros. Cada mañana se coloca en las Plazas que son lugares transcurridos para ofrecer sus productos.
Ella se considera una mujer trabajadora y muy sacrificada, ya que gracias a su esfuerzo ella ha logrado ayudar a su familia y estar con el negocio que tiene. Comenta que su trabajo es muy duro y sacrificado, pero que le gusta.
Claudelina solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, con las cuales podrá elaborar las banderas y las remeras que vende. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta e brinda.
texts.en:
Señorita Claudelina is 22 years old.  She is single and lives with her parents.  She works selling flags and T-shirts from the popular clubs in Paraguay.  She also sells underwear for men and women.  Every morning she sets up to sell her products in the busiest plazas.

She considers herself to be a hard-working woman who is very self-sacrificing, as thanks to her efforts she has managed to support her family and have her business.  She comments that her work is very hard and requires sacrifice, but she enjoys it.

Claudelina is requesting the loan for the purchase of fabric, with which she will be able to make the flags and T-shirts that she sells.  She is grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity that is being provided to her.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making flags and T-shirts.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa Maria habitante del casco Urbano de Nueva Guinea,labora desde hace 3 años para en un Banco como Auxiliar de Atencion de Oficina, actividad considerada como su principal fuente de ingreso, su esposo trabaja como Guarda de Seguridad, en conjunto colaboran en los gastos y progresos familiares;Doña Rosa Maria nesecita este financiamiento para construir una cocina en su casa de habitacion y asi poder tener mejores comodidades que le permita vivir en otras condiciones de vida en conjunto con su familia, es muy conocida como una persona responsable, trabajadora, progresiva y de buenas costumbres, desde ya agradece el apoyo a dicha institucion.
texts.en: Rosa Maria lives in the city center of Nueva Guinea.  She has been working in a bank as an office assistant for three years.  This is her main source of income.  Her husband works as a security guard and together they contribute towards their family expenses and progress.  Rosa Maria needs this loan to build a kitchen in her home which will allow her to enjoy more comfort and better living conditions with her family.  She is known as a responsible, hard-working, progressive woman with good habits.  She is grateful for the institution's support.

loans.use: to build a kitchen

loans.name: Nelly Yesenia

texts.es:
Nelly, vive con su esposo y una hija D. 3 años, ella tiene un local D. venta D. celulares D. diferentes compañías, claro, movistar, tigo, Digicel y el esposo atienD. otro ya son negocios bien establecidos.
Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar más accesorios para teléfonos (cargadores, baterias,carcasas) y nuevos teléfonos para ofrecerles a los clientes más variedad, y poder obtener mejores ingresos.
El sueño D. Nelly es tener una mejor calidad D. vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Nelly lives with her husband and her three year old daughter.  She has a place where she sells cell phones from different companies; Movistar, Tigo, and Digicel.  He husband attends to another one.  They are now well-established businesses. 

She needs the loan to buy more cell phone accessories (chargers, batteries, and cases) and new phones to offer the customers greater variety.  She needs to be able to get better income.

Nelly’s dream is to have a better quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy more cell phones and accessories (chargers, batteries, and cases).

loans.name: Gicela Maritza

texts.es:
Gisela, se dedica a la venta de tortillas ,vive en casa propia, con sus dos hijos de 15 y 20 años de edad, tiene 20 años de tener este negocio y lo heredo de su abuela, ya tiene muchos clientes y es rentable, trabaja todos los días de lunes a sábado.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar maíz, y leña y a si aumentar sus ganancias y darle mejor servicio a los clientes.
El sueño de Gisela es tener siempre su negocio  y darle a los hijos lo que ellos necesitan y lo importante el estudio.
texts.en:
Gicela sells tortillas.  She lives with her two children, ages 15 and 20.  She has had this business for 20 years.  She inherited it from her grandmother.  She now has a lot of customers, and it is profitable.  She works every Monday through Saturday.

She will use the loan to buy corn and firewood.  That way she will increase her earnings and give better service to her customers.

Gicela’s dream is to always have her business.  She also dreams of giving her children what they need; education is very important.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes (dresses, pants, skirts, and shorts).

loans.name: Arling Jissell

texts.es: Arling de la Comarca Villa Alvarez labora en su casa de habitacion, donde tiene establecido un molino de moler maiz, para realizar este servicio al pueblo de Villa Alvarez, actividad que funciona como su mayor fuente de ingreso para el bienestar familiar, requiere de este financiamiento para complementar gastos en la construccion de su vivienda, esto le permitira garantizar vivir en mejores condiciones de vida, en su comunidad la consideran como una persona responsable, trabajadora, porgresiva  y de buenas costumbres espera ser beneficiada con este fondo para poder llevar a cobo su actividad proyectada.
texts.en:
Arling is from Villa Alvarez.  She works at home where she has a mill which grinds corn.  She provides this service to the village of Villa Alvarez.  This is the main source of income for her family.

Arling needs this loan to cover the cost of building her home.  This will enable her to enjoy better living conditions.  Within her community, Arling is considered to be a responsible, hard-working, progressive person with good habits.  She hopes to receive this loan so that she can carry out her planned project.

loans.use: to finish building her home

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, administra una tienda en la cual vende gaseosas y artículos de primera necesidad y por las tardes se dedica a vender pupusas en su casa, desde hace tres años se dedica a este negocio.
El préstamo lo utilizara para fortalecer más su negocio en la compra de: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite para surtir más la tienda y comprar quesillo y otros ingredientes para la venta de pupusas, con esta compra poder atender más clientes.
El objetivo de Isabel es mejorar su calidad de vida, para ella y su familia, darles el estudio a sus hijos y a si obtener mejores  ingresos.
texts.en:
Isabel lives with her husband and their 3 children, and operates a store in which she sells soft drinks and articles of primary necessity. Afternoons, she sells 'pupusas' [stuffed tortillas, very popular in El Salvador] from her house. Isabel has been doing this for some 3 years now.

The loan will be utilized to strengthen her store's inventory, buying merchandise such as rice, beans, sugar, and oil, and to buy cream cheese and other ingredients used in 'pupusas'. With these purchases Isabel will be able to serve more customers.

Isabel's objective is to improve her entire family's quality of life, and to provide schooling for her children and thereby, obtaining improved income.

loans.use: buy rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es:
María vive con su esposo y su hijo, tiene una sala belleza, corta cabello a damas y caballeros, tintes, uñas acrílicas, trabaja todos los días de lunes a domingo.
Ella necesita el préstamo para su negocio en la compra de cremas, tintes, maquillaje, shampoo,  para tener más variedad y de esa forma tener más clientela y también mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de María es que crezca su negocio y sus clientes se sientan bien, en el futuro tener una casa propia para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Maria lives with her husband and her son, and she has a beauty salon where she cuts hair for ladies and gentlemen, dies hair, does nails, and works every day, Monday through Sunday.

Maria needs this loan for her business, to buy creams, tints, make up, and shampoo, in order to have more variety, and to have more clientele, plus to improve her income.

Maria's dream is for her business to grow and for her customers to feel content. In the future, she wants to have her own house, one that she and her family can enjoy.

loans.use: buy creams, tints, make up, and shampoo for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy natural and chemical fertilizer.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha tiene 35 años, ella se destaca por ser una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 18 y 16 años, quienes dependen de ella para tener educación y alimentación. Juntos viven en su casa que es propia. Su trabajo consiste en la venta de comida que es distribuida por diversos lugares de la ciudad, pues sus clientes, quienes en su mayoría son aserraderos,laboran lejos. Su faena empieza desde muy temprano, preparando los alimentos que previamente ya son elegidos por sus asiduos comensales. A ella desde muy pequeña le gustó cocinar, pues posee buena sazón y eso le da mucha ventaja en su negocio. Sin embargo la parte más dificil tener que distribhuir los alimentos y eso es muy agotador para ella. Pero el sacrificio vale si desea ver a sus hijos profesionales. Espera mas adelante contar con una movilidad propia, de esa manera no se agotará y terminará de enviar toda la comida a tiempo. Este será el cuarto crédito con MFP, le fue bien el ciclo pasado y espera que le vaya mejor esta vez, tiene muchas ganas de seguir trabajando y considera que es de mucha ayuda los préstamos otorgados por que le dan la oportunidad de invertir más. Con el monto solicitado podrá comprar ingredientes para la producción de diversos platos de comida.
texts.en:
Martha is 35 years old. She stands out as a fighter and an entrepreneur. She is a single mother of two childrne who are 18 and 16 years old and who depend on her for their education and food. They live together in a home of their own. 

Her work is selling food that is delivered to different parts of the city, since her clients, the majority of whom are sawmill workers, live far away. Her day begins very early, preparing the food that had already been ordered by her clients. She has enjoyed cooking since she was very little, so she has a good sense of flavor and that is a great advantage in her business. Without a doubt, the most difficult part is distributing the food and that is very exhausting for her. But the sacrifice is worth it if she wants to see her children be professionals. She hopes to advance further with a delivery mobile of her own, that way she won’t be exhausted, and she will finish delivering all of the food on time. 

This will be her fourth loan with MFP. The past loan cycle went well, and she hopes it will go better this time. She is eager to continue working and she considers the awarded loans to be a great help because they provide the opportunity to further invest. With the amount requested, she will be able to buy ingredients to make the various meals.

loans.use: to buy products to make various meals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy vitamins and antibiotics in the form of pills, syrups and injections.

loans.name: Mario Rene

texts.es:
Mario, vive con su mamá y sus hermanos, es soltero, es empleado en el pollo campestre, tiene un horario rotativo, y administra una tienda de productos de primera necesidad y su madre se encarga de atenderla.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar mercadería el cual le permitirá crecer y tener una mejor atención a los clientes y de esa manera obtener mejores ingresos para su familia, la compra especificamente sera en arroz, frijoles, aceite, pan y huevos.
El sueño de Mario es que su negocio crezca y que su familia viva bien.
texts.en:
Mario is single and lives with his mother and siblings.  He's an employee of the Pollo Campestre restaurant and has a variable schedule. He also runs a store of basic household goods that his mother is responsible for tending.

He will use the loan to buy merchandise that will allow him to grow and give his customers better service and, in this way, have better earnings for his family.  Specifically, he will buy rice, beans, oil, bread, and eggs.

Mario's dream is for his business to grow and his family to live well.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, bread, and eggs.

loans.name: Felipe Carlos

texts.es:
Felipe, vive con su mamá es soltero, ella es dependiente, él trabaja de mecánico desde hace quince años, tiene experiencia no tiene un horario establecido, trabaja todos los días de lunes a domingo.
El necesita el préstamo para reparar el techo y el piso de su vivienda, el cual le permitirá tener su casa en buenas condiciones y vivir con su familia.
El sueño de Felipe es vivir feliz con su familia en su casa y que este en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Felipe is single and lives with his dependent mother. He has worked as a mechanic for the past fifteen years. He has experience, he doesn’t have fixed hours and he works every day, from Monday to Sunday.

He needs the loan to repair the roof and the floor of his home, which will allow him to live in better conditions with his family. 

Felipe’s dream is to live happily with his family and for their home to be in good condition.

loans.use: to buy material to repair the roof and floor of his home.

loans.name: Luz Ofelia

texts.es:
Luz Ofelia en las afueras de su casa tiene un carrito para la venta de frituras, su comida se está siendo muy reconocida gracias a que es muy buena y de excelente calidad.

Ella con su negocio le permite tener el sustento diario para su familia, además de poder estar activa. Ella quiere tener un restaurante no solo para tener una excelente calidad de vida sino también para poderles dejar a sus hijos una entrada fija de dinero.
texts.en:
Luz Ofelia has a cart outside her house where she sells fritters. Her food is becoming well known because it is very good and of excellent quality. 

Her business allows her to support her family and stay active. She wants to have a restaurant not only to have an excellent quality of life, but to be able to give her children a steady income.

loans.use: to outfit her locale.

loans.name: Elia Noemi

texts.es:
Elia, vive con su hija de 18 años y una nieta de 8 meses, posee una tienda y venta de comida, este negocio lo tiene desde hace veinticinco años, lo heredo de sus padres, se dedica todos los días de lunes a sábado.
El préstamo lo utilizara para para comprar los productos de primera necesidad como jugos, sodas azúcar, e ingredientes para la elaboración de comida, el cual permitirá obtener mejores ingresos.
El objetivo de Elia, es mantener su negocio  fortalecido y tener más clientes, lo que permitirá que ella y su  familia vivan en condiciones mejores.
texts.en:
Elia lives with her 18 year-old daughter and an eight month-old granddaughter.  She has a store, and sells meals.  She has had this business for 25 years; she inherited it from her parents. She works every day from Monday to Saturday. 

The loan will be used to buy basic household products, such as juices, sodas, sugar, and ingredients for making meals. This will allow her to get a better income. Elia's goal is to keep building up her business, and attracting more customers. This will allow her and her family to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy juice, sodas and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Jenny Elizabeth

texts.es:
Jenny, vive con sus dos hijos de 14 y 18 años de edad, es madre soltera, no tiene nadie que le ayude solo ella trabaja para sostener a su familia, tiene una tienda con productos de primera necesidad, vende todos los días de 6:00 am a 6:00 pm de lunes a domingo.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar más mercadería: azúcar jugos, jabón, detergente, pan, huevos, el cual le ayudara aumentar más su negocio, ya que hay varios negocios de talleres de carpintería que ellos son sus clientes, y darles mejor atención con los productos.
El sueño de Jenny es establecer más su negocio, como lo tenía antes  y mejorar la calidad de vida a sus hijos y tener un negocio estable que tenga mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Jenny lives with her two children, ages 14 and 18.  She is a single mother, and has no one to help her; she is the sole support for her family. She has a store that sells basic household necessities. She sells every day from 6:00am to 6:00pm, Monday to Sunday.   

She will use the loan to buy more merchandise: sugar, juices, soap, detergent, bread, eggs. This will help her increase her business, since there are several carpentry workshop businesses that are her customers, and she will be able to serve them better. 

Jenny's dream is to build up her business to what it was before, to improve her children's quality of life, and to have a stable business with better income.

loans.use: To buy merchandise: sugar, juices, soap, detergent, bread, and eggs.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Maria, es separa, vive con sus hijas ya todas mayores en la cuidad D. San Lorenzo. Ella se dedica a la venta D. quesos y harina D. maíz. Cuenta que se inicio en este rubro con una tía hace un tiempo. Gracias a todo su sacrificio y con mucho esfuerzo logró independizarse y logró montar su propio negocio.
Comenta que diariamente empieza su jornada D. trabajo muy temprano. Dice también que tiene muchos clientes que siempre compran D. ella los productos que trae, por ser D. buena calidad y muy ricos. Uno D. los sueños D. Maria es poder ampliar su negocio y D. esa forma tener mayores ingresos y así también poder ayudar a otras personas, dándoles puestos D. trabajo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. más quesos y harina D. maíz, ya que tiene mucha demanda y le gustaría poder cumplir con todos sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Maria is separated, and lives in the city of San Lorenzo with her daughters, who are now all adults. She sells cheeses and corn flour. 

She says that started in this line of work with an aunt some time ago. Thanks to all her sacrifice and with a lot of effort, she succeeded in becoming independent, and managed to start up her own business. She says that she starts her work day very early every day. She also says that she has a lot of customers, who always buy the products she carries, because they are of good quality, and very delicious. 

One of María's dreams is to be able to expand her business, and in that way have more income. She also wants to be able to help other people by giving them jobs. She is applying for the loan in order to buy cheeses and corn flour, since there is a lot of demand, and she would like to be able to fill all her orders.

loans.use: To buy cheeses, and corn flour for later sale.

loans.name: Marina Isabel

texts.es:
Marina, vive con dos hijos, está acompañada, se dedica a la venta de leña y tortillas, tiene diez años en este oficio, trabaja todos los días de lunes a viernes.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar maíz y fortalecer más su negocio, y mejorarlo más, con la inversion espera obtener mejores ganancias y aumentar en clientes, ya que el negocio es rentable.
El objetivo de marina mejorar económicamente y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Marina lives with two children and her companion.  She sells firewood and tortillas.  She’s been in this occupation for ten years.  She works every day Monday through Friday.

She will use the loan to buy corn to strengthen and improve her business more.  She hopes to obtain more profits and customers with this investment since the business is profitable.

Marina’s goal is to improve economically and more her family forward.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oil, soft-drinks, juice, cookies and candy.

loans.name: Noemi Yanira

texts.es:
Noemí, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de merienda: tostadas yuca, nuégados, turrones, enchiladas, este negocio lo aprendió hace 5 años y vende todos los días  de lunes a domingo.
El préstamo lo necesita para la materia prima,yuca, platano, aceite, condimentos y de esa forma lo utilizara para incrementar sus ingresos y  más posibilidades de obtener variedad y tener más clientes.
El sueño de Noemí es aumentar sus ganancias y aumentar en sus ventas para darle mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Noemí lives with her husband and two children.  She sells prepared meals: tostadas, manioc, nuégados [fried pastry], turrones [nougat], and enchiladas.  She learned this business five years ago and she sells every day from Monday through Sunday.

She needs the loan to buy raw materials: manioc, banana, oil and condiments and will use it to increase her income and to have the possibility of having more variety and more customers.

Noemí’s dream is to increase profits and sales to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy manioc, bananas, oil and condiments to prepare her meals.

loans.name: Dinorah Del Carmen

texts.es:
Dinorah, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ellos le ayudan a trabajar, se dedica a la venta de tostadas de plátano verde, aprendió el oficio gracias al apoyo  de su hermana,ya tiene experiencia, no tiene horario para vender ya que todos los días se dedica a este negocio.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar materia prima como yuca, plátano,y aceite para elaborar las tostadas y de esa manera tener los ingredientes para preparar los productos y atender mejor a sus clientes.
El sueño de dinorah es que su negocio crezca  y de esa forma darle mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Dinorah lives with her husband and two children.  They help with her work.  She sells fried green bananas, a business she learned thanks to help from her sister.  Now she has experience.  She does not have a fixed schedule for sales since she works at this business every day.

She needs the loan to buy raw materials like manioc, bananas and oil to make her snacks and to have all the ingredients available to make her products and provide better customers service.

Dinorah’s dream is that her business grows to provide her family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy manioc, bananas and oil.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Alba desde hace unos años tiene un negocio de venta de ropa cerca de la plaza de Mercado del municipio de Rionegro, ella con su negocio se sostiene económicamente ya que su esposo la dejo ya hace un tiempo.

Ella quiete tener mas surtido en su negocios para poder tener mas clientes y ofrecerles mejor variedad, además al incrementar sus ventas su calidad de vida mejorará notablemente.
texts.en:
Alba has had a business of selling clothing for some years near the market plaza in Rionegro.  She supports herself with this business since her husband left her some time ago.

She would like to have a larger selection in her business to have more customers and to be able to offer them a greater variety. Also with the increase in sales her quality of life would improve measurably.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Vecinal 3 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VECINAL 3” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva de la cual la señora Beatriz es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Inicio de comercio de víveres, elaboración de mantas, venta de comida, tejido de gorros y polainas, tejido de guantes, venta de papa, venta de ropa para niños, elaboración de chompa a máquina, venta de ropa y calzados

La señora Beatriz,  indica que es socia de Pro Mujer desde el año 2002 y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida que viene trabajando hace quince años atrás.

El préstamo que sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de víveres para cocinar) que adquirirá de la Ceja y posterior a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito.
texts.en:
The “VECINAL 3” community bank will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as a part of the  Panamericana center. It is made up of ten members and is directed by Beatriz, who is the president. The association members' businesses are varied. Among them, we have: opening a grocery store, making blankets, selling food, knitting hats and gaiters, knitting gloves, selling potatoes, selling children's clothes, making sweaters with machine knitting, selling clothes and shoes. 

Beatriz has been a member of Pro Mujer since 2002 and she joined at the invitation of a developer. At present, she has a business selling food. She has done this for fifteen years. 

She will take out the loan to increase her capital (to buy food to cook). She will do her purchases in La Ceja to later prepare the food and sell it in her locale. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family. She is married and has a son.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes to loans.

loans.use: to buy food to cook.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy assorted sorbets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure, and to rent fields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure and herbicides for his farming.

loans.name: Ana Julieta

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la venta de sorbetes, vive con sus hijos, todos trabajan, el negocio lo inicio hace 2 años y ha sido un negocio rentable, cuenta con clientes quienes la prefieren por la calidad de sus productos.
Actualmente quiere comprar sorbetes, de varios sabores y paletas, esta compra le ayudara para ofrecer a los clientes diversidad de sabores para mantener siempre su preferencia.
Su aspiración es crecer en el negocio, ya que sus ingresos dependen únicamente del volumen de ventas que obtenga a diario.
texts.en:
Ana works selling sorbets.  She lives with her children, and they all work.  She began her business two years ago and it has been a profitable business.  She has customers who choose her for the quality of her products.

She currently wants to purchase sorbets in various flavors and tastes.  This purchase will help her to offer her customers a variety of flavors so that they will always find what they prefer.

Her aspiration is to grow her business, as her income depends solely on her daily sales volume.

loans.use: to buy sorbets in various flavors and tastes.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María, vive con su hijo de 12 años y su esposo,  poseen casa propia, desde hace 13 años María aprendió el oficio de la sastrería, este surgió por iniciativa propia y por el momento ya cuenta con experiencia.
Ella necesita comprar materia prima que es la tela de diferentes marcas y colores, botones de diferentes medidas, broches y ciper, esta inversión le permitirá tener surtido el taller de todos los materiales necesarios para la confección de ropa. 
Su aspiración es que el taller continúe brindando servicio, ya que es un trabajo que a ella le agrada y por lo mismo se esmera para mantenerlo.
texts.en:
María lives with her 12-year-old son and her husband.  They own their house.  María learned tailoring 13 years ago.  The business arose from her own initiative and to date she’s gained experience in it.

She needs to buy raw materials which are fabric in various colors and brands, different sizes of buttons, clasps and zippers.  This investment will make it possible for her to have a good assortment on hand in the shop of all materials needed to make clothes.

Her goal is that the shop continues providing service since it’s work that she enjoys which is why she works so hard to keep it going.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons and clasps for her tailor shop.

loans.name: Patricia Arely

texts.es:
Patricia, vive con su esposo y una hija D. 10 años, ella se dedica a la venta D. lácteos, este negocio lo inicio hace 15 años, desD. entonces se ha encargado D. ofrecer lo mejor en quesos, cuajada y todos los derivados D. la leche, este negocio le ha ayudado para solventar necesidades en su hogar.
