Her great goal and dream is to be able to sell her handicrafts abroad.

loans.use: to buy paint and thread for embroidery.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
María Eugenia tiene 52 años de edad es soltera vive con los seis hijos de treintaitres, treinta, veintiocho,veintiseis,veinteicinco y diecisiete años de edad en ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC 1º de mayo, se encuentra ubicada en la cdla 1º de mayo, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos se dedican a labores comerciales.
	
María se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos y otros animales. Las compras y las ventas de los animales los hace en Ventanas .El crédito lo solicita para comprar más animales para crianza, la comida y vacunas para que los pollos y los demás animales se crien bien y poder venderlos.

El sueño es tener y administrar un negocio que sea rentable. Los desafios al que se enfrenta a diario es la competencia y las enfermedades que les dan a los animales.

En los momentos libres le gusta dedicarse a cuidar las plantas del jardín.
texts.en:
María Eugenia is 52 years old.  She is single, and lives with her six children aged 33, 30, 28, 26, 25, and 16 years old in Ventanas, in the Los Ríos province.

The communal bank "Primero de Mayo" is located in the Primero de May neighborhood which is part of the Ventanas Canton, in the Los Ríos Province.  Its members works in various businesses.
	
María works raising and selling chickens and other animals.  She makes her purchases and sales in Ventanas.  She is requesting the loan to buy more animals to raise, their food, and vaccines so that the chickens and other animals grow well and she can sell them.  

Her dream is to have and manage a profitable business.  The challenges that she faces daily are competition and animal illness.

In her free time, she likes to take care of her garden.

loans.use: to buy more animals to raise, their food, and vaccines.

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.es: Tatiana tiene 27 años, es una mujer alegre y muy trabajadora, es casada pero hasta el momento no tiene hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, y sueña con ser madre pronto, por tanto ella y su esposo trabajan y ahorran lo suficiente para darle lo mejor a su ansiado hijo. Su trabajo consiste en viajar a la ciudad de Trujillo, ciudad conocida como la primera en producir zapatos de cuero y de calidad, ahí compra la cantidad necesaria y de los que le hacen pedidos sus clientes. Sus sistema de venta es a crédito, y cada cierto tiempo, realiza las cobranzas respectivas, de acuerdo a los ingresos de sus asiduos compradores. Por otro lado se dedica también en la venta de cosméticos que sus clientes previamente lo eligen por catálogo y bajo el mismo sistema de pago. Tiene tres años trabajando en ambos negocios, y hasta el momento lo hace sola, pues su esposo trabaja para una entidad del estado. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que viaja cada dos meses y ese recorrido le distrae, por otro lado éste trabajo le permite tener tiempo para dedicarse a su hogar. Este será el primer crédito con MFP, por lo que asegura pagará sus cuotas a tiempo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más ropa para que sus clientes no dejen de estar a la vanguardia de la moda.
texts.en:
Tatiana is twenty-seven-years-old. She is a happy woman and very hardworking. She's married, but at this point does not have any children. She and her husband live in their own house. Tatiana dreams of being a mother soon, so she and her husband are working and saving what they need to give the best to the awaited child.

Tatiana's work involves traveling to Trujillo, a city known for being first in the production of quality leather shoes. She buys as much as she needs and clients put in orders. She sells on credit, and every so often, when her regular clients have income, she collects payments.  She also sells cosmetics that clients pre-order from catalogs, and collects payment as she does with her other products. She's been working in both businesses for three years and thus far has worked by herself. Her husband works for a state entity.

What Tatiana likes about her work is that she travels every two months and enjoys  the trips. The work also allows her time to work in her house. This will be her first loan with MFP, so she assures us that she will make her payments on time. She'll use her loan to buy more clothing for her clients, who are always in the vanguard of style.

loans.use: to buy a wider variety of clothing.

loans.name: Armonia 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Armonia II lo conforman cuatro personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Martha Lorena de 46 años  quien es la coordinadora del grupo. En el 2000 inició vendiendo pozol y tiste luego con las ganancias y los préstamos empezó a realizar tortillas, yoltamal, elotes cocidos, güirilas y hace poco vende chatarra. 

Martha tiene seis hijos de los cuales solo los cuatro menores dependen de ella y son los que le ayudan el negocio. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de chatarra principalmente y un poquito en cada negocio. Su meta principal es mejora las condiciones de su vivienda.

Las otras integrantes son Claudia Vanessa de 27 años quien vende tortillas y frijoles cocidos, Debora Rebeca de 23 años  vende nacatamales, frijoles y tortillas desde hace 2 años ½ y María Teresa de 38 años quien vende tortillas y frijoles, cuajadas y leñas.
texts.en:
The “Armonia (Harmony) II” Group is made up of 4 hard-working and enterprising women, one of whom is Martha Lorena, 46 years old, who is coordinator of the group. In the year 2000 she began selling pozol (a hominy and pork dish) and later, with her earnings and loans, she began to prepare tortillas, tamales, boiled corn-on-the-cob, and other local specialties; then recently, she began selling scrap metal.

Martha has 6 children, of whom 4 minors still depend on her, and are helping out in her business. The loan will be used principally to buy scrap metal and a  little of the remaining funds will be invested in each area of her business. Martha's main goal is to improve the condition of her house.

The other group members are Claudia Vanessa who is 27 years old and sells tortillas and cooked beans; Debora Rebeca, who is 23 and has sold tamales, beans, and tortillas for 2 ½ years now; and Maria Teresa, who is 38 and sells tortillas and beans, cottage cheese, and firewood.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal to recycle.

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.es: Joaquina es socia del Banco Comunal Sumacc Huayta, tiene 45años y 5 hijos, es socia del FINCA Peru hace 7 años. Su negocio es una tienda de Medicina Natural en un Mercado, empezó con un pequeño ambiente donde cosía fustanes, el primer crédito que obtuvo lo utilizó para comparar telas y una remalladora para su taller de costura, ahora ella tiene una tienda de Medicina Natural, le va bien, gracias a las capacitaciones que ha recibido le han ayudado a poder administrar bien su dinero, y hacer empresa, ahora este préstamo que saco lo utilizará para poder comprar jarabes y extractos que es lo que le falta, gracias a Finca ella pudo obtener un terreno y la educación de sus hijos lo que mas le gusta es que ella aprende mucho en su Banco Comunal y eso lo valora mucho, ya que en otras Entidades Financieras solo se ocupan en dar préstamos, ella ahora desea poder tener su tienda en la Selva.
texts.en:
Joaquina is a member of the "Sumacc Huayta" Communal Bank.  She is 45 years old, and has five children.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for seven years.

Her business is a Natural Medicine store in a market.  She started with a small business as a street vendor selling petticoats that she had sewn, and she used her first loan to buy fabric and a sewing machine for her workshop.  Now she has a Natural Medicine store, which is going well for her thanks to the trainings she has received, which have helped her to be able to manager her money well and create her business.

This current loan that she is requesting will be used to buy syrups and extracts that she needs. 

Thanks to Finca, she has been able to buy some land and educated her children.  What she likes most is that she learns a lot from the Communal Bank, and she values this greatly as other financing entities only bother with giving loans.

She would now like to be able to have a store in the town of La Selva.

loans.use: to buy syrups and extracts for her Natural Medicine store.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: La señora Claudia es una cliente antigua de nuestra institución, tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran estudiando, ella se dedica a la venta de comida en una de  las  paradas de minibuses de la zona de Sopocachi, actualmente ella es la única que mantiene su hogar, ya que su pareja no cuenta con un ingreso fijo, el crédito esta destinado a la compra de quintales de arroz, fideo, papa aceite, esto para que pueda disminuir el costo que significa comprar por libras, con lo que ahorrar piensa alquilar una tienda para su negocio y poder atender en cenas y platos especiales. De esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Claudia is a long-time client of our institution. She has two children who attend school, and she works selling food at one of the minibus stops in the Sopocachi neighborhood.  Currently, she is the only person who contributes to her household, as her partner doesn't have a steady income.

This loan will be used to make bulk purchases of rice, noodles, potatoes, and oil, as this is cheaper than buying by the pound.  With the money she saves, she is thinking about renting a store for her business and being able to serve dinner and special dishes.  In this way she could increase her income and quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy food supplies in bulk.

loans.name: Natacha Carmina

texts.es:
Natacha Carmina tiene  37 años de edad es casada vive con el esposo y con los cinco hijos de diecinueve, trece, dieciocho,diecisiete, veintidos años de edad en ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC 1º de mayo, se encuentra ubicada en la cdla 1º de mayo, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos se dedican a labores comerciales.
	
Natacha se dedica a la venta de  licores en especial la venta de cerveza las compras de los licores la realiza en el cerveceria Pilsener y las vende en Ventanas .El crédito lo solicita para comprar más producto, ampliar y realizar algunos arreglos para el local.

El sueño es tener y administrar un negocio parta obtener mayores utilidades. Los desafios al que se enfrenta a diario es la competencia.

En los momentos libres le gusta bailar y escuchar música.
texts.en:
Natacha Carmina is 37 years old.  She is married, and lives with her husband and five children aged 19, 13, 18,16, and 22 in Ventanas in the Los Ríos province.

The "Primero de Mayo" communal bank is located in the Primero de Mayo neighborhood, which is part of the Ventanas Canton in the Los Ríos province.  Its members work in various businesses.
	
Natacha works selling alcoholic beverages, especially beer.  She buys the alcohol from the Pilsener brewery, and sells it in Ventanas.  The loan that she is requesting is to buy more product, to expand and make several repairs to her premises.

Her dream is to have and manage a business that will earn greater profits.  The challenges that she faces daily are the competition.

In her free time, she likes to dance and to listen to music.

loans.use: to buy more product, to expand, and to make several repairs to her premises.

loans.name: Jhoana

texts.es: Jhoana es socia del Banco Comunal Sumacc Huayta, tiene 24 años, su negocio es un taller de Bordados y Artesanía que tiene en su casa, pero antes ella se dedicaba a la compra y venta de ropa, ahora se unió al negocio de su familia y le va muy bien, agradece por todo el apoyo que le dieron cuando ella mas necesitaba y las capacitaciones ayudaron mucho para que pueda progresar, ahora este préstamo lo utilizará en comprar hilos hebillas y caminos de mesa para los bordados, esta ahorrando para poder tener una tienda en el centro.
texts.en:
Jhoana is a member of the "Sumacc Huayta" communal bank.  She is 24 years old, and her business is a workshop in her home where she does embroidery and handicrafts.  Although she previously she worked buying and selling clothes, she has now joined the family business and it's going very well for her.

She is grateful for all the support that has been given to her when she most needed it, and for the trainings which have helped her greatly so that she can progress.  

This current loan will be used to buy thread, buckles, and table runners for embroidering.  

She is saving up to be able to have a store in the town center.

loans.use: to buy thread, buckles and table runners for embroidery.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia  es socia del  Banco Comunal “La Yunguyeñita”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 24 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos.  Tiene grado de instrucción primaria.
Desde hace un ciclo trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/.  500.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invirtió en su negocio de venta de cereales, detergentes, pastas dentales, shampoo, galletas, etc. 
Con éste nuevo préstamo por la suma  de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, comprará cinco cajas de galletas, cinco paquetes de detergentes, pastas dentales y cereales, nos cuenta que su mercadería la compra en Desaguadero y la vende en la ciudad de Moquegua, a veces su esposo le ayuda en el negocio, él trabaja en transportes como chofer.
La señora desea que su negocio crezca y sea más grande para mejorar sus ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones, el ahorro y  sus ganancias
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the  “La Yunguyeñita” community bank in the district and province of Yunguyo, in the Puno department.  She is 24 years old, lives with her husband and has 2 children.  She has a primary school education.
For the last cycle she has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement.  Her first loan was for 500 new soles, money which she invested in her business of selling cereals, detergents, toothpastes, shampoo, crackers, etc..
With this new loan of 500 new soles, she will buy five cases of crackers, five cases of detergent, toothpastes and cereals.  She purchases her merchandise in Desaguadero and sells it in the city of Moquegua.  At times, her husband helps her in her business.  He is employed as a driver.
She wants her business to grow to be larger and this way generate better income.
What she likes about the community bank are the meetings, the savings and her profits.

loans.use: to buy five cases of crackers, five cases of detergent, toothpastes and cereals.

loans.name: 15 Corazones Group

texts.es:
15 mujeres son las integrantes del comité denominado 15 Corazones. Estas mujeres emprendieron este camino, por la gran oportunidad que se les ofrece en la Fundación Paraguaya de otorgarles un credito siendo ellas amas de casa y sobre todo capacitarlas para que sepan utilizar esos recursos. Todas son muy sacrificadas luchan para la estabilidad de sus familias por medio de sus labores.
Una de las miembros es la señora María, ella se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de artículos, desde comestibles hasta prendas, zapatos y otros. Por medio de esto ella logra ayudar un poco con los gastos que diariamente surgen en la casa. Está muy orgullosa de lo que hace, ya que este es un trabajo digno y decoroso.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, prendas y zapatos, ya que mediante esto podrá abastecerse y tener reserva ante posible pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fifteen women make up the committee called “15 Corazones.”  These women started out on this path thanks to the great opportunity Fundación Paraguaya offered them in granting a loan, since they are housewives, but above all, however, training them so that they will know how to best use these resources.  They are all very dedicated and strive for their family’s stability through their work.

One of the members is María.  She sells all types of items from foodstuffs to clothes, shoes and others.  Through this she’s able to help with daily household expenses that arise.  She’s very proud of what she does since this is proper, dignified work.

She requests the loan to buy foodstuffs, clothes and shoes to stock up and have reserve inventory available to meet possible customer requests.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs, clothes and shoes for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Jaime Acisclo

texts.es:
A sus 31 años de edad Jaime sueña con tener su propio negocio, y es por tal motivo que hoy solicita un préstamo, hace 8 años aproximadamente  aprendió a fabricar artesanías en un material llamado mimbre y con éste fabrica todo tipo de muebles, teniendo este conocimiento decidió montar su negocio y debe comprar toda la maquinaria y la materia prima que requiere para realizar los primeros productos y comenzar a vender para generar ingresos y hacer crecer poco a poco su negocio.

Jaime sueña con tener a futuro un gran negocio, que sea reconocido en el sector y que sus clientes lo distingan por la buena calidad y el mejor servicio. Para comenzar con este proceso deberá comprar máquinas como: Sin fin, radial, taladros, soplete, grapadoras, entre otras. Pero el capital es muy alto y el no cuenta con esta suma de dinero. Por lo que espera recibir el crédito y emprender su negocio con la ilusión te tener un mejor futuro y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
At 31 years of age, Jaime dreams of having his own business and because of this he is currently requesting a loan.  About eight years ago he learned how to craft items out of wicker.  He makes all types of furniture.  Having this knowledge, he decided to start his own business for which he needs equipment and raw material to produce his first items and sell them to generate income and grow the business.

Jaime wants to have a large business in the future, recognized in the area, and identified by his customers for the good quality of the products and good service.  To start this process he needs to buy machines such as: circular saw, drill, blowtorch, stapling gun, and others.  The cost of these is very high and he currently does not have this sum of money.  He is wanting to get the loan and be able to start his business with the hope of having a better future and improved quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase machinery and raw materials.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa es socia del Banco Comunal Sunacc Huayta, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 3 años. Luisa es mayorista de papa en el Mercado Las Américas, antes vendía salchipollos en su casa, recuerda que su primer crédito lo utilizó para comprar un carrito para vender salchipollos, ahora ella con su esposo son mayoristas de papa, agradece mucho a Finca, los préstamos que ha recibido le ayudaron a su progreso, ahora invertirá en comprar mas papa para poder enviar a la costa donde esta su esposo, y su mayor anhelo ahora es poder comprar una camioneta para ya no pagar el traslado.
texts.en: Luisa is a member of the community bank Sunacc Huayta.  She is 28 years old and has 2 children.  She has been a member of  FINCA de Peru for 3 years.  Luisa is a wholesaler of potatoes in the Las Americas market.  Before this she used to sell chicken sausages from her home.  She recalls that she used her first loan to purchase a cart for the sale of the sausages.  Currently she and her husband are potato wholesalers.  She is very thankful to FINCA.  The loans that she has received have helped her to progress.  Currently she will invest in the purchase of more potatoes to send to the coast where her husband is located.  He main wish now is to be able to buy a small truck so as not to have to pay for the shipping.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes at wholesale.

loans.name: Adonay Group

texts.es:
El grupo Adonay es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora una de ella es la señora Perla Marina de 39 años es propietaria de una pulpería la cual administra desde hace 2 años. La pulpería la inicio su madre y ella lo continúo junto con su esposo.
Ella tiene dos niños de 8 y 6 años quienes están en primaria e invertirá en productos en especial granos básicos.
Las otras integrantes son Miriam del Carmen de 54 años quien inicio con la costura hace 15 años y luego diversifico su negocio con la venta de bisutería, chinelas y  perfumes; y Skarleth de 23 años vende llantas y baterías para carros.
texts.en:
The Adonay group is made up of three hard-working and entrepreneurial women.  One of them is 39-year-old Perla Marina who owns a grocery store which she has been running for two years.  Her mother started the grocery store and she kept it going together with her husband.

Perla Marina has two children aged 8 and 6 who are in elementary school.  She will invest her loan in buying products for her store, especially basic grains.

The other members of this group are 54-year-old Miriam del Carmen, who started a sewing business 15 years ago and then diversified her business by selling costume jewelry, thongs (flip flops) and perfume; and 23-year-old Skarleth who sells car tires and batteries.

loans.use: to buy basic grains

loans.name: Edison Antonio

texts.es:
Edison Antonio tiene 22 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos vive con los padres en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
 
La VRC 1º de mayo, se encuentra ubicada en la cdla 1º de mayo, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos se dedican a labores comerciales.
	
Edison se dedica a fabricar ladrillos los materiales los compra en el comercial Loaiza y los vende en Ventanas. El crédito lo solicita para comprar material y poder ampliar el negocio para mejorar los ingresos económicos.

El credito le servira para poder mejorar la estabilidad económica por los que esta pasando.

El sueño es poder administrar un fabrica grande para poder tener ingresos buenos. Los desafios al que se enfrenta a diario es la competencia.

En los momentos libres le gusta pasear y ver televisión.
texts.en:
Edison Antonio is 22 years old, single, and doesn't have any children.  He lives with his parents in Ventanas, in Los Ríos province.

The '1º de Mayo' community bank is located in '1º de Mayo' community, in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  The members of the bank work in commercial activities.

Edison makes bricks.  He buys his materials in Comercial Loaiza and sells in Ventanas.  He is requesting this loan to buy materials and expand his business so that he can improve his income.

This loan will help Edison to improve his financial stability.  His dream is to be able to run a large factory so that he can make good income.  The challenge he faces every day is competition.

In his free time, Edison enjoys going out for walks and watching television.

loans.use: to buy material and expand his business

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene  es socia del  Banco Comunal “La Yunguyeñita”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar.  Cuenta con educación secundaria (incompleta).
La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cuatro años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invirtió en su negocio de venta de abarrotes, cereales, detergentes, pastas dentales, golosinas, etc.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevo soles, comprará cincuenta arrobas de avena,  detergentes y otros productos para venderlos en la ciudad de Moquegua.  Trabaja sola  en el negocio, su esposo es transportista.
La señora desea mejorar su casa y comprar más terrenos para dejárselos a sus hijos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y lo que gana el ahorro.
texts.en:
Marlene is a member of the “La Yunguyeñita” community bank which is located in Yunguyo district and province, in Puno department.  She is 34 years old, married, and has two school-age children.  She did not complete her secondary education.

Marlene has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four years.  Her first loan was for 300 soles and she invested that money in her business selling groceries, cereals, detergents, toothpaste, candies, etc.  

With this new loan for 1,500 soles, Marlene will buy fifty 'arrobas' of oats (1 arroba = approx. 25lbs), detergents and other products to sell in the town of Moquegua.  She works alone in her business.  Her husband is a truck driver.

Marlene would like to make improvements to her home and buy more land to leave to her children.

What Marlene likes about her community bank are the meetings and what she makes on her savings.

loans.use: to buy fifty 'arrobas' of oats, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Juana Isabel de 52 años se dedica a la venta de comida en un principio realizaba veinte comidas por encargo pero el muchacho que las llevaba ya no continuo así que decidió poner su fritanga y venta de comida en su casa pero espera dentro de dos meses volver a reanudar la venta de comida por encargo.
El crédito que solicita es de autoestima para la compra de unos medicamentos.
texts.en:
Juana Isabel is 52 years old and sells meals.  She used to make twenty meals a day to order but the boy who delivered her meals stopped working and so she decided to set up a fried food place and sell meals from home.  However, she hopes within two months to be able to start selling meals to order again.

Juana Isabel is requesting this loan for personal use, to buy medicines.

loans.use: to buy medicines

loans.name: Union Progreso Group

texts.es: Carole es integrante D. la Alcancía Comunal “Unión Progreso” la cual está conformado por 11 socios dedicadas a diversas actividades comerciales. Carole  tiene 30 años D. edad y tiene 01 hijo la cual solo depenD. D. ella ya que nos comenta que es madre soltera, actualmente se dedica a la venta D. gelatinas, bebidas donD. su lugar D. venta se centra en una losa deportiva, también se dedica a la venta D. ropa pues D. esa manera genera mayores ganancias para ella y su pequeño, es D. esta manera como Carole ha salido adelante, trabajando arduamente. El deseo D. Carole es D. terminar D. construir su vivienda ya que por el momento solo es D. material pre-fabricado (madera). Con el crédito que solicito piensa invertir en su negocio D. ropa comprando pantalones, polos, casacas y blusas. La Alcancía Comunal “Unión Progreso” están agradecidos por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Carole is a member of the “Unión Progreso” community bank.  This bank has 11 members who are engaged in different commercial activities.  Carole is 30 years old and has one child who is solely dependent on her as she tells us that she is a single mother.  Carole currently sells gelatin desserts and drinks from her sales location which is based on a sports court  She also sells clothes as this way she is able to make more profits for herself and her little one.  This is how Carole has got ahead in life, by working hard.

Carole's wish is to finish re-building her home as it is currently only built from pre-fabricated material (wood).  She plans to invest her loan in her clothes business, buying pants, tops, jackets and blouses.  The members of the "Unión Progreso" community bank are grateful for the help they are being given.

loans.use: to buy pants, tops, jackets and blouses

loans.name: Noemi Elizabeth

texts.es:
Noemi Elizabeth tiene 19 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos vive con los padres en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC 1º de mayo, se encuentra ubicada en la cdla 1º de mayo, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos se dedican a labores comerciales.
	
Noemi se dedica a la venta de lacteos desde hace dos años atras. Los productos los compra y los distribuye en Ventanas. El crédito lo solicita para abastecerse de más producto para poder venderlo y aumentar los ingresos económicos.

El sueño es poderse comprar un carro para poder transportar los productos para lo posterior venderlos. Los desafios al que se enfrenta a diario es la competencia.

En los momentos libres le gusta asistir a los bailes terapias.
texts.en:
Noemi Elizabeth is 19 years old, single and she does not have any children. She lives with her parents in Ventanas, in the Los Ríos province.

The “first of May” (1º de mayo) communal bank is located in the “first of May” (1º de mayo) community. This community is located in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos provinces. The members are involved in commercial activities. 

Noemi has sold dairy products for two years. She buys and distributes these products in Ventanas. The loan she is requesting is for stocking up on more products in order to sell them and increase her income. 

Her dream is to be able to purchase a vehicle in order to transport her products and sell them from the back. The challenge she has daily is her competition. 

In her free time, she likes to go to aerobic dance classes.

loans.use: stock up on more products in order to sell them.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Granito de Mostaza, tiene 37 años y 3 hijos, es socia de FINCA Peru hace mas de 10 años. Rosa tiene un Panificadora, empezó con $2.00, poco a poco junto $10.00 y le dieron de préstamo $50.00 dólares, con ese dinero compró harina para hacer los panes pero en ese entonces era poco lo que tenía, ahora el préstamo que esta solicitando lo utilizará para comprar de harina para la preparación de los panes, ella agradece todo el apoyo que le brindaron para seguir con su negocio, ya que ahora la meta que tiene es poder tener su propio horno, por ahora lo alquila. Le encanta las capacitaciones, y dice que aprendió mucho para poder tener un buen negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the 'Granito de Mostaza' community bank.  She is 37 years old and has three children.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for more than 10 years.  Rosa has a bakery.  She started out with $2.00, gradually added $10.00 and received a loan for $50.00.  With this money, she bought flour for making bread but, back then, she didn't have much at all. 

Rosa will use the loan that she is currently requesting to buy flour for making her bread.  She is grateful for all the support that she has been given to help her continue in her business.  Her goal is to own her own oven because she rents the one that she currently uses.  Rosa enjoys the training sessions and says that she has learned a lot which has enabled her to have a good business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making bread

loans.name: Oscar Napoleon

texts.es: Oscar Antonio de 29 años, tiene su negocio que es brindar el servicio de tricitaxi y venta de pan. Comenzó hace 2 años con su negocio, pues con el paso del tiempo es que ha ido creciendo con ambos negocios, ya que todos los días se dedica como mucho empeño, es así obtiene más clientes nuevos. Trabaja desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche  todos los días. Para poder seguir con su negocio quiere comprar llantas, asientos, cadenas, lona, plásticos entre otros productos para su triciclo. En el futuro quiere seguir adelante con este medio de vida que le proporciona a su familia los ingresos necesarios.
texts.en: Oscar Antonio is 29 years old. He has a business which is providing tricitaxi service and selling bread. He began with his business two years ago and with the passing of time both businesses have been growing since every day he is dedicates himself with a lot of effort. In this way he obtained more new customers. He works from 6 in the morning until 8 at night every day. In order to be able to continue with his business, he wishes to buy wheels, seats, chains, canvas, and plastic, among other products for his tricycle. In the future, he wants to continue ahead with this way of life that provides his family with the necessary income.

loans.use: to purchase wheels, seats, chains, canvas, and plastic, among other products.

loans.name: Rosario Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Rosario del Carmen es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien inicio con la venta de refresco y un taxi negocio que tiene junto a su esposo quien es que maneja el taxi. Ella con el crédito le realizara unas reparaciones al taxi para que siempre este en buen estado y su meta es poder comprar otro taxi.
texts.en:
Rosario del Carmen is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who started selling soft drinks and managing a taxi.  She and her husband both own the taxi and he drives it.

Rosario del Carmen will use her loan to have some repairs carried out on the taxi so that it is always in a good state of repair.  Her goal is to buy another taxi.

loans.use: to repair her taxi

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz es socia del Banco Comunal Granito de Mostaza, tiene 40 años y 2 hijos, es socia del FINCA Peru desde hace 10 años. Luz es propietaria de un Multiservisios, ella es Contadora de profesión y trabajaba en un multiservisios, fue así que vio que era rentable e hizo su propio negocio, recuerda que el primer crédito que obtuvo fue para comprar papeles, agradece mucho porque con lso préstamos que ha recibido le ayudaron a poder hacer crecer su negocio, esta muy orgullosa de todo lo que pudo obtener gracias a su esfuerzo y a todos los que la ayudaron, ahora este préstamo lo utilizará para comprar insumos para las impresoras, papel en rollo, papeles para planos, ahora lo que desea es poder ampliar su negocio.
texts.en: Luz is a member of the Granito de Mostaza Community Bank. She is 40 years old and has two children. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 10 years. Luz is the owner of a multiservice shop (business that offers notary services, accounting, etc). She is an accountant by trade and she worked in a multiservice shop. It was this way that she saw that it was profitable and she started her own business. She remembers that the first loan she obtained was to buy paper. She is very thankful because with those loans that she received she was able to grow her business. She is very proud of everything that she was able to obtain thanks to effort and to all of the people who helped her. Now she will use this loan to buy supplies for the printers, rolls of paper, flat paper. Now what she wants is to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her printers.

loans.name: Santos Francisca

texts.es: Santos Francisca tiene 45 años, su actividad es la una panadería. Tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solamente 3 están bajo su cargo, ella se levanta temprano para empezar su labor y realizar los productos que sus clientes solicitan. Este negocio lo aprendió en una panadería con esfuerzos propios Santos decide empezar su propio negocio. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de mantequilla, queso, maíz y leña.
texts.en:
Santos Francisca is 45 years old and has a bakery.  She has five children, only three of whom are still in her care.  Santos Francisca gets up early to start her work and make the products that her customers request.  She learned this business in another bakery and, through her own efforts, decided to start her own business.  

Santos Francisca is requesting this loan to buy butter, cheese, corn and firewood.

loans.use: to buy butter, cheese, corn and firewood

loans.name: Damiana

texts.es: La Sra. Damiana, tiene dos hijos menores, estudian en primaria, su esposo tiene la actividad de pintor. Desde hace 10 años la señora Damiana  se dedica a la comercialización de, la  venta de maní, papas fritas, plátanos fritos, chipilo, pipocas y haba,  Ella ambula por las calles de la  ciudad de Santa Cruz con  dos canastas llenas de mercadería vende por menor y también por mayor cuando le hacen pedidos. El financiamiento es para terminar de construir su casa ya que les falto dinero para el techado ya que se acerca la época de lluvias,   la Sra. Damiana es una persona muy trabajadora con ganas de superación y están muy agradecidos por la confianza que emprender les da al otorgarle un  crédito.
texts.en:
Damiana has two minor children going to elementary school.  Her husband’s a painter.  For the last ten years Damiana has been selling peanuts, fried potatoes, fried bananas, fried manioc chips, popped corn and lima beans.  She wanders the streets of the city of Santa Cruz with two baskets full of merchandise that she sells at retail and also at wholesale when she gets orders. 

The loan is to finish building her house because she needs money for the roof since the rainy season is approaching.  Damiana is a very hardworking person who very much wants to get ahead.  She is very grateful for the trust that Emprender has placed in her by granting her a loan.

loans.use: to buy plywood to roof her house.

loans.name: Teresa Petita

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 40 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 22, 19 y 5 años, vive con su familia en Otavalo. Teresa se describe como una persona muy trabajadora, alegre, activa y le gusta llevarse con todas las personas.

Trabaja con una hija en su tienda de víveres. Trabaja con Fodemi por años consecutivos el actual crédito que solicita es para abastecer su tienda de víveres y también para la compra de un frigorífico para la carne, inversión que le servirá para aumentar su producción, sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos que le servirá para dar el estudio a sus hijos.

Su sueño es tener un negocio más amplio para poder dar trabajo a personas que necesiten y también seguir dando el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Teresa, 40, is married and has three children who are 22, 19 and 5 years old.  She lives with her family in Otavalo.  Teresa describes herself as a hardworking, cheerful, active person who likes to get along well with everyone.

She works with her daughter in a food store.  She’s been working with Fodemi for consecutive years.  The current loan is to stock her store with foodstuffs and also to buy a refrigerator for the meat.  This investment will help her increase production and sales and thus her income that will help for her children’s education.

Her dream is to have a larger business to employ people who need work and also to continue to provide education for her children.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs and a refrigerator for the meats in her store.

loans.name: Santiago Enrique

texts.es:
Santiago Enrique tiene 55 años de edad es casado tiene un hijo, vive con la esposa y con el hijo de nueve años de edad en ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC 1º de mayo, se encuentra ubicada en la cdla 1º de mayo, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos se dedican a labores comerciales.

Santiago es comerciante compra y vende gallinas criollas desde hace un año y medio Las compras y las ventas las realiza en Ventanas. El crédito lo solicita para comprar más pollos, alimentación y vacunas para poder mantener a los animales en buenas condiciones para poder venderlos y mejorar los ingresos económicos.

El sueño es  comprarse un carro para poder transportar los pollos para salir a vender y lograr reunir dinero para poder darle al hijo para que culmine los estudios. Los desafíos al que se enfrenta a diario es la competencia.

En los momentos libres le gusta pasar con la familia y compartir momentos agradables.
texts.en:
Santiago Enrique, age 55, is married and has one child.  He lives with his wife and nine year old son in Ventanas in the Los Ríos province.

The 1° de Mayo Communal Bank is located in 1º de Mayo community, in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province. The bank's members work in commerce.

Santiago is a merchant; he has been selling Creole hens for a year and a half.  He makes his purchases and his sales in Ventanas.

He is requesting the loan to buy more chickens, feed, and vaccinations in order to maintain the animals in good condition.  He will do this in order to sell them and improve his income.

His dream is to buy a car in order to be able to transport the chickens in order to go sell them.  He also dreams of getting together money for his son so that he can complete his education.  The challenge he faces daily is the competition.

He likes to spend his free time with his family and share enjoyable moments.

loans.use: to buy more chickens, feed, and vaccinations.

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
El comité llamado La Amistad es de la ciudad de Santaní. Está integrado por 13 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Ellas se unieron con el propósito de buscar mayores ingresos para sus familiares e hijos. Desean que tengan una vida mejor a la que ellas tuvieron, es por eso de su lucha diaria.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Elida, ella se dedica a la cría y posterior venta de animales. Nos comenta que mediante esto ella logra mantener y ayudar a su familia. Cuenta que es una tarea no muy fácil, pues requiere de mucho esfuerzo físico, pero pese a esto le gusta mucho lo que hace. Le gustaría poder seguir con este trabajo y poder crecer más.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de animales para la cría como así también para la compra de alimentos para los mismos. Está con las esperanzas puestas en el crédito, pues de tenerlo le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group named "La Amistad" ("Friendship"), is from the city of Santaní.  It has 13 women as members, all of whom are friends and neighbors in this city.  They came together with the plan of looking for better income for their families and children.  They want to be able to give them a better life, and this is why they strive on a daily basis.

One of the members is Señora Elida.  She works raising and then selling animals.  She tells us that this is not an easy task as it requires a lot of physical effort, but in spite of this she really enjoys what she does.  She would like to be able to continue with this work and be able to grow her business further.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of animals to raise, and also to buy feed for them.

She has placed her hope in this loan, as having it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy animals for raising and then selling, and to buy feed for them.

loans.name: Mery Yune

texts.es:
Mery  es socia del  Banco Comunal “La Yunguyeñita”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos.  Cuneta con educación primaria.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años, su préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles lo invirtió en su negocio de venta de abarrotes, cereales, detergentes y jabón.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevo soles comprará mercadería como papa, chuño, maíz, cebada, avena  y otros cereales, la mercadería la compra en Desaguadero, Huacullani y los vende los días domingos en Yunguyo y los martes los vende en la localidad de Juliaca. Trabaja sola en el negocio, su esposo trabaja como transportista en mototaxi.
Su sueño es seguir y mejorar  el negocio para incrementar sus ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones, el ahorro y las ganancias generadas por el ahorro.
texts.en:
Mery is a member of the “La Yunguyeñita” communal bank located in Yunguyo District and Province, Puno Department.  She’s 32 years old, married and has two children.  She completed elementary school.

She’s been collaborating with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years.  Her initial, 300 new sol, loan was invested in her grocery business in cereals, detergent and soap.

She will use her new, 1000 new sol, loan to buy merchandise like potatoes, dehydrated potatoes, corn, barley, oats and other cereals.  She buys her merchandise in Desaguadero and Huacullani and sells it in the Sunday market in Yunguyo and the Tuesday market in Juliaca.  

She works alone in her business; her husband works as a mototaxi driver.  Her dream is to stay in business to improve it and increase her profits.  What she likes about the communal bank is the meetings and the profits from savings.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Gayatri

texts.es: Gayatri tiene 28 años, es una mujer joven, dinámica y muy alegre, es madre soltera de dos niños de 12 y 5 años, es por ello que trabaja a diario para poder brindar lo mejor a sus hijos y a su familia que viven junto a ella. Ella y los suyos viven en casa de sus padres en compañía de sus dos hermanos. El trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de comida, actividad que empieza desde muy temprano, para dirigirse al mercado, lugar donde ocupa un espacio para su respectiva venta, es así que dispone de prepararse y comprar la materia prima indispensable y tener los utensilios limpios para iniciar con la preparación de los alimentos. Ella elabora diversos platillos ente ellos comidad regional, como juanes, tacachos, entre otros. Asimismo menciona que en éste trabajo cuenta con el apoyo de su hermano, y del que ella lo ayuda a él con el pago de sus estudios. le gusta mucho su trabajo, aunque hay veces que luego de cocinar debe lavar los utensilios, perjudicándola el cambio de temperatura. Por tanto solo espera un tiempo no tan largo para poder trabajar en otro rubro. Este será el cuarto crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Con el monto solicitado, comprará materia prima para seguir con la preparación de  comida y brindar mas variedad de platos a sus fieles consumidores.
texts.en: Gayatri is 28 years old. She is a young, dynamic and very happy woman. She is a single mother to two children who are 12 and 5 years old. It is for this that she works daily to be able to provide the best to her children and to her family who live with her. They live in her parents' house along with her two brothers. The work she is dedicated to is selling food, an activity that she starts very early in order to get to the market, a place where she occupies a space for her respective sales. It is this way that she prepares and buys essential ingredients and has clean utensils to begin preparing her dishes. She makes different dishes including regional food such as "juanes," "tacachos," among others. Additionally she mentions that in this work, she has her brother's support and she helps him with paying for his education. She likes her work a lot although there are times when after cooking she should clean utensils, damaged by the temperature change. So she hopes for a time not too far off when she can work in another field. This will be her fourth loan with MFP for which she hopes for the support of each one of you. With the amount requested, she will buy ingredients to continue making food and providing a greater variety of dishes to her faithful customers.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Yolanda Breatriz

texts.es:
La Señora. Yolanda es socia del banco comunal Gualaceñitas, viven por el cantón Gualaceo. Este cantón es muy visitado por su armonía, el encanto y la calidez de una ciudad antigua y moderna, tiene una gastronomía muy variada, su gente no pierden sus tradiciones, se dedican a la elaboración de artesanías y lo más importante son personas cálidas y amables.

La Señora. Yolanda tiene 56 años es divorciada en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos quienes ya son mayores de edad, trabajan y le ayudan económicamente. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Yolanda se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida rápida, tiene su propio negocio y labora de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 
Este es el segundo crédito que realiza nuestra socia en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de productos como pan, carne, salchichas, papas, aceite, servilletas etc. para continuar con su negocio
 
Su sueño es de viajar a Panamá.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Gualaceñitas community bank whose members live in Gualaceo canton.  This canton is very popular with visitors owing to the charm and warmth of a city which is both ancient and modern.  The local cuisine is wide ranging and the local people have not lost their traditions.  They make handicrafts and, most importantly, they are warm and kind people.

Yolanda is 56 years old, divorced, and has two children from her marriage who are grown up, work and help her financially.  She does not own her own home but lives in a rental house.

Yolanda makes and sells fast food.  She has her own business and works from Sunday to Sunday.  She does not work fixed hours.

This is the second loan that our member has requested through her community bank and she will invest it in buying products such as bread, meat, sausages, potatoes, oil, napkins, etc. in order to continue in her business.  Her dream is to travel to Panama.

loans.use: to buy bread, meat, sausages, potatoes, oil, napkins, etc.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia es socia del  Banco Comunal “La Yunguyeñita”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos.  Ella estudió solo la primaria.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace seis ciclos, su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó para incrementar al capital de  su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de casacas.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevo soles, comprará 150 casacas.  La señora nos cuenta que la mercadería  la compra en Desaguadero y  la vende en la ciudad de Lima. Trabaja junto con su esposo.
Su sueño es tener otra casa en Lima y un carro para uso personal.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son  las reuniones en las que comparte con otras socias.
texts.en:
Patricia is a member of the “La Yunguyeñita” communal bank located in Yunguyo District and Province, Puno Department.  She’s 30 years old, married and has two children.  She only completed elementary school.

She’s been collaborating with the Manuela Ramos Movement for six cycles.  Her initial, 500 new sol, loan was used to increase working capital in her business; she sells jackets.

She will use her new, 2000 new sol, loan to buy 150 jackets.  She tells us that she buys her merchandise in Desaguadero and sells it in the city of Lima. She works together with her husband.  Her dream is to have another house in Lima and a car for her personal use.   What she likes about the communal bank is the meetings where she can share with other members.

loans.use: to buy 150 jackets.

loans.name: Luz Adilia

texts.es:
Luz Adilia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 41 años quien es propietaria de un Bar coctelero desde hace 13 años donde trabaja junto a su compañero de vida. Ella es del grupo el cueto y este es un crédito de temporada el cual utilizara para la compra de productos y su meta es llegar a tener un restaurante.
Ella tiene dos hijos de 27años y 7 años respectivamente.
texts.en:
41-year-old Luz Adilia is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman.  She is the owner of a cocktail bar which she has had for 13 years.  She works there together with her life partner.  Luz Adilia is a member of the El Cueto group and this is a seasonal loan which she will use to buy products.  Her goal is to own a restaurant.

Luz Adilia has two children aged 27 and 7.

loans.use: to buy liquor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tires, headlights and to do certain engine repairs.

loans.name: Javier Antonio

texts.es:
Javier Antonio tiene 19 años de edad es casado no tiene hijos, vive con la esposa en en ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC 1º de mayo, se encuentra ubicada en la cdla 1º de mayo, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos se dedican a labores comerciales.

Javier tiene una casa y se dedica a realizar conecciones electricas en Ventanas, el material que necesita para relizar estas instalaciones los compra en Guayaquil. El crédito lo solicita para poder invertir en otro negocio ya que el negocio al que se dedica es de mucho riesgo y lo va ha invertir en compra y venta de calzado para poder obtener mejores utilidades.

El sueño es  comprarse un carro para poder transportar el calzado a los diferentes lugares que visite. Los desafíos al que se enfrenta a diario es la competencia.

En los momentos libres le gusta pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Javier Antonio  is 19 years old. He is married but has no children. He lives with his wife in Ventanas, in the province of Los Rios. The First of May VRC is located in the First of May citadel belonging to Ventanas in the province of Los Rios where people are dedicated to trading work.

Javier has a house and is dedicated to making electrical connections in Ventanas. He buys the material that he needs to make these installations in Guayaquil. The loan he is requesting is to be able to invest in another business since the business he is dedicated to is very risky and he is going to invest in buying and selling footwear in order to be able to obtain better skills.

His dream is to buy himself a car so he can transport the footwear to different places he visits. The challenges he faces daily are the competition. In his free time he likes to spend time with family.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase and sale of shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies to make hammocks.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del  Banco Comunal “La Yunguyeñita”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos.  Estudió hasta 3ro  de educación secundaria.
Su primer préstamo  de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, lo invirtió en su negocio venta de zapatillas, desodorantes, pinzas, etc, estos productos los vende en a ciudad de Arequipa, también se dedica a la crianza de ganados como ovinos y vacunos, trabaja con el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace más de cuatro años.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, comprará semillas de papa, avena, cebada para el sembrío, sus hijos y su esposo se dedican a la chacra y al ganado.
La señora desea tener mejor el negocio y más seguro que le asegure ganancias diarias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo, el ahorro y su ganancia.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the "La Yunguyeñita” community bank which is located in Yunguyo district and province, in Puno department.  She is 30 years old, married, and has two children.  She studied up to the third year of her secondary education.

Rosa's first loan was for 300 soles.  She invested that money in her business selling slippers, deodorants, hairpins, etc.  She sells these products in the town of Arequipa.  She also raises livestock such as sheep and cows.  Rosa has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for more than four years.

Rosa will use this new loan for 500 soles to buy potato seeds, oats and barley to sow.  Her children and her husband work on the farm and raise livestock.

Rosa would like to improve her business and make it more secure so that it guarantees her daily profits.

What Rosa likes about her community bank is the ease of obtaining a loan, the savings and the interest she makes on her savings.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds, oats and barley

loans.name: Maria Karina

texts.es:
La señora Maria es de la ciudad de Santaní, está casada y tiene 3 hijos. Su esposo es encargado de la Estación de servicios. Ella es propietaria de una mini tienda donde vende bebidas, golosinas, comidas rápidas en general.  Comenzó con un pequeño negocio y luego poco a poco y gracias a su sacrificio pudo llegar hasta donde está hoy.
Ella comenta que gracias a este trabajo ella puede mantener la casa y paliar los gastos que diariamente surgen en la casa. Dice que le gustaría seguir con su negocio ya que tiene muchas ventas y eso le genera muy buenos ingresos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, golosinas y otros, con lo cual podrá abastecer su negocio y de esa forma poder tener todo en el caso de que algún cliente le pida algo.
texts.en:
Señora Maria is from the city of Santaní.  She is married and has three children.  She is the proprietor of a mini-store where she sells drinks, candy, and fast food in general.  She began with a small business and later, little by little, grew to where she is today, thanks to her self sacrifice.

She comments that thanks to this work, she can keep up her home and cover the expenses that arise in her home on a daily basis.  She says that she would like to be able to continue with this business as she has good sales and it generates a good income for her.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of drinks, candy and other things, with which she will be able to stock up her business.  In this way, she will have everything in her house for any customer, whatever they need.

loans.use: to buy candy, drinks and other things.

loans.name: María Rosa

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Gualaceñitas, viven por el cantón Gualaceo. Este cantón es muy visitado por su armonía, el encanto y la calidez de una ciudad antigua y moderna, tiene una gastronomía muy variada, su gente no pierden sus tradiciones, se dedican a la elaboración de artesanías y lo más importante son personas cálidas y amables.

Doña María tiene 49 años, es casada y ha concebido 4 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, casados e independientes. Su esposo ha migrado en busca de mejores oportunidades de trabajo, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora María trabaja en su casa, ella se dedica a fabricar calzado, labora todos los días sin un horario fijo y se encuentra en este trabajo hace 30 años.
 
Es su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir para la compra de una máquina para coser calzado que le hace falta.
 
Su sueño es viajar a los Estados Unidos.
texts.en:
María is a member of the “Gualaceñitas” communal bank; they live in Gualaceo Canton.  This canton has many visitors because of its harmony, charm and warmth of a city that is both ancient and modern.  It has a varied cuisine and its residents still keep their traditions.  They are dedicated to crafts making and what’s most important is that they are warm and kind people.

María is 49 years old, married and has four children who are all adults, married and independent.  Her husband has emigrated in search of better work opportunities.  She owns the house she lives in.

María works at home making footwear.  She works every day with no set work schedule and she’s been in business for 30 years.

This is the third loan she’s done with the communal bank and she’s going to invest it in the purchase of a footwear sewing machine she needs.  Her dream is to travel to the United States.

loans.use: to buy a machine to sew footwear.

loans.name: Gabriel Gertrudis

texts.es: Gabriel Gertrudis tiene 58 años, su actividad es un restaurante Bar y Comedor. Comenzó su negocio con un pequeño bar y restaurante que rentaba lo que elevaba los costos de mantenimiento del local, ha sido con la ayuda de los financiamientos  que logro compara un nuevo lugar que es mucho más amplio y llegan muchos clientes. El motivo del crédito es para la compra frutas, verduras, carnes, pollo, vasos, platos, granos básicos, entre otros.
texts.en: Gabriel Gertrudis, 58, has a restaurant called Restaurant/Bar.  He started the business with a small bar and restaurant that he rented which increased operating costs.  With help from the loans he was able to buy a new place that’s much larger and many customers come.  The reason for the loan is to buy fruit, vegetables, meats, chicken, glasses, plates and basic grains, among others.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, meats, chicken, glasses, plates and basic grains, among other things.
